analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i chos gcig las ldog na gzhan la nges par yod pas 'ga' la yang the tshom mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, when one reverses from the property of an entity, one definitely does not have it in another. Thus, one should not doubt any of them.

original: gang zhig 'ga' las kyang ldog par ma nges pa de ni gnyi ga la 'jug par dogs pa nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig 'ga' las kyang ldog par ma nges pa de ni gnyi ga la 'jug par dogs pa nyid kyis the tshom gyi rgyu nyid do //
translated: That which is not ascertained to reverse from anything is the cause of doubt, since it is suspected to engage both.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni des na de yod par dogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni des na de yod par dogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being shown: “since there is suspicion that it exists there.”

original: 'o na ci ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid ldog pa dang ldan par bshad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ltar mnyan par bya ba nyid ldog pa dang ldan par bshad ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the statement “sound is impermanent because it is produced” is said to have a reversal?

original: smras pa ; gang gi phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu yang rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir 'di la ldog pa yod pa'i ldog pa dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ; gang gi phyir 'di 'ga' zhig tu yang rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba de'i phyir 'di la ldog pa yod pa'i ldog pa dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
translated: We say: Because it is not seen to be concomitant with anything else, it is said to have a reversal that is concomitant with that.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: ldog pa'i sgra 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba 'gog pa lhur byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgra 'di ni rjes su 'gro ba mthong ba 'gog pa lhur byed pa yin gyi /
translated: This word “reversal” is focused on the negation of the seen concomitance.

original: ldog pa nges pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the exclusion is definitely expressed.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ldog pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyi ldog pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The exclusion that has the nature of not seeing concomitance is not the probans.

original: 'o na go bar byed pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na go bar byed pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of probans is it that does make known?

original: bshad pa / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas nges par bya ba'i go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas nges par bya ba'i go bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni brjod zin to //
translated: It has been said that the probans that makes known is that which ascertains through the non-apprehension of a cause or through the non-apprehension of a pervader.

original: 'di snyam du de yang rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur ba des na @190b 'phen pa ma yin na snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du de yang rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur ba des na @190b 'phen pa ma yin na snyam na /
translated: But if it is thought that that also would be without concomitance, then it is not a probans.

original: smras pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa nges par bstan par mi nus so //
analyzed: smras pa de yang rjes su 'gro ba med par ldog pa nges par bstan par mi nus so //
translated: It is said that that also, without concomitance, cannot be shown to be the exclusion.

original: 'brel pa yod na ni bsgrub par bya ba log na gtan tshigs ldog la /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod na ni bsgrub par bya ba log na gtan tshigs ldog la /
translated: If there is a relation, then when the probandum is absent, the probans is absent.

original: 'brel pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yang de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: And the relation is based on the reason of identity or origination from that.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po mthon ba yod pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma sgrub par byed pa shes par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i bdag nyid dang rgyu'i dngos po mthon ba yod pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma sgrub par byed pa shes par byed pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that is the proof of the valid cognition whose object is the existence of the high state of being of the nature of that and the cause of that.

original: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'ga' zhig tu rang bzhin na ma 'bras bur mthong na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu rang bzhin na ma 'bras bur mthong na /
translated: If one sees the effect in some cases,

original: 'ga' zhig gis khyab pa dang / 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis khyab pa dang / 'ga' zhig gis 'bras bur rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: one will understand the pervasion in some cases and the effect in some cases.

original: de'i bdag nyid du nges par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul dang / de las byung ba'i tshad ma'i yul gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i yul yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid du nges par byed pa'i tshad ma'i yul dang / de las byung ba'i tshad ma'i yul gang yin pa de nyid rjes su 'gro ba'i yul yin te /
translated: The object of the valid cognition that ascertains the nature of that and the object of the valid cognition that arises from that are the same as the object of the forward pervasion.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i nges pa nyid kyis ldog par nges pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ldog pa nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i nges pa nyid kyis ldog par nges pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ldog pa nges pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the ascertainment of the nature of that and the arising from that, there is no ascertainment of the reverse pervasion without the forward pervasion.

original: des na phan tshun ltos par grub po //
analyzed: des na phan tshun ltos par grub po //
translated: Thus, they are established as mutually dependent.

original: gal te mnyan bya nyid ni nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya nyid ni nyan pa'i rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba yin la /
translated: If what is to be heard is the object of the auditory consciousness,

original: de yang rang gi rnam pa can gyi rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: de yang rang gi rnam pa can gyi rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: isn’t it the cause of that consciousness that has its aspect?

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni don byed pa med de /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni don byed pa med de /
translated: That which is not momentary does not perform a function.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la mnyan par bya ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la mnyan par bya ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the proof of impermanence, what is to be heard is the opposite of the discordant class.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las gzhan la med pa tsam gyis ni de rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can las gzhan la med pa tsam gyis ni de rjes su 'gro ba med pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that something is not a reason by the mere fact of not existing in a subject other than the probandum.

original: des na ldog pa med pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na ldog pa med pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid ni go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: Therefore, because it is not the opposite of that, how could it be said that what is to be heard is not a reason?

original: gal te nyan pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid mnyan bya yin na /
analyzed: gal te nyan pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid mnyan bya yin na /
translated: If what is to be heard is the cause of the auditory consciousness,

original: 'o na ni de sgra tsam la yod bas /
analyzed: 'o na ni de sgra tsam la yod bas /
translated: then it exists as mere sound.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gang gis skad cig ma nyid kyi khyab pa sgrub pa de nyid kyi sgra yang skad cig mar grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma gang gis skad cig ma nyid kyi khyab pa sgrub pa de nyid kyi sgra yang skad cig mar grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the valid knowledge that refutes the pervasion of momentariness establishes that sound is momentary,

original: mnyan bar par bya ba nyid kyis gzhan ci zhig bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: mnyan bar par bya ba nyid kyis gzhan ci zhig bsgrub par bya /
translated: What else is to be established by the fact that it is audible?

original: gang zhig rtags kyi tshul grub pa'i dus su ma grub pa de ni rtags las sgrub pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig rtags kyi tshul grub pa'i dus su ma grub pa de ni rtags las sgrub pa yin na /
translated: If something is established by a reason when it is not established at the time of the establishment of the reason,

original: sgra'i skad cig ma nyid ni mnyan bya'i rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i dus nyid du grub pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i skad cig ma nyid ni mnyan bya'i rjes su 'gro ba grub pa'i dus nyid du grub pa yin te /
translated: then the momentariness of sound is established at the time of the establishment of the pervasion that it is audible,

original: des na mnyan bya la mi ltos so //
analyzed: des na mnyan bya la mi ltos so //
translated: and therefore it does not depend on audibility.

original: de ltar yod pa'i khyab pa grub pa'i dus nyid na sgra skad cig ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yod pa'i khyab pa grub pa'i dus nyid na sgra skad cig ma grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But at the time of the establishment of the pervasion of existence, the momentariness of sound is not established.

original: 'di ltar yod pa'i dngos po ni tshad med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa'i dngos po ni tshad med pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the existence of things is limitless.

original: de'i phyir thun mong gi yul la khyab par 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong gi yul la khyab par 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it pervades the common locus.

original: ji ltar dngos po gcig gi mur thug pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa med par bstan par mi nus pa de ltar ni skad cig ma 'jig pa'i skabs su 'chad par 'gyur @191a * //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po gcig gi mur thug pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa med par bstan par mi nus pa de ltar ni skad cig ma 'jig pa'i skabs su 'chad par 'gyur @191a * //
translated: Just as it is not possible to show that one thing is devoid of the capacity for causal efficiency through succession and simultaneity, in the same way, it will be explained in the section on the momentary destruction of things that it is not possible to show that all things are devoid of the capacity for causal efficiency.

original: ro ; thun mong gi yul can gyi khyab pa sgrub kyang sgra yod par the tshom za ba na /
analyzed: ro ; thun mong gi yul can gyi khyab pa sgrub kyang sgra yod par the tshom za ba na /
translated: The pervasion of the common subject is established, but when there is doubt about the existence of sound,

original: skad cig mar ma grub pa yin la yod par nges pa la ni grub pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig mar ma grub pa yin la yod par nges pa la ni grub pa yin no //
translated: it is not established for one who is certain that it exists.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni sgra tsam la yod pas de nyid du khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni sgra tsam la yod pas de nyid du khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since audibility exists in mere sound, it is to be established as the pervader.

original: de'i phyir mnyan bya 'am gzhan yang rung ste gang zhig thun mong ma yin pa de ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyan bya 'am gzhan yang rung ste gang zhig thun mong ma yin pa de ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, whatever is not common, whether it be audibility or something else, is not the probans.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag rjes su dpag par bya ba grub pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma nyid kyis shes par 'dod pa'i bye brag rjes su dpag par bya ba grub pa'i phyir na /
translated: Because the specific object to be inferred, which is desired to be known, is established by the very valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has no activity.

original: dngos po gcig la brten pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa med par bsgrub pa yang mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la brten pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa med par bsgrub pa yang mi nus te /
translated: It is not possible to establish that something based on a single entity does not perform its function either sequentially or simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir khyab pa 'grub par ga la 'gyur ;
analyzed: de'i phyir khyab pa 'grub par ga la 'gyur ;
translated: Therefore, how can the pervasion be established?

original: gal te nges pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba 'am ldog pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te nges pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba 'am ldog pa yin na /
translated: If the very ascertainment is the forward or counter pervasion,

original: 'o na ni rtags tshul gnyis par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni rtags tshul gnyis par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But then it follows that the reason is the second type of reason,

original: phyogs kyi chos rjes su 'gro ldog dag las gang yang rung ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos rjes su 'gro ldog dag las gang yang rung ba'o zhe na /
translated: because the property of the subject is either positive or negative concomitance.

original: dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
translated: To refute that, the text says, “It is not because of the negation.”

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tshul tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag tshul tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: Positive and negative concomitance are different modes.

original: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa tshad mas nges kyang gzhal bya nyid bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa tshad mas nges kyang gzhal bya nyid bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, although it is ascertained by valid knowledge that the reason exists in things that are similar instances, it is not ascertained that it does not exist in things that are not similar instances, just like the object of knowledge.

original: gang zhig nges kyang ma nges pa gang yin pa de las khyad par gzhan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig nges kyang ma nges pa gang yin pa de las khyad par gzhan nyid yin la /
translated: That which is ascertained and that which is not ascertained are different.

original: khyad par gzhan nyid kyang tshul gzhan yin par bstan pa'i phyir na tshul gcig nyid ma yin no ;
analyzed: khyad par gzhan nyid kyang tshul gzhan yin par bstan pa'i phyir na tshul gcig nyid ma yin no ;
translated: And because a difference is a different mode, they are not the same mode.

original: /'o na kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de dag ni nges pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: /'o na kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de dag ni nges pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: However, as explained earlier, they are to be expressed by the term “ascertained.”

original: nges pa de dag ni gcig gis kyang gyi ga bstan par nus pa'i phyir sgra'i sbyor ba de bsdus te brjod kyi tshul gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa de dag ni gcig gis kyang gyi ga bstan par nus pa'i phyir sgra'i sbyor ba de bsdus te brjod kyi tshul gcig tu byas pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: Because each of these two is able to indicate the other, the application of the term is inclusive, and is not made in a single way.🔽Thus, the master Dignaga says,

original: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos yang na don gyis go ba ste /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos yang na don gyis go ba ste /
translated: Or, by implication,

original: shugs kyis rtogs pa gang yang rung ba gcig rab tu sbyar bas kyang gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: shugs kyis rtogs pa gang yang rung ba gcig rab tu sbyar bas kyang gnyi ga rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: Because the application of either one indicates both.

original: yang na'i sgra ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i skabs ki gzhung la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: yang na'i sgra ni tshad ma kun las btus pa'i skabs ki gzhung la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word or is based on the text of the Compendium of Valid Cognition.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba bsdus pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the application is inclusive,

original: sbyor ba gcig gis brjod pa'i tshul ni tha dad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig gis brjod pa'i tshul ni tha dad pa kho na'o //
translated: Because the way of expressing it by a single application is different.

original: gzhan dag ni med pa yod pa ma yin pa la ni med pa nyid 'jug pa 'gog par byed de //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni med pa yod pa ma yin pa la ni med pa nyid 'jug pa 'gog par byed de //
translated: Others say that nonexistence does not apply to what is nonexistent, and it is refuted.

original: med pa yod pa ma yin pa ni gzhi zhes bya ba gnas gzhi'i nus pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa der mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa yod pa ma yin pa ni gzhi zhes bya ba gnas gzhi'i nus pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras byed pa la sogs pa'i nus pa der mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-existence is not a basis, because it is not tenable that the capacity of a basis and the capacity of an action, etc.🔽are in that.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible.

original: med pa ni nus pa @191b thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni nus pa @191b thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because non-existence is devoid of all capacity.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir pha rol la bzhad gad du smras pa ni re zhig phyugs dag kyang zes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir pha rol la bzhad gad du smras pa ni re zhig phyugs dag kyang zes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to refute this, he says to the opponent, “You are just like a cow,” etc.

original: gang gi tshe gang mi rigs par mthong ba de nyid ki tshe snga ma dang phyi ma dran pa'i nus pa med kyang de la mi gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang mi rigs par mthong ba de nyid ki tshe snga ma dang phyi ma dran pa'i nus pa med kyang de la mi gnas so //
translated: When one sees that something is not tenable, then even without the capacity to remember the former and latter, one does not remain in that.

original: rgol la 'di ni gang kho na'i tshe gzhan 'gog pa de nyid kyi tshe rang nyid spyod par byed do //
analyzed: rgol la 'di ni gang kho na'i tshe gzhan 'gog pa de nyid kyi tshe rang nyid spyod par byed do //
translated: The opponent says, “When you refute others, at that very time you yourself engage in activity.”

original: des na phyugs las kyang phyugs yin te /
analyzed: des na phyugs las kyang phyugs yin te /
translated: Therefore, you are just like a cow,

original: phyugs kyi drung na yang phyugs yin no //
analyzed: phyugs kyi drung na yang phyugs yin no //
translated: and in the presence of a cow, you are a cow.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pa chen po'i yang chen po bla ma dag la smed pa'i phyir 'di las bdag nyid mi shes pa gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pa chen po'i yang chen po bla ma dag la smed pa'i phyir 'di las bdag nyid mi shes pa gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: Since I have asked the great masters, the greatest of the great, such as the Acarya Dignaga, what else is there that I do not know?

original: bdag nyid mi shes pa'i bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mi shes pa'i bya ba ni 'di tsam du zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the activity of not knowing oneself is limited to just this.

original: gzhan 'gog pa'i dus su bdag nyid mi rigs pa byed pa nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan 'gog pa'i dus su bdag nyid mi rigs pa byed pa nyid bstan pa'i don du bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the statement that it is not right for one to do that which is to be stopped by another is:🔽At the time of stopping another, one should not do that which is to be stopped by another.

original: pha rol po 'di ldog pa'i don ston pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig de nyid kyis te /
analyzed: pha rol po 'di ldog pa'i don ston pa rjod par byed pa'i tshig de nyid kyis te /
translated: The meaning of this is that the very words which express the teaching of the meaning of stopping the opponent show that it is not right for one to do that which is to be stopped by another.

original: med pa la med pa nyid mi 'thad do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag gis med pa dngos po ma yin pa la tha snyad mi 'thad par ston cing sgrub cing gzan dag 'gog par byed pa ni gsal bar rgyal po'i chos lugs yin
analyzed: med pa la med pa nyid mi 'thad do zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa dag gis med pa dngos po ma yin pa la tha snyad mi 'thad par ston cing sgrub cing gzan dag 'gog par byed pa ni gsal bar rgyal po'i chos lugs yin
translated: The words “It is not tenable that a non-entity is a non-entity” and so on show that it is not tenable to designate a non-entity, a non-thing, and that it is the royal law that one should stop the opponent by means of the words which teach and establish this.

original: no // khyed kyi rigs pa dang mi rigs pa brtags pa dang mi ldan pa'i tshig 'di ni rgyal po'i chos lugs dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: no // khyed kyi rigs pa dang mi rigs pa brtags pa dang mi ldan pa'i tshig 'di ni rgyal po'i chos lugs dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Your statement, which is not supported by any logical reasoning or scriptural authority, is similar to the legal system of a king.

original: 'di snyam du med pa brjod pa'i tshig gis 'di tha snyad du mi byed do snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du med pa brjod pa'i tshig gis 'di tha snyad du mi byed do snyam na /
translated: If you think, “I do not use the term nonexistence,”

original: smras pa / bdag nyid mi smra na ni gzhan rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: smras pa / bdag nyid mi smra na ni gzhan rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: we reply: If you do not speak, you cannot be understood by others.

original: mi dbang la smra na yang med pa la sgra 'jug pa'i skyon 'di spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: mi dbang la smra na yang med pa la sgra 'jug pa'i skyon 'di spang bar mi nus so //
translated: Even if you speak to the lord of the gods, you cannot avoid the fault of applying the term to what is nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du 'di ni skyon gzhan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ni skyon gzhan te /
translated: In the same way, this is another fault:

original: med pa la gtan tshigs mi 'gog na sgrub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa la gtan tshigs mi 'gog na sgrub pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not refute the reason, you have established the thesis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / med pa las ldog pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ga la yod pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / med pa las ldog pa tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid ga la yod pa'o //
translated: We reply: How can nonexistence have a characteristic that is different from the negation of existence?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dngos po med pa bkag pa nyid dngos po 'ga' zhig tu brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa bkag pa nyid dngos po 'ga' zhig tu brjod pa yin te /
translated: The negation of the absence of an entity is said to be some entity.

original: des na gnyi ga la dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la dgag par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, you cannot avoid both faults.

original: dngos po med pa bkag pa'i phyir na dngos po khas blangs par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa bkag pa'i phyir na dngos po khas blangs par 'gyur na de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because of the negation of non-entity, entity would be accepted, but that is not reasonable.

original: gzhan yang med pa las ldog pa'i ldog pa de nyid khyod ci ltar 'dod ;
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa las ldog pa'i ldog pa de nyid khyod ci ltar 'dod ;
translated: Moreover, how do you assert that negation is the opposite of non-existence?

original: tshig gi sbyor ba gang gis 'dod ce na /
analyzed: tshig gi sbyor ba gang gis 'dod ce na /
translated: By what verbal expression is it asserted?

original: bshad pa / med pa las ldog pa med do zhes ba ba 'dis so //
analyzed: bshad pa / med pa las ldog pa med do zhes ba ba 'dis so //
translated: It is said: “There is no negation of non-existence.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: med pa las ldog pa grub pa ma yin zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: med pa las ldog pa grub pa ma yin zhes smras pa na /
translated: When it is said, “The negation of non-existence is not established,”

original: ldog pa'i ldog pa la med pa 'byung khung du bstan pa yin no //🔽ji ltar ldog pa la ltos nas nus pa med pa'i @192a * //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ldog pa la med pa 'byung khung du bstan pa yin no // ji ltar ldog pa la ltos nas nus pa med pa'i @192a * //
translated: the negation of negation is shown to be the source of non-existence.🔽Just as non-existence is not the source of negation because it is dependent on negation,

original: phyir 'byung khung nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du ldog pa'i ldog pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: phyir 'byung khung nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du ldog pa'i ldog pa la yang yin no //
translated: in the same way, the negation of negation is also so.

original: ldog pa la ni 'byung khung nyid bkag la /
analyzed: ldog pa la ni 'byung khung nyid bkag la /
translated: Negation is refuted as the source of non-existence,

original: ldog pa'i ldog pa la ni 'byung khung nyid du brjod de /
analyzed: ldog pa'i ldog pa la ni 'byung khung nyid du brjod de /
translated: and the negation of negation is described as the source of non-existence.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin pa byas pa yin no //
translated: But that is unreasonable.

original: don 'di nyid lhag dang bcas te tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: don 'di nyid lhag dang bcas te tshigs su bcad pa dag gis bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this point in more detail, he says:

original: ldog pa med pa'i med pa gang yin pa de nyid ni bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa med pa'i med pa gang yin pa de nyid ni bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The non-existence that does not negate is the probandum.

original: de yang dngos po de yod par bstan pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang dngos po de yod par bstan pa yin zhing /
translated: And that is taught to be the existence of that entity.

original: med pa la yang de ni yod par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: med pa la yang de ni yod par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: And it is asserted that it exists in non-existence.🔽The non-existence of an entity is not related to non-existence.

original: dngos po med pa ni med pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa 'di ni blun po ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni med pa dang 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa 'di ni blun po ste /
translated: This is taught by the fool,

original: glen pa'i kun du spyod pa yin no ;
analyzed: glen pa'i kun du spyod pa yin no ;
translated: the conduct of the stupid.

original: gal te de las ldog pa med na dngos po med pa de la gtan tshigs 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de las ldog pa med na dngos po med pa de la gtan tshigs 'jug par bya ste /
translated: If it does not negate that, then the reason is applied to that non-existence.

original: yod par 'dod dam ci zhes rnam par dbye ba sgyur la sbyar te /
analyzed: yod par 'dod dam ci zhes rnam par dbye ba sgyur la sbyar te /
translated: Is it asserted to exist?

original: ldog pa'i sgra ni bral pa'i don brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i sgra ni bral pa'i don brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “negation” expresses the meaning of separation.

original: gal te / yang ldog pa'i sgra dngos po med pa brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te / yang ldog pa'i sgra dngos po med pa brjod na ni /
translated: If the word “negation” expresses non-existence,

original: des na de la ldog pa med na zhes gnas gzhi rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de la ldog pa med na zhes gnas gzhi rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is reasonable to say, “If it does not negate that,” in that context.

original: 'di snyam du dngos po med pa de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa de yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dngos po med pa de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa de yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the reason does not apply to the non-entity,

original: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis smras pa /
translated: the Master says:

original: 'o na ni 'di nyid ni dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'di nyid ni dgag pa yin te /
translated: But this is just a negation,

original: 'di lta ste dngos po bkag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dngos po bkag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: for this is called the negation of an entity.

original: des na 'dod pa med do zhes ci ste 'gog //
analyzed: des na 'dod pa med do zhes ci ste 'gog //
translated: So why do you negate what is not accepted?

original: de ltar gal te sgrub pa de nyid 'gog na dgag pa thob pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gal te sgrub pa de nyid 'gog na dgag pa thob pa yin la /
translated: Thus, if you negate just that affirmation, you obtain a negation.

original: dgag pa 'gog pa yang sgrub pa yin pas med pa la gnyi ga dgag par bya ba ni mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa 'gog pa yang sgrub pa yin pas med pa la gnyi ga dgag par bya ba ni mi nus so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And since the negation of a negation is an affirmation, it is shown that it is impossible to negate both in the case of non-existence.

original: da ni skyon gzhan bsags pa'i phyir //🔽sgrub dang dgag pa ma rtogs pa //
analyzed: da ni skyon gzhan bsags pa'i phyir // sgrub dang dgag pa ma rtogs pa //
translated: Now, in order to show another fault,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “Without understanding affirmation and negation,” and so on.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: dag gi don gyi mtshan nyid sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni med pa la 'jug par mi nus te /
analyzed: dag gi don gyi mtshan nyid sgra las byung ba'i tha snyad ni med pa la 'jug par mi nus te /
translated: The definition of the meaning of words cannot be applied to non-existence.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan med pa ni de la yod pa dang med pa tha snyad bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan med pa ni de la yod pa dang med pa tha snyad bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Because the absence of another is neither existent nor nonexistent in that .

original: dngos po med pa de nyid kyang rang nyid yod pa dang med par tha snyad du mi nus so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa de nyid kyang rang nyid yod pa dang med par tha snyad du mi nus so //
translated: And that very absence of an entity cannot be said to be either existent or nonexistent.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par dbye ba'i mtha' can gyi tshig gis brjod par bya ba dngos po med pa brtag pa 'am brjod par 'gyur pa rnam par dbye ba thams cad ni byed pa po brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par dbye ba'i mtha' can gyi tshig gis brjod par bya ba dngos po med pa brtag pa 'am brjod par 'gyur pa rnam par dbye ba thams cad ni byed pa po brjod par 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan can nyid do //
translated: Because all the divisions that are expressed by a word that ends in a division are the very reason for the desire to express the agent.

original: rnam par dbye ba dang po yang byed pa po'i nus pa khongs su 'dus pa can nyid yin la /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba dang po yang byed pa po'i nus pa khongs su 'dus pa can nyid yin la /
translated: The first division is also included in the power of the agent.

original: drug pa'i yul yang lhag ma bya ba dang byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
analyzed: drug pa'i yul yang lhag ma bya ba dang byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can nyid do //
translated: And the object of the sixth is also the remainder, preceded by action and agent.

original: des @192b na nus pa dang bral pa'i phyir gnas gzhi la sogs pa'i nus pa dang 'brel pa med pas /
analyzed: des @192b na nus pa dang bral pa'i phyir gnas gzhi la sogs pa'i nus pa dang 'brel pa med pas /
translated: Because of that, the absence of power is not related to the power of the basis, etc.

original: dngos po med pa 'di la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi smra ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'di la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i tha snyad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi smra ba nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to apply the terms “affirmation” and “negation” to this non-thing, one would have to accept that one is unable to speak.

original: dngos po med pa la mi smra ba thob pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mi smra ba thob pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only would one have to accept that one is unable to speak about non-things,🔽but also all conventions of negation would be cut off.

original: dgag pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyang chad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: dgag pa'i tha snyad thams cad kyang chad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: 'gal ba'i phyir na re zhig yod pa'i don rnams la ni dgag pa med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir na re zhig yod pa'i don rnams la ni dgag pa med do //
translated: Because of contradiction, negation is not possible for existent objects.

original: gnas gzhi la sogs pa mi 'thad pas dgag pa de ni med pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas gzhi la sogs pa mi 'thad pas dgag pa de ni med pa 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the basis of negation and so on are not tenable, that negation will not apply to non-things.

original: des na rnam pa gzhan gsum pa med pa'i tshul 'dis dgag pa'i don med par te nus par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: des na rnam pa gzhan gsum pa med pa'i tshul 'dis dgag pa'i don med par te nus par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, by this method of there being no third alternative, the object of negation will be nonexistent, that is, impossible.

original: /'di snyam du yod pa nyid yul dang dus la ltos nas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: /'di snyam du yod pa nyid yul dang dus la ltos nas 'gog pa yin te /
translated: One might think that existence is negated in dependence on place and time.

original: dper na bum pa yod pa nyid yul lam dus de na med do zhes dgag pa bzhin no zhes pha rol dogs nas gal te yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs par smos so //🔽ci ltar de yod pa ste dngos po de rnam pa gang gis yod pa'i rnam pa des ni dgag par mi nus la /
analyzed: dper na bum pa yod pa nyid yul lam dus de na med do zhes dgag pa bzhin no zhes pha rol dogs nas gal te yul dus zhes bya ba la sogs par smos so // ci ltar de yod pa ste dngos po de rnam pa gang gis yod pa'i rnam pa des ni dgag par mi nus la /
translated: For example, it is like the negation “the existence of a pot is not in that place or at that time.”🔽In whatever way it exists, that is, in whatever way that entity exists, it cannot be negated in that way.

original: rnam pa gang gis de med pa'i rnam pa des kyang dgag par mi nus pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis de med pa'i rnam pa des kyang dgag par mi nus pa nyid de /
translated: And in whatever way it does not exist, it cannot be negated in that way either.

original: med pa ni gnas gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni gnas gzhi la sogs par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a non-entity has a basis, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po 'am dngos po med pa dgag pa dang 'brel par mi nus la /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir phyi rol gyi dngos po 'am dngos po med pa dgag pa dang 'brel par mi nus la /
translated: Therefore, because an external entity or non-entity cannot be related to a negation,

original: dgag pa byed pa yang yin pa de'i sgra'i don la brten nas 'gro ba 'dir dgag pa dang sgrub pa thams cad 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa byed pa yang yin pa de'i sgra'i don la brten nas 'gro ba 'dir dgag pa dang sgrub pa thams cad 'dod pa yin no //
translated: and because negation is also a linguistic referent, all negations and affirmations are asserted to be based on the meaning of words.

original: sgra'i don ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: sgra'i don ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of a word?

original: dngos dngos med pa brten pa ste //
analyzed: dngos dngos med pa brten pa ste //
translated: It is the basis of entity and non-entity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rten gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rten gang la yod pa'o //
translated: It is the basis of the real and the unreal.

original: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The meaning of the word is threefold.

original: zhes gang 'chad pa yin pa //🔽de phyir dngos dngos med rten can //
analyzed: zhes gang 'chad pa yin pa // de phyir dngos dngos med rten can //
translated: This is what is being explained.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the meaning of the word is the basis of the real and the unreal.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du lhag par nges pa'i phyir sgra'i don kyang phyi rol nyid ma yin nam zhe na phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa sgra'i don yin par su smra /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du lhag par nges pa'i phyir sgra'i don kyang phyi rol nyid ma yin nam zhe na phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa sgra'i don yin par su smra /
translated: If the meaning of the word is definitely external in nature, is it not external? Who says that the meaning of the word is definitely external in nature?

original: 'di ltar gang la phyi rol gyi rten yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la phyi rol gyi rten yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is like this: it does not have an external basis.

original: rten ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rten ni nges pa'o //
translated: The basis is the meaning.

original: phyi rol te phyi'i yul du nges pa ni sgra'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol te phyi'i yul du nges pa ni sgra'i don ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word is not definitely external, an external object.

original: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du ni nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du ni nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not definitely external in nature.

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag dang 'brel ba nyid shing gi tshig gi don yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag dang 'brel ba nyid shing gi tshig gi don yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word is related to negation and affirmation.

original: tha snyad kyi yul gyi don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yul gyi don gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no other meaning of a conventional object.

original: blo'i yul nyid sgra'i don yin te /
analyzed: blo'i yul nyid sgra'i don yin te /
translated: The object of the cognition is the meaning of the word.

original: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag 'brel par rung ba nyid shing la sogs pa'i tshig gi don yin @193a * //🔽gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa dang sgrub pa dag 'brel par rung ba nyid shing la sogs pa'i tshig gi don yin @193a * // gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: The negation and the affirmation are related to the meaning of the word, such as “tree,” and not to anything else.

original: phyi rol shing la sogs pa nyid nges pa ni tshig gi don du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyi rol shing la sogs pa nyid nges pa ni tshig gi don du mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable that the external tree, etc. are the meaning of the word.

original: phyi rol gyi shing ni gang na yod pa der bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa gang la med pa de na yang dag nyid thams cad kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shing ni gang na yod pa der bdag nyid thams cad kyis yod pa gang la med pa de na yang dag nyid thams cad kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The external tree exists where it exists in its entirety, and it does not exist where it does not exist in its entirety.

original: gal te de 'dra bar yod pa nges par byas pa'i tshig gi don yin na /
analyzed: gal te de 'dra bar yod pa nges par byas pa'i tshig gi don yin na /
translated: If the meaning of the word is the ascertainment of the existence of the tree in that way,

original: 'o na ni de la sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan 'brel par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'o na ni de la sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan 'brel par mi 'thad do //
translated: then it is not tenable that the negation or the affirmation is related to it.

original: yod pa'i don gyi khyad par can gyi shing myong bar 'gyur ba ni don dag gam /
analyzed: yod pa'i don gyi khyad par can gyi shing myong bar 'gyur ba ni don dag gam /
translated: The tree, which is the object of the experience of the meaning of the word, does not exist,

original: de bkag pa dang 'brel par nus pa ni med do //
analyzed: de bkag pa dang 'brel par nus pa ni med do //
translated: and it is not possible to relate the negation of that to the meaning of the word.

original: ci ste yang yod pa ma yin par shes pa'i shing sgra'i don yin na /
analyzed: ci ste yang yod pa ma yin par shes pa'i shing sgra'i don yin na /
translated: But if the meaning of the word is the tree that is known to be nonexistent,

original: de yang sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: and it is not suitable to be related to another affirmation or negation.

original: gang zhig nges pas sgrub pa dang dgag pa 'brel par rung ba yod pa dang med pa dag las phyi rol rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig nges pas sgrub pa dang dgag pa 'brel par rung ba yod pa dang med pa dag las phyi rol rnam pa gzhan ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is suitable to be related to an affirmation or negation is either existent or nonexistent, and there is no other kind apart from those two.

original: de'i phyir shing yod do shing med do zhes bya ba'i ngag la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nges pa ni shing gi sgra'i don ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing yod do shing med do zhes bya ba'i ngag la phyi rol gyi rang bzhin nges pa ni shing gi sgra'i don ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in statements such as “The tree exists” and “The tree does not exist,” the ascertained external nature is not the referent of the word tree,

original: de yong ba 'am med par nges par byas pa ni sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'am dgag pa dang 'brel bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yong ba 'am med par nges par byas pa ni sgrub pa ni sgrub pa'am dgag pa dang 'brel bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable to be related to an affirmation or negation that is ascertained as either existent or nonexistent.

original: sgra'i don ni phyir rol la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i don ni phyir rol la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: The referent of the word is not external because

original: phyi rol bdag nyid thams cad kyis log gam gnas kyang sgra'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol bdag nyid thams cad kyis log gam gnas kyang sgra'i don rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: even if the external thing is entirely destroyed or remains, the referent of the word is cognized.

original: gang zhig dgag pa dang sgrub pa ni phyi rol la brten pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de la 'di skad 'dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig dgag pa dang sgrub pa ni phyi rol la brten pa ma yin no zhes zer ba de la 'di skad 'dri bar bya ste /
translated: To those who say that affirmation and negation are not based on external things, this should be said:

original: sgra'i don la brten nas sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ci dgag pa dang sgrub pa phyi rol la mi brten par ma brjod dam /
analyzed: sgra'i don la brten nas sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang dgag pa thams cad 'dod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis ci dgag pa dang sgrub pa phyi rol la mi brten par ma brjod dam /
translated: But by merely saying we accept all affirmations and refutations based on the meaning of the words, is it not implied that affirmations and refutations do not depend on external objects?

original: brjod na yang 'dis ci bya /
analyzed: brjod na yang 'dis ci bya /
translated: If it is implied, then what is the point of saying it?

original: 'o na dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i phyi rol la brten par ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na dgag pa dang sgrub pa'i phyi rol la brten par ci ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how do you understand the statement affirmation and refutation depend on external objects?

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol de 'dra ba ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol de 'dra ba ni med do zhe na /
translated: Because there is no external object that is like that.

original: bden te phyi rol gyi dngos po de 'dra ba ni med do //
analyzed: bden te phyi rol gyi dngos po de 'dra ba ni med do //
translated: True, there is no external object that is like that.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi rten chos can de nyid phyi rol gyi yul dgag pa dang sgrub pa de dag dang 'brel bar snang te mngon no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi rten chos can de nyid phyi rol gyi yul dgag pa dang sgrub pa de dag dang 'brel bar snang te mngon no //
translated: However, the very external basis, the subject, appears, that is, is perceived, to be related to those affirmations and refutations of external objects.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa ma yin pa chos can yin na phyi rol la brten pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel par snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa ma yin pa chos can yin na phyi rol la brten pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel par snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the subject is not ascertained as having an external nature, how could it appear to be related to affirmations and refutations that depend on external objects?

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du nges pa ma yin pa de ni de la brten pa'i sgrub pa 'am dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin du nges pa ma yin pa de ni de la brten pa'i sgrub pa 'am dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If something is not ascertained as the nature of something, then it is not related to the affirmation or negation of that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: shing gi sgra'i don ni phyi rol du nges pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: shing gi sgra'i don ni phyi rol du nges pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of the word tree is not ascertained externally.

original: 'dis ci 'dra ba zhig nges pa de 'dra ba ni phyi rol @193b na med do //
analyzed: 'dis ci 'dra ba zhig nges pa de 'dra ba ni phyi rol @193b na med do //
translated: Whatever is ascertained by this is not external.

original: 'di ltar shing ma yin pa gcig pu las logs pa'i dngos po ni phyi rol na 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar shing ma yin pa gcig pu las logs pa'i dngos po ni phyi rol na 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Thus, there is nothing external that is separate from a mere non-tree.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis ldog pa gcig la ltos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis ldog pa gcig la ltos te /
translated: Imagination, by the power of its own fully ripened habitual tendencies, in dependence on one exclusion,

original: phyi rol gyi shing gi brjod par bya ba ldog pa gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shing gi brjod par bya ba ldog pa gzhan dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs par byed do //
translated: causes the realization of the external tree as the nature related to another exclusion.

original: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba nges pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rang bzhin dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba nges pa med pa'i phyi rol gyi dngos po ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: An external thing that is not ascertained as having such a nature, which is common to both things and non-things, does not exist.

original: de ni gcig tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni gcig tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It would be either existent or nonexistent,

original: yod med thun mong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod med thun mong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: not both existent and nonexistent.

original: des na phyi rol gyi rang bzhin thun mong ba rnam par rtog pa sbrul pa ni gang la brten pa'i sgrub pa dang / dgag pa dag phyi rol dang 'brel pa nges par 'gyur ba sgra'i don yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi rang bzhin thun mong ba rnam par rtog pa sbrul pa ni gang la brten pa'i sgrub pa dang / dgag pa dag phyi rol dang 'brel pa nges par 'gyur ba sgra'i don yin no //
translated: Therefore, the common nature of external things is the referent of words, on the basis of which the affirmation and negation of external things are ascertained.

original: phyi rol la gtan med pa yin yang 'di ni phyir rol gyi shing gi rang bzhin du rnam par rtog pas bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol la gtan med pa yin yang 'di ni phyir rol gyi shing gi rang bzhin du rnam par rtog pas bkod pa yin te /
translated: Even though external things do not exist at all, they are posited as the nature of external trees by conceptualization.

original: des na 'di phyi rol du lhag par zhen par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di phyi rol du lhag par zhen par byas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, external things are conceived to be real.

original: phyi rol de 'dra ba nyid ni ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi ngo bo nges pa ma yin par brjod do //
analyzed: phyi rol de 'dra ba nyid ni ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi ngo bo nges pa ma yin par brjod do //
translated: Since they are not like external things, they are said not to be ascertained as external things.

original: chos can sgra'i don 'di lta bu ni sgra 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir yod do zhes 'dod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: chos can sgra'i don 'di lta bu ni sgra 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir yod do zhes 'dod pa yin gyi /
translated: This referent of the word “external thing” is asserted to exist because the word is used.

original: 'di la tshad ma gzhan brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma gzhan brjod par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not necessary to state a means of valid knowledge in addition to that.

original: shing gi sgras brjod par bya ba ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa chos can 'di 'dra ba med na ni don gzhan dgag pa dang sgrub pa dang / 'brel pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing gi sgras brjod par bya ba ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa chos can 'di 'dra ba med na ni don gzhan dgag pa dang sgrub pa dang / 'brel pa ni mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the word tree were not related to a single exclusion, then it would be impossible to negate or affirm any other object, or to relate it to the subject.

original: gal te yod na 'on na de nyid don dam pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod na 'on na de nyid don dam pa'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If it were, then that very thing would be an ultimate reality.

original: smras pa / tha snyad la brten nas yod do zhes 'dod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / tha snyad la brten nas yod do zhes 'dod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: We reply: We accept that it exists in conventional terms, but not ultimately.

original: 'di ltar nges pa'i chos can 'di blo'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar nges pa'i chos can 'di blo'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: In this way, the ascertained subject is not of the nature of cognition,

original: blo'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: blo'i rnam pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: nor is it of the nature of the aspect of cognition,

original: de dag ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shing ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin du mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not abide as the nature of the exclusion of non-tree.

original: phyi rol yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it external,

original: ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa'i phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no external object related to a single exclusion.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad brten pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad brten pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is based on convention,

original: tha snyad kyi yul du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi yul du sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that it is the nature of what is superimposed as the object of convention.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa yang don du ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa yang don du ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: Conceptual thought is what causes one to perceive one’s own unreal appearances as real.

original: des na sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis shing gi sgra'i don yod pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: des na sgro btags pa'i tshul gyis shing gi sgra'i don yod pa nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word tree is ascertained as existent by the mode of superimposition.

original: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin la ni sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan 'brel pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin la ni sgrub pa 'am dgag pa gzhan 'brel pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in regard to its nature, there is no other proof or refutation that is related to it.

original: gal te phyi rol mi snang ba la sgro btags pa yang dgag par bya ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol mi snang ba la sgro btags pa yang dgag par bya ba ma yin na /
translated: If the superimposition of what does not appear externally is not to be refuted,

original: 'o na sgrub pa dang dgag pa ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: 'o na sgrub pa dang dgag pa ji ltar nges she na /
translated: then how is proof and refutation ascertained?

original: @194a * // bshad pa /
analyzed: @194a * // bshad pa /
translated: In response, it is said:

original: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de gang gi rang bzhin yin par nges pa de dgag par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de gang gi rang bzhin yin par nges pa de dgag par nges pa yin no //
translated: The nature of that superimposition is ascertained as the nature of that which is to be refuted.

original: phyi rol gyi shing gi rang bzhin du yang nges pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi shing gi rang bzhin du yang nges pa yin te /
translated: It is also ascertained as the nature of an external tree.

original: des na sgrub pa dang dgag par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sgrub pa dang dgag par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, proof and refutation are ascertained.

original: de'i phyir blo ma yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo ma yin /
translated: Therefore, it is not the mind.

original: blo'i snang ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba yang ma yin /
translated: It is also not the appearance of the mind.

original: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang ma yin zhing phyi rol yang sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang ma yin zhing phyi rol yang sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang 'brel pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Nor is it the nature of the superimposition, nor is the external object related to the affirmation or negation.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa de ldog pa gcig la brten nas phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa de ldog pa gcig la brten nas phyi rol gyi rang bzhin du nges pa yin la /
translated: However, the external object is ascertained as the nature of the superimposition in dependence on the reversal of the superimposition.

original: phyi rol de la sgrub pa dang dgag pa 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol de la sgrub pa dang dgag pa 'brel pa yin no //
translated: And the external object is related to the affirmation or negation.

original: thag pa'i rdzas sbrul du mos pa la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i 'jug pa ni blo ma yin de'i snang ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: thag pa'i rdzas sbrul du mos pa la sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i 'jug pa ni blo ma yin de'i snang ba ma yin zhing /
translated: The engagement of the affirmation or negation in the substance of the rope, which is imagined to be a snake, is not the awareness, because it is not the appearance of that.

original: sgro btags pa'i sprul la yang rig pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i sprul la yang rig pa ma yin gyi /
translated: And it is not the awareness of the superimposed snake.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin phyi rol du nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin phyi rol du nges pa ma yin no //
translated: However, the nature of the superimposition is not ascertained as external.

original: des na phyi rol tu de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi rol tu de'i rang bzhin du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of the external object.

original: des na shing med do zhes bya ba'i ngag brjod pa na phyi rol gyi shing ni bzlog par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: des na shing med do zhes bya ba'i ngag brjod pa na phyi rol gyi shing ni bzlog par bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, when the statement “The tree does not exist” is uttered, the external tree is what is to be negated,

original: des na dgag pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dgag pa'i bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the action of negation does not exist in the absence of an external tree.

original: blo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blo yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not cognition,

original: sgra'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i don ma yin pa'i phyir dang / myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the meaning of a word and because it is an experience.

original: blo'i snang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the appearance of cognition,

original: de yang myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang myong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that also is an experience.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi don sgrol pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ngag gi don med par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi don sgrol pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ngag gi don med par 'gyur ro zhes gang smras pa de bsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement that the meaning of a word is preceded by the release of the meaning of a sentence is refuted.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba shing ma yin pa rjod pa ldog pa dang 'brel pa phyi rol gtan med pa yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa don btags nas /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba shing ma yin pa rjod pa ldog pa dang 'brel pa phyi rol gtan med pa yod pa dang med pa dang ldan pa don btags nas /
translated: Imagination is a common locus of entity and non-entity, a connection of the exclusion of the expression of non-wood, and it is external, utterly non-existent, and endowed with existence and non-existence.

original: kun du brtags pa'i don de phyi rol gyi yul sgrub pa dang dgag par rlom pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i don de phyi rol gyi yul sgrub pa dang dgag par rlom pa yin no //
translated: Having imputed the meaning of the imagined object, it is the assumption of the establishment and negation of the external object.

original: blo ma yin snang ba ma yin phyi rol ma yin /
analyzed: blo ma yin snang ba ma yin phyi rol ma yin /
translated: It is not cognition, not an appearance, not external,

original: sgro btags pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sgro btags pa yang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: and not even an imputation.

original: 'on kyang sgro btags par gyur pa'i phyi rol yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgro btags par gyur pa'i phyi rol yin no //
translated: However, it is external, which is to say, it is an imputation.

original: ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa'i shing gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa'i shing gi rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ci ltar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: How is this understood?

original: shing ma yin las ldog par rtogs so zhes nyams su myong ba ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: shing ma yin las ldog par rtogs so zhes nyams su myong ba ni med do zhe na /
translated: It is not experienced as “the exclusion of what is not a tree.”

original: de ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: 'on kyang gang nges pa de rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang nges pa de rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin no //
translated: whatever is ascertained is the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag ni nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa dag ni nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspects of object and subject are not ascertained,

original: de dag nges pa myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag nges pa myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their ascertainment is not experienced.

original: des na de dag ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na de dag ni rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they are not the objects of conceptual consciousness,

original: 'on kyang de dag ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni rang rig pa'i mngon sum nyid do //
translated: but rather they are the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yul ma yin te /🔽gang gi phyir rnam par @194b rtog pa'i don ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yul ma yin te / gang gi phyir rnam par @194b rtog pa'i don ni sgra dang 'dres pa yin no //
translated: Also, the particular characteristic is not the object,🔽because the object of conceptual consciousness is mixed with words.

original: sgra dang 'dres pa yang sgra'i bya ba las skyes pa'i blo la snang ba gang yin pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra dang 'dres pa yang sgra'i bya ba las skyes pa'i blo la snang ba gang yin pa yin na /
translated: That which is mixed with words is that which appears to the mind that arises from the activity of words.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgra'i bya ba'i dus su snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgra'i bya ba'i dus su snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The intrinsic identity of a sound does not appear at the time of the sound's activity.

original: rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid du yang nyams su myong bas grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid du yang nyams su myong bas grub pa yin te /
translated: The experience of conceptualization is established as having the nature of ascertaining intrinsic identity.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ston par byed de /
translated: Therefore, conceptualization reveals the intrinsic identity of nonexistence.

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:

original: sgra don 'di dag gzhi mthun nyid //
analyzed: sgra don 'di dag gzhi mthun nyid //
translated: These terms and referents are not the same thing.

original: yod pa min yang zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa min yang zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Although they do not exist, they are said to be there.

original: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po dang med pa thun mong du nges pa yin na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de ni dngos po dang med pa thun mong du nges pa yin na /
translated: The nature of the superimposition is ascertained as common to both things and nonthings.

original: phyi rol mthong ba'i rang bzhin ni gnyi ga'i thun mong ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol mthong ba'i rang bzhin ni gnyi ga'i thun mong ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the external object is not common to both.

original: de'i phyir shing ma yin pa gcig pu las ldog pa dang yod pa dang med pa las mi ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir shing ma yin pa gcig pu las ldog pa dang yod pa dang med pa las mi ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one understands that the exclusion of non-tree is one and the same as the existence of tree, and that it is not the exclusion of both existence and nonexistence,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong du rtogs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: one understands that the exclusion of nonexistence is common to both things and nonthings.

original: gang yang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de gnyi ga'i thun mong ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba yin yang phyi rol du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin de gnyi ga'i thun mong ba dang / mi gsal ba nyid kyi phyi rol dang mi 'dra ba yin yang phyi rol du nges pa yin no //
translated: The nature of the superimposition is common to both, and it is not similar to the external object in being unclear, but it is ascertained as external.

original: snang ba dang sgro btags pa dag rnam pa gzhan gyis 'dra bar ni mi 'thad do /
analyzed: snang ba dang sgro btags pa dag rnam pa gzhan gyis 'dra bar ni mi 'thad do /
translated: It is not tenable that appearances and superimpositions are similar in any other way.

original: phyi rol de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong pa'i rtogs pa na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong par sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong pa'i rtogs pa na yang de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong par sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: When the external object is realized to be empty of being the nature of that, it is superimposed as empty of being the nature of that.

original: des na phyi rol dang sgro btags pa dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong bar 'dra ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na phyi rol dang sgro btags pa dag de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas stong bar 'dra ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the external object and the superimposition are similar in being empty of being the nature of that,

original: sgro btags par bya ba'i phyi rol nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sgro btags par bya ba'i phyi rol nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the external object that is the basis of the superimposition is ascertained.

original: de'i phyir yang shing ma yin pa las ldog pa nges so zhes khong du chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang shing ma yin pa las ldog pa nges so zhes khong du chud pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is understood that the exclusion of non-tree is ascertained.

original: gzhan yang gal te gzhan las ldog pa'i don sgro mi 'dogs na gzhan med pa gang gis rtogs /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gzhan las ldog pa'i don sgro mi 'dogs na gzhan med pa gang gis rtogs /
translated: Moreover, if the meaning of exclusion from other is not superimposed, how is the absence of other conceived?

original: me'i ngo bo nyid nges pa rtogs pa na de las gzhan med pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: me'i ngo bo nyid nges pa rtogs pa na de las gzhan med pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: When the nature of fire is ascertained, the absence of anything other than that is realized.

original: gzhan la sa ldog pa rtogs pa med na /
analyzed: gzhan la sa ldog pa rtogs pa med na /
translated: If the realization of the opposite of other is not realized,

original: gcig tu nges par brtag par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par brtag par mi nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that it cannot be ascertained as one?

original: de'i phyir nges pa'i rang bzhin sgro 'dogs pa nyid ni gzhan ldog pa rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nges pa'i rang bzhin sgro 'dogs pa nyid ni gzhan ldog pa rtogs pa nang du 'dus pa yin no ;
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the nature of fire is included in the realization of the opposite of other.

original: / des na bdag gis ldog pa rtogs so snyam du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ni gzhan ldog pa sgro 'dogs par mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: / des na bdag gis ldog pa rtogs so snyam du nyams su myong ba'i phyir ni gzhan ldog pa sgro 'dogs par mi brjod kyi /
translated: Thus, because of the experience of thinking “I realize the opposite of other,” the opposite of other is not said to be superimposition.

original: 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba dang / phyi rol nyid dang / nges pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i shugs kyis yin no //🔽dper na bdag gis spyi mthong ngo snyam du myong @195a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po dang dngos po med pa thun mong ba dang / phyi rol nyid dang / nges pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i shugs kyis yin no // dper na bdag gis spyi mthong ngo snyam du myong @195a * //
translated: However, the commonality of entity and nonentity, the external itself, and the nature of ascertainment are by the power of ascertainment.

original: ba med mod kyi /
analyzed: ba med mod kyi /
translated: For example, there is no experience of thinking “I see the universal.”

original: de lta na yang spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong pa'i shugs kyis spyi mthong ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis brtas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa nyams su myong pa'i shugs kyis spyi mthong ba yin no zhes gzhan gyis brtas pa bzhin no //
translated: Nevertheless, others claim that the perception of universals is by the force of the experience of consciousness that has a universal aspect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i don sgro btags pa yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i don sgro btags pa yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the superimposition of the meaning of a conceptual consciousness is not of the nature of an affirmation.

original: 'on kyang ldog pa'i rang bzhi yin no ;
analyzed: 'on kyang ldog pa'i rang bzhi yin no ;
translated: However, it is of the nature of an exclusion.

original: / gzhan ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa ma bzung na ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gzhan ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pa ma bzung na ni sngar bshad pa'i rnam pa gsum gyi nges pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not apprehend the ultimate nature of an exclusion, then the ascertainment of the three modes explained earlier is not tenable.

original: gzhan yang ldog pa gtsor gyur pa sgro btags pa'i don de yang gzhan sel par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ldog pa gtsor gyur pa sgro btags pa'i don de yang gzhan sel par brjod pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, the meaning of a superimposition that is a principal exclusion is also said to be an other-exclusion.

original: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhan ldog pa de nges pa na yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyi gzhan ldog pa de nges pa na yang /
translated: And because the nature of a superimposition is an exclusion of other, when that is ascertained,

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi don rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i phyi rol gyi don rtogs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: an external object that is an exclusion of other is realized.

original: rnam par rtog pa sgro btags kyi gzhan ldog pas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sgro btags kyi gzhan ldog pas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It engages by way of the exclusion of other, which is a superimposition.

original: phyi rol dag la ni gzhan ldog pa cam zhig rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol dag la ni gzhan ldog pa cam zhig rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: With regard to external objects, the exclusion of other is understood merely as an exclusion.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as an own characteristic.

original: des na sgro btags kyi gzhan ldog pa ni dngos su yin la /
analyzed: des na sgro btags kyi gzhan ldog pa ni dngos su yin la /
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of other, which is a superimposition, is the direct object.

original: phyi rol gyi gzhan ldog pa ni shugs kyis 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzhan ldog pa ni shugs kyis 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The exclusion of other of external objects is the indirect object.

original: med par dgag pa'i gzhan sel ba don gyi shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de nye bar bzung nas ni /
analyzed: med par dgag pa'i gzhan sel ba don gyi shugs kyis rnam par rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur ba de nye bar bzung nas ni /
translated: The exclusion of other, which is an internal negation, becomes the object of a conceptual consciousness by the indirect force of the object.🔽Having taken that as the basis, it is said:

original: ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid med phyir //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid med phyir //
translated: Because the exclusion of other does not have a nature,

original: gnas dang mi gnas rtogs pa med //
analyzed: gnas dang mi gnas rtogs pa med //
translated: There is no apprehension of its being or not being a basis.

original: ces bshad la /
analyzed: ces bshad la /
translated: And:

original: sgro btags pa'i gzhan sel ba dngos su rnam par rtog pa'i don nye bar bzung nas ni //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i gzhan sel ba dngos su rnam par rtog pa'i don nye bar bzung nas ni //
translated: Having taken as the object the exclusion of other, which is a superimposition,

original: spyi yi blo yang bslad pa yin //
analyzed: spyi yi blo yang bslad pa yin //
translated: The cognition of universals is also mistaken.

original: des na sun dbyung ba yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: des na sun dbyung ba yang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, there is no refutation.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan sel pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan sel pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: Thus conceptual consciousnesses have as their object the exclusion of other.

original: sgra sel par sbyor pa'i dus na ni nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don brjod par bya ba nyid du sbyar bar bya ste ;
analyzed: sgra sel par sbyor pa'i dus na ni nges pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i don brjod par bya ba nyid du sbyar bar bya ste ;
translated: When a term is applied to exclude something, it is applied to express the meaning of a definite conception.

original: gzhan du na nges pa'i don brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na nges pa'i don brjod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not express a definite meaning.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don brjod par bya ba nyid byed na /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul gyi don brjod par bya ba nyid byed na /
translated: Therefore, when the object of conception is expressed,

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba sgra rnams kyi brjod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: since it is of the nature of a definite object, the exclusion of other is the object of expression of terms.

original: gzhan sel ba gzhan dang bral ba la sgra 'jug pa yin no zhes gnas so ;
analyzed: gzhan sel ba gzhan dang bral ba la sgra 'jug pa yin no zhes gnas so ;
translated: Thus, the term is applied to the exclusion of other, the absence of other.

original: / gdon mi za bar sgro brtags pa ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa chos can du gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gdon mi za bar sgro brtags pa ldog pa gcig dang 'brel pa chos can du gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One must certainly take as the subject the superimposition of the term in relation to the exclusion of one thing.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi'i don rnam pa gnas pa de 'dra ba'i sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid chos can du bzung na ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi'i don rnam pa gnas pa de 'dra ba'i sgra'i don gyi mtshan nyid chos can du bzung na ni /
translated: If that is so, if the external object that is the basis of the aspect is taken as the subject that has the characteristic of the meaning of the term,

original: de'i tshe chos gcig sgrub na chos thams cad sgrub par thal la /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos gcig sgrub na chos thams cad sgrub par thal la /
translated: then it follows that when one property is established, all properties are established.

original: 'gog pa na @195b 'ang rang bzhin thams cad 'gog par thal lo //
analyzed: 'gog pa na @195b 'ang rang bzhin thams cad 'gog par thal lo //
translated: and when you refute one, it follows that you refute all natures.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is this.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po khyad par ji snyed dang ldan pa'i khyad par de thams cad ni gcig med na yang thams cad ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po khyad par ji snyed dang ldan pa'i khyad par de thams cad ni gcig med na yang thams cad ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever specific features external things have, all of those features will be eliminated if even one of them is absent.

original: chos 'ga' zhig ni rnam par gnas la chos 'ga' zhig ldog par ni phyi rol gyi yul rtogs pa ma yin no //
