analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig ni rnam par gnas la chos 'ga' zhig ldog par ni phyi rol gyi yul rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that some features of external objects are ascertained and some are not.

original: gal te yang ji ltar phyi rol rtogs pa de ltar blos sgra'i yul chos can du bzung ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yang ji ltar phyi rol rtogs pa de ltar blos sgra'i yul chos can du bzung ba ni /
translated: If the object of the word is apprehended by the mind in the same way that external objects are apprehended,

original: de'i tshe bum pa'i rang bzhin dang chu 'dzin par nus pa dang / rtag pa dang ma byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa'i chos bzhi po rnams kyi sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bum pa'i rang bzhin dang chu 'dzin par nus pa dang / rtag pa dang ma byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa'i chos bzhi po rnams kyi sgrub pa dang dgag pa dang grub pa dang bde ba gcig par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that the four properties of the subject, the pot, would be established, refuted, both established and refuted, and neither established nor refuted, all at the same time.

original: phyi rol ni ji snyed cig bde thams cad ldog pa 'am /
analyzed: phyi rol ni ji snyed cig bde thams cad ldog pa 'am /
translated: If external objects are ascertained in their entirety,

original: yod par khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: yod par khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: and they are not different in existence.

original: 'ga' zhig ni sgrub la gzhan dag ni 'gog pas tha dad par ni rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni sgrub la gzhan dag ni 'gog pas tha dad par ni rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But some are established and others are refuted, and so they are understood to be different.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol dang mi mthun pa'i sgra'i yul chos can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol dang mi mthun pa'i sgra'i yul chos can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the subject is a sound object that is not like external objects.

original: 'di snyam du chos de dag gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du chos de dag gcig tu rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that those properties are understood as one.

original: des na 'ga' zhig ni sgrub la gzhan dag ni 'gog pa la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig ni sgrub la gzhan dag ni 'gog pa la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in some being established and others being refuted.

original: dper na lha sbyin sgrub la mchod sbyin 'gog pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin sgrub la mchod sbyin 'gog pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, Devadatta is established and Yajna is refuted.

original: gal te de ltar tha dad par khas len na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tha dad par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that they are different,

original: gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa dag gi bkag pa dang ni sgrub pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du gyur pa dag gi bkag pa dang ni sgrub pa bzhin du /
translated: then, just as the refutation and the establishment are different,

original: chos kyi yul sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dag / chos can gcig la 'du par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos kyi yul sgrub pa dang ni dgag pa dag / chos can gcig la 'du par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the establishment and the refutation of the property of the subject would not be combined in one subject.

original: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gcig la 'du par ni rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gcig la 'du par ni rtogs pa yin te /
translated: But it is understood that the establishment and the refutation are combined in one.

original: bum pa ni sa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: bum pa ni sa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: A pot is of the nature of earth,🔽but it is not fire.

original: gser gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bum par gyur pa nyid kyi gser gyi rang bzhin 'gog pa yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no zhes bum par gyur pa nyid kyi gser gyi rang bzhin 'gog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of gold that is a pot is refuted.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i sgra'i don gyi yul ni chos can du mi bzung se /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol gyi don ci 'dra ba de 'dra ba'i sgra'i don gyi yul ni chos can du mi bzung se /
translated: Therefore, the object of the meaning of a word that is similar to an external object should not be taken as the subject.

original: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i skyon du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the previously explained error would ensue.

original: 'o na khyod kyi sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin la chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ci ltar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin la chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ci ltar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Well, how could the convention of subject and object apply to the nature that is the superimposition of yours?

original: sgro btags pa'i don yang dag pa'i rtogs pas res 'ga' mi gnod pa yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don yang dag pa'i rtogs pas res 'ga' mi gnod pa yang ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how could the object of superimposition be sometimes not harmed by correct knowledge?

original: rang gi 'dod pas gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas gnyi ga yang bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach both of these, he says:

original: bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa 'ba' zhig gis phyi rol du btags pa'i chos can gcig gi dbang du byed te /
analyzed: bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa 'ba' zhig gis phyi rol du btags pa'i chos can gcig gi dbang du byed te /
translated: By the mere exclusion of non-pot, the super-imposed subject is taken as the basis.

original: tha snyad ci ltar blos bstan pa zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tha snyad ci ltar blos bstan pa zhes 'brel to //
translated: The convention is whatever is indicated by the mind.

original: @196a * // ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa'i chos can de lta bu'i phyi rol ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @196a * // ldog pa gcig gi mthar thug pa'i chos can de lta bu'i phyi rol ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no external object whatsoever that is the locus of a single negation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos gcig sgrub pa na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos gcig sgrub pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one property is established,

original: de sten te de dang 'brel pa lta bu'i chos can de'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba de nyid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de sten te de dang 'brel pa lta bu'i chos can de'i dbang du byas te zhes bya ba de nyid dang sbyar ro //
translated: the locus of that property is the same as that which is relied upon, that is, that with which it is related.

original: lta bu'i sgra smos pa ni don dam bar tha dad pa sngon du song ba can gyi ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bu'i sgra smos pa ni don dam bar tha dad pa sngon du song ba can gyi ldan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “for example” is used because there is no inherence that is based on ultimate difference.

original: gcig las log pa 'ba' zhig tu btags pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mang po las ldog par brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig las log pa 'ba' zhig tu btags pa gang yin pa de nyid ni mang po las ldog par brtags pa yin te /
translated: That which is designated as the negation of one is designated as the negation of many.

original: des na de ni chos can du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni chos can du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is the locus of the property.

original: de nyid na sna tshogs chos kyi gzhir gyur pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid na sna tshogs chos kyi gzhir gyur pa zhes smos so //
translated: That is why it is said to be the basis of the various properties.

original: chos gzhan rnams ni btang snyoms te yongs su ma bzung ba'o ;
analyzed: chos gzhan rnams ni btang snyoms te yongs su ma bzung ba'o ;
translated: Other properties are indifferent, that is, they are not accepted.

original: / sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod pa na chos gzhan 'brel par rung ba dag las yang btang snyoms su 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: / sgra mi rtag go zhes brjod pa na chos gzhan 'brel par rung ba dag las yang btang snyoms su 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: When it is said that “sound is impermanent,” one becomes indifferent to other phenomena that are suitable to be related.

original: 'di gzhan du gyur tam ma gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di gzhan du gyur tam ma gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not this is transformed into something else,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du re zhig gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du re zhig gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba ni btang snyoms so //
translated: it is impermanent. This is indifference.

original: ma byas pa ma yin no zhes chos 'ga' zhig 'gog na de'i dben pa ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa ma yin no zhes chos 'ga' zhig 'gog na de'i dben pa ste /
translated: When one refutes some phenomenon, saying “it is not unproduced,” its absence is

original: des stong par gyur pa'i chos can zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: des stong par gyur pa'i chos can zhes 'brel to //
translated: related to it, as in “the phenomenon that is empty of that.”

original: 'dir yang lta bu'i sgra lta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang lta bu'i sgra lta bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the word “like” should be supplied.

original: gang gi phyir sgra dang gzhi gcig pa'i ma byas pa nyid rjes su brjod nas 'gog pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra dang gzhi gcig pa'i ma byas pa nyid rjes su brjod nas 'gog pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the unproduced that is the same basis as sound is refuted by implication,

original: sngar rang bzhin de dang ldan pa phyis 'gag pa dang 'brel pa dben pa lta bur snang bar ni chos can yin no //
analyzed: sngar rang bzhin de dang ldan pa phyis 'gag pa dang 'brel pa dben pa lta bur snang bar ni chos can yin no //
translated: the phenomenon that is related to its cessation, having previously had that nature, is the subject.🔽It appears as if it were absent,

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos dag la ni ltos par bya ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos dag la ni ltos par bya ste /
translated: but it should be related to other phenomena.

original: ma byas pa nyid 'gog pa na byas pa nyid la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid 'gog pa na byas pa nyid la ltos pa yin no //
translated: When one refutes non-production, one does rely on production.

original: sgrub pa'i dus su ni gcig bsgrub na chos gzhan la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus su ni gcig bsgrub na chos gzhan la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: At the time of proof, one does not necessarily rely on another phenomenon in order to prove one phenomenon.

original: 'gog pa la ni dgag par bya ba dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan las ltos par bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la ni dgag par bya ba dang 'gal ba'i chos gzhan las ltos par bya ba kho na'o //
translated: But at the time of refutation, one must rely on another phenomenon that is incompatible with what is to be refuted.

original: gang na btang snyoms zhes 'don pa der ni dgag par bya ba gzhan btang snyoms su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang na btang snyoms zhes 'don pa der ni dgag par bya ba gzhan btang snyoms su gyur pa zhes bya ba'i don du sbyar ro //
translated: Where the text reads “equanimity,” the meaning is that one should be indifferent to other objects of refutation.

original: re zhig chos gcig ni dgag par bya ba yin la /🔽gzhan dag ni btang snyoms su bya ba 'am /
analyzed: re zhig chos gcig ni dgag par bya ba yin la / gzhan dag ni btang snyoms su bya ba 'am /
translated: One phenomenon is to be refuted.🔽One should be indifferent to other phenomena,

original: sgrub pa la ltos par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ltos par bya ba nyid do //
translated: or one should rely on them in order to prove something.🔽This is how we use the conventions of subject and object.

original: kho bo cag gi chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad de lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes don gcig bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gi chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad de lta bur gyur pa yin no zhes don gcig bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: da ni chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad sgro btags pa la bden pa'i shes pas gnod pa med do zhes bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
analyzed: da ni chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad sgro btags pa la bden pa'i shes pas gnod pa med do zhes bstan pa'i don du smras pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the conventions of phenomena and subjects are not undermined by a cognition of reality, it is said:

original: ci ltar chos can gcig la brten nas don rnams kyi tha snyad rtogs par bya ba de bzhin du /🔽tha snyad byed pa pos kyang tha @196b snyad de ma brtags par te /
analyzed: ci ltar chos can gcig la brten nas don rnams kyi tha snyad rtogs par bya ba de bzhin du / tha snyad byed pa pos kyang tha @196b snyad de ma brtags par te /
translated: Just as objects are understood through conventions based on a single subject,🔽so too the user of conventions accepts them without analyzing them,

original: rnam par ma phyed par khas len pa ste rtogs bas so //
analyzed: rnam par ma phyed par khas len pa ste rtogs bas so //
translated: that is, without distinguishing them.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid rnam par 'byed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid rnam par 'byed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Conceptualization itself is what distinguishes,

original: de yang rnam par bslad par gyur pa'i phyir gang gis yul rnam par dbye bar bya /
analyzed: de yang rnam par bslad par gyur pa'i phyir gang gis yul rnam par dbye bar bya /
translated: but since it is itself distorted, how can it distinguish objects?

original: 'di snyam du ci ltar smig rgyu la chur zhen pa ni ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du ci ltar smig rgyu la chur zhen pa ni ;
translated: This is what is meant: Just as the conception of water in a mirage

original: rang nyid skyes pa'i bden pa'i shes pas bzlog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rang nyid skyes pa'i bden pa'i shes pas bzlog pa de bzhin du /
translated: is reversed by the cognition of reality that arises in its place,

original: chos dang chos can du sgro btags pa 'di yang yin no zhes dgos pa la /
analyzed: chos dang chos can du sgro btags pa 'di yang yin no zhes dgos pa la /
translated: so too is the superimposition of phenomena and subjects.

original: tha dad don rten zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha dad don rten zhes smos so //
translated: The expression “based on a different object” is used.

original: tha snyad gang la tha dad pa'i don phan tshun ldog pa'i rten yod pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad gang la tha dad pa'i don phan tshun ldog pa'i rten yod pa'o //
translated: A convention is based on a different object when it is based on the mutual exclusion of two things.

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pa ni chu ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pa ni chu ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of water in a mirage is not based on the exclusion of non-water.

original: des na gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a case of a convention.

original: chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ni phan tshun ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad ni phan tshun ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The convention of a property and a property-possessor is based on mutual exclusion, and therefore, it is not a case of a mistake.

original: gal te sgro 'dogs pa 'di res 'ga' ba yin na ni gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te sgro 'dogs pa 'di res 'ga' ba yin na ni gnod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If this superimposition were occasional, it would be a case of a mistake.

original: res 'ga' ba ni ma yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba ni ma yin no zhes rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: But it is not occasional. In order to demonstrate this by another method, it is said:

original: 'di ni thog ma med pa yang yin la bag chags kyang yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni thog ma med pa yang yin la bag chags kyang yin te /
translated: This is beginningless and is also a latent impression.

original: rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa bskyed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: It is the capacity to generate a conception.

original: de las byung ba'i chos dang chos can gyi don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i chos dang chos can gyi don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object of a property and a property-possessor that arises from that.

original: 'jig rten don te 'jig rten ba'i rab tu grags pa'i don de la tha snyad du byed pa pos gnod pa min te /
analyzed: 'jig rten don te 'jig rten ba'i rab tu grags pa'i don de la tha snyad du byed pa pos gnod pa min te /
translated: The world is not harmed by the conventional usage of the term “agent” in the sense of the world’s well-known usage, for the sake of the world.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa bden pa dang ldan ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa bden pa dang ldan ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the cognition that harms is not endowed with truth.

original: des na res 'ga' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi gnod do //
analyzed: des na res 'ga' ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir mi gnod do //
translated: Therefore, since it is not occasional, it does not harm.

original: da ni ci ltar tha dad pa la brten pa dang / bslad pa ci ltar mi ldog par de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni ci ltar tha dad pa la brten pa dang / bslad pa ci ltar mi ldog par de ltar bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how it is based on difference and how the adulteration is not averted, he says:

original: chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa dang / bgo ba la sogs pa snam bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang la med pa'i don de ni gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa de'i 'bras bu gang la yod pa dang / bgo ba la sogs pa snam bu'i bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu gang la med pa'i don de ni gcig pa yin no //
translated: The object that is the effect of the apprehension of water, etc., and the object that is not the effect of the accomplishment of cloth, etc., are the same.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de rgyu ma yin pa dag dang / de bzhin du bgo ba la sogs pa byed pa'i nus pa med pas de ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ldog pa'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid kyis de rgyu ma yin pa dag dang / de bzhin du bgo ba la sogs pa byed pa'i nus pa med pas de ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ldog pa'o //
translated: “From that” means that, by the very fact that it is the cause of the apprehension of water, etc., it is different from those that are not its cause, and, similarly, by the fact that it is not able to produce cloth, etc., it is different from those that are not that.

original: don gcig ces bya ba 'dis ni don dam par ldog pa dang ldan pa'i don gcig nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gcig ces bya ba 'dis ni don dam par ldog pa dang ldan pa'i don gcig nyid yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase “the same object” indicates that ultimately, the object is the same, even though it is associated with different conceptual distinctions.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i rten can gyi bslad pa gang dag yin pa tha dad rten can te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i rten can gyi bslad pa gang dag yin pa tha dad rten can te /
translated: Therefore, those that are contaminations associated with different bases are those that are associated with different bases.

original: don dam pa ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi bslad pa gang dag yin pa'i bslad pa de dag gis don de mthong ba nyid la sbyor ro @197a * //
analyzed: don dam pa ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi bslad pa gang dag yin pa'i bslad pa de dag gis don de mthong ba nyid la sbyor ro @197a * //
translated: Those contaminations that are the reasons for the ultimate conceptual distinctions are the contaminations that cause one to see that object as it really is not.

original: zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: de dang ngag gis zhes zlos pas ni ldog pa mang ba'i phyir bslad pa mang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang ngag gis zhes zlos pas ni ldog pa mang ba'i phyir bslad pa mang ba nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that there are many conceptual distinctions, and therefore, there are many contaminations.

original: bslad pa gang dag gis don gang zhig 'phel ba dang 'grib pa lta bur byed pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: bslad pa gang dag gis don gang zhig 'phel ba dang 'grib pa lta bur byed pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: Those contaminations that cause an object to appear as if it were increasing or decreasing are called “contaminations.”

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: chu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes de ltar de'i rgyu nyid kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pa'i bum pa sgrub pa'i rtog pas yul du byas pa ni 'phel ba dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: chu 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin zhes de ltar de'i rgyu nyid kyis de las gzhan dag las ldog pa'i bum pa sgrub pa'i rtog pas yul du byas pa ni 'phel ba dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The nature of holding water is the cause of that. The conceptual thought that posits a pot as different from those other things that are not its cause is associated with increase.

original: snam bu ma yin no zhes de ltar de'i don gyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis 'grib pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: snam bu ma yin no zhes de ltar de'i don gyi rgyu ma yin pa nyid kyis 'grib pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of “is not cloth” is not the cause of that. It is associated with decrease.

original: de ldan nyid min yang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ldan nyid min yang zhes bya ba ni don dam pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “Even though it is not associated” means that the ultimate is not.

original: gang gi de las 'phel ba'am 'grib pa byed par 'gyur ba don de ni ldan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig dang bral ba med la /
analyzed: gang gi de las 'phel ba'am 'grib pa byed par 'gyur ba don de ni ldan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig dang bral ba med la /
translated: That object whose increase or decrease would be caused by that is not devoid of some associated property.

original: bral ba dang yang ldan pa med de /
analyzed: bral ba dang yang ldan pa med de /
translated: Nor is it associated with that which is devoid of it.

original: de lta mod kyi de dang ldan pa ma yin yang don de mthong ba nges pa nyid la sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de dang ldan pa ma yin yang don de mthong ba nges pa nyid la sbyar ro //
translated: Even though it is not associated with that, the seeing of that object is still applied to certainty.

original: 'brel pa 'ga' las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan 'ga' zhig ldog pa dogs pa na ni sgrub pa lta bur byed la /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'ga' las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan 'ga' zhig ldog pa dogs pa na ni sgrub pa lta bur byed la /
translated: “From some relation” means that when the cessation of some other property is suspected, it is treated as if it were an affirmation.

original: sgrub pa'i chos des kyang bum pa 'phel ba lta bur mngon pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos des kyang bum pa 'phel ba lta bur mngon pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The property of the probandum is only the mere appearance of the pot.

original: gang zhig chos gzhan med pa yod par dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don du bum pa la ni 'gebs par byed pa nus pa med do zhes blo gros rmongs pa'i dogs pa la ltos nas 'gebs par nus pa yod pa bzhin du brtags nas gzhi gcig pa nyid🔽du bstan pa sel bar byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig chos gzhan med pa yod par dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don du bum pa la ni 'gebs par byed pa nus pa med do zhes blo gros rmongs pa'i dogs pa la ltos nas 'gebs par nus pa yod pa bzhin du brtags nas gzhi gcig pa nyid du bstan pa sel bar byed do //
translated: In order to eliminate the doubt of someone who thinks that the absence of another property is present, the absence of the capacity to cover is imputed in the pot in dependence on the doubt of a confused mind.🔽In the same way, the absence of the capacity to cover is taught to be the same basis as the capacity to cover.

original: des na sngar ldan zhing phyis bral ba'i chos des 'grib pa dang ldan pa lta bur nges pa'i tha snyad la sbyor ba yin no //🔽nye bar bslad pa de yang des na bslad par zhes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na sngar ldan zhing phyis bral ba'i chos des 'grib pa dang ldan pa lta bur nges pa'i tha snyad la sbyor ba yin no // nye bar bslad pa de yang des na bslad par zhes pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the convention of “possessing decrease” is applied to the property that was previously present and later becomes absent.

original: bslad pa nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: bslad pa nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: That contamination is not “contaminated by that” because it is not reasonable for contamination to be contaminated.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bslad pa gang yin pa de dag ni don rnams kyi don dam pa tha dad pa la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: bslad pa gang yin pa de dag ni don rnams kyi don dam pa tha dad pa la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Those contaminations engage in dependence on the ultimate difference of objects.

original: des na de dag gi bslad pa nyid ni shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: des na de dag gi bslad pa nyid ni shes par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, their error cannot be known,

original: mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slu ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no deception.

original: smig rgyu la chur bslad pa la ni ldog pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur bslad pa la ni ldog pa'i khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: But in the case of the error of water in a mirage, there is no difference in the cessation of the error,

original: slu ba srid pas gnod par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: slu ba srid pas gnod par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: because deception is possible.

original: des na nye bar bslad pa yin yang bslad par ngo ma shes pa'i rang bzhin ni ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na nye bar bslad pa yin yang bslad par ngo ma shes pa'i rang bzhin ni ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is an error, the nature of the error is not known, and there is no cessation.

original: sgra yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: sgra yang de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: Sound is the reason for that.

original: des na sgra la bslad par bstan pa la ni dgos pa cung zad kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: des na sgra la bslad par bstan pa la ni dgos pa cung zad kyang mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, we see no purpose in teaching that sound is erroneous.

original: bslad pa'i don nyid ni sgra'i don yin pas gang gi tshe de dag gi don la mi gnod pa de'i tshe sgra la yang mi @197b gnod pas sgro btags pa ci dgos //
analyzed: bslad pa'i don nyid ni sgra'i don yin pas gang gi tshe de dag gi don la mi gnod pa de'i tshe sgra la yang mi @197b gnod pas sgro btags pa ci dgos //
translated: Since the meaning of the word is the meaning of the error, when there is no harm to the meaning, there is no harm to the word. Therefore, what is the use of superimposition?

original: de'i phyir de ltar sgro btags pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag ba kho na sgra'i don yin pas med pa la nyid 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sgro btags pa'i sgrub pa dang dgag ba kho na sgra'i don yin pas med pa la nyid 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the proof and refutation of superimposition are the meaning of the word, it is not tenable that the nonexistent is the object of the word.

original: de'i phyir na gang zhig mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa dang bdag dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar brjod pa gang yin pa gsum po de kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na gang zhig mtshan nyid de dang ldan pa'i gtan tshigs ni mi dmigs pa dang bdag dang 'bras bu zhes bya bar brjod pa gang yin pa gsum po de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the only three kinds of reasons that have that characteristic are the non-observation, the nature, and the effect.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni mi dmigs pa dang rang bzhin dang 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is being explained: “The non-observation, the nature, and the effect.”

original: rang gi sgras ni gsum po de stobs mtshungs par ston la /
analyzed: rang gi sgras ni gsum po de stobs mtshungs par ston la /
translated: The word “own” shows that these three are of equal strength.

original: 'o'i sgras kyang de tsam nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'o'i sgras kyang de tsam nyid du'o //
translated: The word “only” shows that they are just that.

original: de nyid dper brjod pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid dper brjod pa ston pa ni /
translated: He shows an example of that:

original: dper na phyogs kyi khyad par dmigs kyis gzung ba la lar ro //
analyzed: dper na phyogs kyi khyad par dmigs kyis gzung ba la lar ro //
translated: “For example, in some cases, the observation of a particular place is specified.”

original: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i mngon sum na'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba'i mngon sum na'o //
translated: “In some cases” refers to the direct perception of the proponent and the opponent.

original: bum pa med de zhes bya ba ni bum pa med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bum pa med de zhes bya ba ni bum pa med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “The pot does not exist” is what is to be established by the expression “the pot does not exist.”

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs ston to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gtan tshigs ston to //
translated: “The characteristic of the observation” and so on shows the reason.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rgyu'o //
translated: The characteristic of the observation is the cause.

original: der gyur pa ni tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i don brjod pa'o //
analyzed: der gyur pa ni tshogs pa'i nang du 'dus pa'i don brjod pa'o //
translated: “That” refers to the collection of the parts.

original: yul ni yul nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: yul ni yul nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
translated: “Object” refers to the object itself.

original: tshogs pa gzhan dag ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gzhan dag ni dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Other collections are not the referent object.

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni med pa'i tha snyad du grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the non-existence of that is established.

original: yang ci ltar na gang zhig med pa de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa shes pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: yang ci ltar na gang zhig med pa de dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gyur pa shes pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: How can that which does not exist be the object of a cognition that has the characteristic of perception?

original: shes pa'i yul nyid yin na yang ji ltar med par brjod ce na /
analyzed: shes pa'i yul nyid yin na yang ji ltar med par brjod ce na /
translated: If it is the object of cognition, how can it be said to be non-existent?

original: de'i rang bzhin du btags nas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du btags nas 'gog pa yin te /
translated: It is refuted by imputing its nature.

original: dgag pa thams cad ni sgro btags pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa thams cad ni sgro btags pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: All refutations have an imputed object.

original: dper na skyes bu dkar sham 'di na med po zhes bya ba 'di la /🔽'di skad ces dkar sham yin na ni dgag tu med la /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dkar sham 'di na med po zhes bya ba 'di la / 'di skad ces dkar sham yin na ni dgag tu med la /
translated: For example, when one says, “This white man does not exist,”🔽one cannot say, “If he were white, he could not be refuted;

original: 'gog pa yin na yang dkar sham ma yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa yin na yang dkar sham ma yin no zhes ni brjod par mi nus pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin no //
translated: if he were refuted, he could not be white.” It is the same here.

original: gal te de ltar na mi snang ba yang sha za la sogs pa snang ba nyid du sgro btags nas dgag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mi snang ba yang sha za la sogs pa snang ba nyid du sgro btags nas dgag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the non-appearance of ghosts, etc. would be a superimposition, since they are superimposed as appearing.

original: gang la sgro gdags par rung ba de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la sgro gdags par rung ba de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: It is just that which is suitable to be superimposed that is superimposed.

original: sgro gdags par rung ba yang don gang zhig yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: sgro gdags par rung ba yang don gang zhig yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs pa nyid yin na /
translated: And that which is suitable to be superimposed is an object that, if it exists, is certainly perceived.

original: sha za la sogs pa ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa ni de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But ghosts, etc. are not like that.

original: de lta na yang phyogs 'di na bum pa yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang phyogs 'di na bum pa yod na gdon mi za bar dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Even so, if a pot exists in this place, it is certainly perceived.🔽One would not doubt that, even though the pot exists, it is not perceived because some cause is incomplete.

original: bum pa yod kyang rgyu 'ga' zhig ma tshang bas mi dmigs pa yin no zhes dogs par mi 'gyur ba de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa yin no //🔽sgro @198a * //
analyzed: bum pa yod kyang rgyu 'ga' zhig ma tshang bas mi dmigs pa yin no zhes dogs par mi 'gyur ba de nyid la sgro 'dogs pa yin no // sgro @198a * //
translated: That is the superimposition.

original: gdags pa ga las des she na /
analyzed: gdags pa ga las des she na /
translated: From what is that superimposition?

original: de lta na ni 'o na rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba na bum pa yod na dmigs par rung bar rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na rgyu ma tshang ba med par 'gyur ba na bum pa yod na dmigs par rung bar rtogs kyi /
translated: If that is so, then when the cause is not incomplete, it is understood that if the pot exists, it is suitable to be perceived.

original: sha za la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sha za la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But ghosts, etc. are not like that.

original: 'o na rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ga las shes she na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid ga las shes she na /
translated: But how do you know that the causes are not incomplete?

original: don 'ga' zhig mthong ba na gang zhig don de dang shes pa gcig la gdon mi za bar 'dre ba'i don de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'ga' zhig mthong ba na gang zhig don de dang shes pa gcig la gdon mi za bar 'dre ba'i don de gnyis ni dmigs pa'i rgyu khyad par med pa yin no //
translated: When one sees some object, the object that is necessarily mixed with that object in a single cognition is the object that is not different from the cause of the object.

original: des na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa na /
analyzed: des na shes pa gcig la 'dre ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa na /
translated: Therefore, when one observes a place, etc. that is mixed with a single cognition,

original: gdon mi za bar dmigs pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid ni dmigs pa'i tshogs pa can sgro gdags bar rung ba yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dmigs pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid ni dmigs pa'i tshogs pa can sgro gdags bar rung ba yin no //
translated: it is certainly the very pot that is observed that is suitable to be superimposed on the collection of the observed.

original: gang zhig yul de nyid la brten par brtags pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid yul de dang shes pa gcig la 'du ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig yul de nyid la brten par brtags pa'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid yul de dang shes pa gcig la 'du ba yin gyi /
translated: The pot that is imagined to be based on that very object is the very one that is mixed with that object and a single cognition.

original: yul gzhan na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not located in another place.

original: des na de nyid sgro gdags par rung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de nyid sgro gdags par rung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is suitable to be superimposed.

original: des na shes pa gcig la tshogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa nyid /
analyzed: des na shes pa gcig la tshogs pa'i dngos po gzhan dmigs pa nyid /
translated: Therefore, the very other thing that is mixed in a single cognition is observed.

original: rung ba nyid du srid pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rung ba nyid du srid pa'i bum pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of a pot that is possible is.

original: de'i phyir rung ba nyid du srid pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa las nges par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rung ba nyid du srid pa dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa'i mi dmigs pa las nges par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained from the non-apprehension that has the characteristic of the apprehension of what is possible,

original: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from any other.

original: de'i phyir shes pa gcig la 'du ba'i don gzhan dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs par rigs pas thob pa yin gyi tshig tsam gyis brtags pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa gcig la 'du ba'i don gzhan dmigs pa nyid dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs par rigs pas thob pa yin gyi tshig tsam gyis brtags pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the collection in one cognition is the very apprehension of another object, which is obtained by reasoning as the non-apprehension that has the characteristic of apprehension, and not by mere words.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid ma brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di'i mtshan nyid ma brjod de /
translated: For that very reason, its characteristic is not stated,

original: dper brjod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dper brjod pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic is established by the example itself.

original: don de'i rjes su 'brangs na ni gzhung mangs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: don de'i rjes su 'brangs na ni gzhung mangs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: If one follows that meaning, it would only lead to an extensive text.

original: shes pa gcig la 'drer rung ba nyid kyis snang ba nyid yin pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: shes pa gcig la 'drer rung ba nyid kyis snang ba nyid yin pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the very appearance by the possibility of mixing in one cognition is, it is said:

original: bum pa la sogs pa gal te yod na dmigs pa snang ba'i yod pa de ni de lta bur 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gal te yod na dmigs pa snang ba'i yod pa de ni de lta bur 'gyur ba nyid du 'gyur gyi /
translated: If such things as a pot existed, the existence of the appearance of the object of apprehension would be just as you say.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not otherwise,

original: bum pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa ni de'i rang bzhin nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a pot is established as its very nature.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dper brjod pa yang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi dper brjod pa yang /
translated: An example of a reason of nature is as follows.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can ston pa'o ;
translated: This is the teaching of the subject.

original: / shing ste shing gi tha snyad du rung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: / shing ste shing gi tha snyad du rung ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: A tree, suitable as a referent of the term tree, is the probandum.

original: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shing sha ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Because it is a śimśapā tree is the proof.

original: shing sha pa mang po mod pa'i yul du shing sha pa'i tha snyad shes pa'i blun po lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa la shing gi tha snyad byed pa shes kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam rgyu mtshan @198b yin par ma rtogs
analyzed: shing sha pa mang po mod pa'i yul du shing sha pa'i tha snyad shes pa'i blun po lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa la shing gi tha snyad byed pa shes kyang lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam rgyu mtshan @198b yin par ma rtogs
translated: In a place where there are many śimśapā trees, a fool who knows the convention of the term śimśapā tree does not understand that the mere possession of leaves and so on is the cause.

original: par mthong ba'i khyad par gzhan tha snyad kyi rgyur sgro btags nas /
analyzed: par mthong ba'i khyad par gzhan tha snyad kyi rgyur sgro btags nas /
translated: Seeing other specific features, he superimposes them as the cause of the convention.

original: sgro btags pa de ma mthong ba'i shing sha ba la shing gi tha snyad mi 'jug pa de la /
analyzed: sgro btags pa de ma mthong ba'i shing sha ba la shing gi tha snyad mi 'jug pa de la /
translated: The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.

original: khyod kyis sngar lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis shing gi tha snyad byas pa de ci ltar brjod par gyur ces sngar zhugs pa'i brda dran par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyod kyis sngar lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis shing gi tha snyad byas pa de ci ltar brjod par gyur ces sngar zhugs pa'i brda dran par byed pa yin no //
translated: The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.

original: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis dper brjod pa ni 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis dper brjod pa ni 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can bstan pa'o //
translated: The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,

original: me yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: me yod do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,

original: du ba la ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //🔽ci'i phyir tshul gsum pa /
analyzed: du ba la ni zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so // ci'i phyir tshul gsum pa /
translated: but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,

original: khyad par med pa las gsum nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par med pa las gsum nyid yin zhe na /
translated: but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,

original: bshad ba / gtan tshigs gsum pa de la gnyis ni dngos po ste bsgrub pa sgrub pa ste go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: bshad ba / gtan tshigs gsum pa de la gnyis ni dngos po ste bsgrub pa sgrub pa ste go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: but is applied to the collection of those parts.

original: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba gcig ni dgag pa ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba gcig ni dgag pa ste /
translated: The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc.,🔽but is applied to the collection of those parts.🔽The expression “tree” is not applied to the individual parts of the tree, such as the roots, etc

original: dgag pa'i tha snyad go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tha snyad go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The term “negation” is used to make this understood.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas gtan tshigs rnam par 'jog pa na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la ltos nas gtan tshigs rnam par 'jog pa na /
translated: When a reason is posited in dependence on the probandum,

original: de tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de tha dad pas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: it is different from it.

original: yul yang sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal bas de dag tha dad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gnyis yin la /
analyzed: yul yang sgrub pa dang dgag pa phan tshun 'gal bas de dag tha dad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gnyis yin la /
translated: And since the object of affirmation and the object of negation are mutually exclusive, because they are different, there are two reasons.

original: sgrub pa'i don yang gtan tshigs las tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa yin pas de dag 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i don yang gtan tshigs las tha dad pa dang / tha mi dad pa yin pas de dag 'gal ba yin la /
translated: And since the object of affirmation is different from the reason and not different from it, they are mutually exclusive.

original: de las kyang de tha dad pas gtan tshigs gnyis so //
analyzed: de las kyang de tha dad pas gtan tshigs gnyis so //
translated: And since it is different from that, there are two reasons.

original: de'i phyir de ltar yul tha dad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar yul tha dad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, because the objects are different, there are three reasons.

original: ci ste yul 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum pa yin yang /
analyzed: ci ste yul 'gal ba'i phyir gtan tshigs gsum pa yin yang /
translated: But even though there are three reasons because the objects are mutually exclusive,

original: gang yod pas rang bzhin la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang yod pas rang bzhin la sogs pa go bar byed pa yin la /
translated: it is because of the existence of the reason that the nature of the object is understood.

original: med pa'i phyir ni gzhan dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa der bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ni gzhan dag go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa der bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to show that the other is not a cause of understanding because it does not have the nature of a cause, he says:

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'brel pa ste /
translated: The nature-relation is the relation of nature.

original: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nature is related.

original: de yod na don gyis don gzhan bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med la /
analyzed: de yod na don gyis don gzhan bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med la /
translated: When it exists, the meaning of the other is established without error.

original: mi 'khrul ba las kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba las kyang go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yin no //
translated: And from the non-erroneous, the thing to be understood and the cause of understanding are known.

original: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'khrul pa med pa ni rang bzhin 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'khrul pa med pa ni rang bzhin 'brel pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: “ Because” means that since the non-erroneous is preceded by the nature-relation, therefore

original: 'brel pa dang ldan pa 'di dag kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang ldan pa 'di dag kho na go bar byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: only these which have the relation are the cause of understanding, not others.

original: gang gis rang bzhin 'brel ce na smras pa /
analyzed: gang gis rang bzhin 'brel ce na smras pa /
translated: By what is the nature-relation? He says:

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being of the same nature.

original: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na de bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrub par byed pa de bsgrub par bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid yin pa des na de bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
translated: Because the proof is the very nature of the probandum, therefore, the proof is related to the probandum by the relation of identity.

original: sgrub par byed pa @199a * //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa @199a * //
translated: The proof

original: bsgrub par bya ba de'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: is the very nature of the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa khyad par med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa khyad par med par 'gyur la /
translated: If the probandum and the proof were not different,🔽then one part of the meaning of the thesis would be the reason.

original: des na dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag dogs na /
analyzed: des na dam bca' ba'i don gyi phyogs gcig gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro zhes gzhan dag dogs na /
translated: Thus, others suspect that.

original: ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: To respond: No.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni chos so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi rang bzhin ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni chos so //
translated: The property is the cause of the reversal of the nature of the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: de'i bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i bye brag kun brtags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the particular of that.

original: sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is an imputation.

original: 'di skad du chos kyi bye brag sgro btags pas des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du chos kyi bye brag sgro btags pas des na bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is explained that because the particular of the property is imputed, therefore, the probandum and the proof are different.

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni nges pa'i yul nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni nges pa'i yul nyid yin gyi /
translated: The object of ascertainment is the object of understanding and the means of understanding,

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no //🔽'di ltar go bar bya ba ni nges par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin ni ma yin no // 'di ltar go bar bya ba ni nges par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: but not the nature of the real.🔽Thus, the object of understanding is that which is to be ascertained,

original: go bar byed pa yang nges par 'gyur ba nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed pa yang nges par 'gyur ba nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: and the means of understanding is that which ascertains, that is, the logical mark.

original: nges ba yang sgro btags pa yin te /
analyzed: nges ba yang sgro btags pa yin te /
translated: Ascertainment is also a superimposition,

original: des na nges pa'i yul gyi tha dad pa yang sgro btags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na nges pa'i yul gyi tha dad pa yang sgro btags pa yin no //
translated: and therefore the difference of the object of ascertainment is also a superimposition.

original: don 'di la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i tshig tshad ma nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i tshig tshad ma nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the master Dignāga teaches in the Nyāyamukha:

original: 'di rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa ste rtags so //🔽rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul du chos can la /
analyzed: 'di rjes su dpog pas na rjes su dpag pa ste rtags so // rjes su dpag par bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid kyi yul du chos can la /
translated: Since this is inferred, it is an inference, that is, a logical mark.🔽The object of inference is the subject that is the domain of the characteristic of a logical reason.

original: khyab pa'i yul du ni rjes su dpag par bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
analyzed: khyab pa'i yul du ni rjes su dpag par bya ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos so //
translated: The domain of pervasion is the property to be established that is the object of inference.

original: rtags dang bsgrub bya'i chos can de dag gi tha snyad tha dad pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba kho na ste /
analyzed: rtags dang bsgrub bya'i chos can de dag gi tha snyad tha dad pa ldog pa'i rang bzhin de thams cad ni blo la yod pa'i chos dang chos can gyi bye brag tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'gro ba kho na ste /
translated: All of those phenomena and subjects that are the bases of the different conventions of reasons and probandum are only the nature that is the different natures of the phenomena and subjects that exist for the mind.

original: blo la brten pa'i rang bzhin des tha dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: blo la brten pa'i rang bzhin des tha dad pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The different conventions are due to the nature that is based on the mind.

original: gal te chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad blos brtags pa yin no /
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos can gyi tha snyad blos brtags pa yin no /
translated: If the conventions of phenomena and subjects are imputed by the mind,

original: de lta na ni 'o na brtags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya bsgrub par thal lo zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na brtags pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bsgrub bya bsgrub par thal lo zhe na /
translated: then it follows that a reason that is imputed would prove a probandum that is imputed.

original: bshad pa / 'di ni chos so 'di ni chos can no zhes bya ba'i chos can nyid gang yin pa de kho na blos kun btags pa yin gyi ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa / 'di ni chos so 'di ni chos can no zhes bya ba'i chos can nyid gang yin pa de kho na blos kun btags pa yin gyi ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi don kyang ni ma yin te /
translated: In response to this, it is said, “The nature of phenomena and subjects that is called ‘this is a phenomenon’ and ‘this is a subject’ is only imputed by the mind. It is not an object that is a different nature.

original: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba don la mi ltos pa rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: blo'i bye brag rang dga' ba don la mi ltos pa rnams ni don gyi rten ma yin pa ste /
translated: The different aspects of the mind that are independent and do not rely on objects are not the supports of objects.

original: don gyi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi gzhi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not the basis of the object.

original: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gang yin pa de las don go bar khas len na ni don te /
analyzed: de dag gis brtags pa'i yul gang yin pa de las don go bar khas len na ni don te /
translated: If one accepts that the object is understood from the object of imputation, then the object

original: dngos po mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po mi 'thob pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: would not be obtained at all.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni rten chos can yin la /🔽'di ni rten pa chos yin no zhes bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba du ma tsam zhig @199b blos brtags ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni rten chos can yin la / 'di ni rten pa chos yin no zhes bya ba dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba du ma tsam zhig @199b blos brtags ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the basis is the subject,🔽and the property of the subject and the probandum are merely imputed by the

original: phyi rol tu nges pa'i don gyi bdag nyid de dang de las ldog pa yang brtags pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol tu nges pa'i don gyi bdag nyid de dang de las ldog pa yang brtags pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: mind, but not by the object itself.

original: yang ci ltar gcig la tha dad par brtags par nus she na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar gcig la tha dad par brtags par nus she na /
translated: Moreover, how can one be imputed as different?🔽In order to demonstrate the reason for the imputation of difference, it is

original: tha dad par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: tha dad par rtog pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: said:

original: gang gi phyir dngos kun te 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos kun te 'ga' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: Because all things—not some of them—🔽are the same in being different from other things.

original: mthun dngos ni rigs mthun ba'o //
analyzed: mthun dngos ni rigs mthun ba'o //
translated: Things that are the same are of the same type.

original: gzhan gyi dngos ni rigs mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos ni rigs mi mthun pa ste /
translated: Other things are of different types.

original: de dag las rang bzhin gyis te brtags pa ma yin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ldog pa la ni rten pa can zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag las rang bzhin gyis te brtags pa ma yin pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyis ldog pa la ni rten pa can zhes 'brel to //
translated: They are distinguished by their intrinsic reality, not by their imagined intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ldog ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang bzhin gyis ldog ce na /
translated: Why are they distinguished by their intrinsic reality?

original: rang rang la ngo bo la gnas pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang la ngo bo la gnas pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established by their own causes.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Because all things are established by their own intrinsic reality,

original: phan tshun 'dre ba ma yin pa de'i phyir na /
analyzed: phan tshun 'dre ba ma yin pa de'i phyir na /
translated: they are not mixed with each other.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma 'brel pas rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma 'brel pas rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are not related by intrinsic reality, they are distinguished from similar and dissimilar things.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ldog mtshams kyi don gang dang gang las de ldog pa don gzhan gyi ldog pa de'i rgyu can ldog mtshams khyad par can gyi yul gyi ldog pa'i rgyu can rigs kyi dbye ba rigs kyi khyad par sgra'i brjod par
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ldog mtshams kyi don gang dang gang las de ldog pa don gzhan gyi ldog pa de'i rgyu can ldog mtshams khyad par can gyi yul gyi ldog pa'i rgyu can rigs kyi dbye ba rigs kyi khyad par sgra'i brjod par
translated: Because that is so, the object of the boundary of distinction, from which it is distinguished, is the cause of the distinction of another object. The cause of the distinction of the object of the special boundary of distinction is the division of the class, the difference of the class, the expression of the word.

original: bya ba rab tu 'byed cing rab tu 'jog go //
analyzed: bya ba rab tu 'byed cing rab tu 'jog go //
translated: It is the basis for the differentiation and positing of the activity.

original: 'di ltar dper na bum pa gcig bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa de bzhin du bum pa gzhan rnams kyang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na bum pa gcig bum pa ma yin pa las ldog pa de bzhin du bum pa gzhan rnams kyang yin la /
translated: For example, just as one pot is distinguished from the non-pot, so are all other pots.

original: thun mong ba'i ldog pa de yang sgra'i brjod bar bya ba'i rigs su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ba'i ldog pa de yang sgra'i brjod bar bya ba'i rigs su brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that common distinction is expressed as the class that is the referent of the word.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i khyad par gang yin pa de rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rigs rtogs na rang gi mtshan nyid khyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir de rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i khyad par gang yin pa de rtogs 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgro btags pa'i rigs rtogs na rang gi mtshan nyid khyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir de rtogs pa yin no //
translated: When that class is understood, the particular of the intrinsic identity is understood means that when the superimposed class is understood, the particular of the intrinsic identity is ascertained, and so it is understood.

original: des na ldog mtshams gzhan dang gzhan la ltos nas kun brtags pa'i ldog pa'i bye brag rnam par rtog pas yul du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog mtshams gzhan dang gzhan la ltos nas kun brtags pa'i ldog pa'i bye brag rnam par rtog pas yul du byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on other boundaries, the conceptual thought takes as its object the various distinctions of the imagined boundary.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du du ma las ldog pa can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gcig ni rnam par rtog pas yul du bya bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du du ma las ldog pa can gyi dngos po'i rang bzhin gcig ni rnam par rtog pas yul du bya bar nus pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, like perception, a single nature of a thing that is the opposite of many cannot be made an object by a conceptual consciousness.🔽In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na ldog mtshams gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gang zhig sgra'i chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba de'i sgra yang brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i phyir chos dang 'dra bas chos zhes brjod
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa des na ldog mtshams gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can rang gi mtshan nyid kyi khyad par gang zhig sgra'i chos gang gis go bar 'gyur ba de'i sgra yang brjod par bya ba la brten pa'i phyir chos dang 'dra bas chos zhes brjod
translated: Since that is so, a specific intrinsic identity that is the reason for the boundary line of another is understood by a word that is a property. Since that word is based on the object, it is called a property because it is similar to a property.

original: do // ldog pa gzhan gyi yul can gyi sgra de las gzhan gyis ni go bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: do // ldog pa gzhan gyi yul can gyi sgra de las gzhan gyis ni go bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That word whose object is the boundary line of another cannot be understood by another.

original: rgyu des na rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag rnam grangs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu des na rnam par rtog pa dang sgra dag rnam grangs pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: For that reason, conceptual consciousnesses and words are not synonyms.

original: 'on kyang yul @200a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul @200a * //
translated: However, their objects are different.

original: tha dad pa yin no zhes smras pa ni tha dad rnam par gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa yin no zhes smras pa ni tha dad rnam par gnas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is meant by “the difference is established.”

original: gal te nges pa'i yul sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin dag nyid tha dad pa dang go bya go byed yin na /
analyzed: gal te nges pa'i yul sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin dag nyid tha dad pa dang go bya go byed yin na /
translated: If the object of ascertainment and the superimposed nature were different, they would be the object of understanding and the means of understanding.

original: de dag la ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid can gyi 'brel pa med do //
translated: But they do not have a relation that has the characteristic of identity.

original: gang la 'brel pa yod pa de dag ni go bya go byed kyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la 'brel pa yod pa de dag ni go bya go byed kyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Those that have a relation are not the object of understanding and the means of understanding,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la go bya go byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la go bya go byed mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of understanding and the means of understanding are not tenable in terms of their own characteristics.

original: des na bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag de'i bdag nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na bsgrub bya sgrub byed dag de'i bdag nyid ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: So how could the object of ascertainment and the means of ascertainment have that nature?🔽It is true that the object of ascertainment does not have that nature, but the means of ascertainment does.

original: bden te 'on kyang nges pa la gnas pa sgro btags kyi rang bzhin du nges pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang nges pa la gnas pa sgro btags kyi rang bzhin du nges pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: However, the object of ascertainment that is ascertained as the superimposed nature is not the object of understanding,

original: de lta bur gyur pa ni su yang don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa ni su yang don du gnyer ba med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because no one seeks such an object.

original: / go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par brloms  pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: / go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par brloms  pa nyid yin te /
translated: The object of understanding and the means of understanding are only imagined to be different in terms of their own characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la don du gnyer ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la don du gnyer ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the purpose of the specific property is fulfilled.

original: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na nyid yin la /
analyzed: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of understanding and the means of understanding are only the specific property.

original: de la ni de'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la ni de'i bdag nyid yod pa nyid do //
translated: And in that case, there is the existence of the nature of that.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid de tha mi dad par 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum gyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid de tha mi dad par 'dzin la /
translated: However, perception grasps that specific property without distinction.

original: rnam par rtog pas ni sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyis nye bar zin pa tha dad pa lta bur ston pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ni sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyis nye bar zin pa tha dad pa lta bur ston pa yin no //
translated: But conceptual thought reveals it as if it were different, because it is seized by the nature of superimposition.

original: ldog mtshams gcig gi rgyu mtshan can lhag par sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyis bar du gcod pa rang gi mtshan nyid de rtogs pa na /
analyzed: ldog mtshams gcig gi rgyu mtshan can lhag par sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyis bar du gcod pa rang gi mtshan nyid de rtogs pa na /
translated: When the specific property is understood, which is the cause of a single exclusion, it is interrupted by the nature of superimposition.

original: ldog mtshams gzhan las ldog pa ni nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog mtshams gzhan las ldog pa ni nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The exclusion from another exclusion is not ascertained.

original: gang zhig nges pas ma nges pa de ni nges pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig nges pas ma nges pa de ni nges pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: That which is not ascertained by a determination is not the object of a determination.

original: des na mngon sum ni de'i rnam pa can yin pas rang bzhin thams cad 'dzin la /
analyzed: des na mngon sum ni de'i rnam pa can yin pas rang bzhin thams cad 'dzin la /
translated: Therefore, since perception has the form of that, it apprehends all natures.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sgro btags kyi rjes su 'brang nas rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin yang ldog pa gcig gi rang bzhin du zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sgro btags kyi rjes su 'brang nas rang gi mtshan nyid nges pa yin yang ldog pa gcig gi rang bzhin du zhen pa yin no //
translated: Conceptual thought, however, is attached to the nature of a single exclusion, even though it ascertains the own-characteristic by following the trace of superimposition.

original: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag nyid de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: des na go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de dag nyid de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, those things that are the object and the means of understanding are just the nature of that,

original: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyis nye bar zin pa dag nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin gyis nye bar zin pa dag nges pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are ascertained by the nature of superimposition.

original: sgro btags pa dang 'brel pa'i tha dad pa nges pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yul gsal bar byed pa na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa dang 'brel pa'i tha dad pa nges pas rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yul gsal bar byed pa na /
translated: When the object is illuminated by the own-characteristic through the ascertainment of the difference connected with superimposition,

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa dag kyang tha dad par ston par byed do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa rang gi mtshan nyid du gyur pa dag kyang tha dad par ston par byed do //
translated: the probandum and the probans, which are the own-characteristic, are also shown to be different.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: sgro gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin tha dad par sgro btags pa yin la /
analyzed: sgro gdags par bya ba'i rang bzhin tha dad par sgro btags pa yin la /
translated: The nature of the superimposition is a superimposition of difference.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgro btags pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang sgro btags pa dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: And the intrinsic identity is like the superimposition.

original: des na @200b sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyis rjes su rtogs pa na tha dad par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: des na @200b sgro btags kyi rang bzhin gyis rjes su rtogs pa na tha dad par zhen pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when one realizes the nature of the superimposition, one conceives of difference.

original: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang zhen par byas pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
analyzed: go bar bya ba dang go bar byed pa'i dngos po yang zhen par byas pa'i tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis yin te /
translated: The relation of the object of understanding and the means of understanding is also due to the conception of difference.

original: des na rang gis de'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na rang gis de'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the intrinsic identity of the object of understanding and the means of understanding.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa'i rang bzhin 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin no //🔽gang gis 'bras bu yang rang bzhin 'brel par 'gyur ba de ston par byed pa ni 'bras bu yang de las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pa'i rang bzhin 'di yang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su brjod pa yin no // gang gis 'bras bu yang rang bzhin 'brel par 'gyur ba de ston par byed pa ni 'bras bu yang de las byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: This relation by intrinsic identity is also called a natural reason.🔽The effect is also related by intrinsic identity, because it is the effect of that.

original: gang gi phyir de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang de rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las byung ba yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu yang de rang bzhin 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The effect is also related by intrinsic identity to that, because it arises from that.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig rang bzhin 'brel pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig rang bzhin 'brel pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag par bya ba shes pa 'di gnyis ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the two, the effect that is related by intrinsic reality and the inference that arises from intrinsic reality, are valid cognitions.

original: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin pa des na ste /
analyzed: der 'khrul pa med pa dag yin pa des na ste /
translated: Because they are non-erroneous with regard to that,

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that they are non-erroneous with regard to the object that is inferred.

original: dper na mngon sum snang yang 'khrul pa med pas tshad ma yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum snang yang 'khrul pa med pas tshad ma yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like direct perception, which is a valid cognition because it is non-erroneous even though it appears.

original: ci'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la 'khrul pa med ce na /
translated: Why is it non-erroneous?

original: bshad pa / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because it arises from the object that is inferred.

original: de las skyes pa nyid ni /
analyzed: de las skyes pa nyid ni /
translated: As for its arising from that,

original: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
analyzed: dngos gang yang dag ji bzhin pa //
translated: the thing that is just so

original: zhes bya ba der gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba der gtan la phab zin to //
translated: has already been determined in that.

original: 'o na 'di mngon sum las khyad ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'di mngon sum las khyad ci yod ce na /
translated: Well then, how is this different from direct perception?

original: smras pa de snang ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa de snang ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: It is said: because it is not just the appearance of that, it is not direct perception.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: don rnam pa med pas mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: don rnam pa med pas mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: Since there is no object, it is not direct perception.

original: mngon sum ma yin na yang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma ni yin /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin na yang 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma ni yin /
translated: And since it is not direct perception, it is not mistaken, and therefore it is valid knowledge.

original: yang ci ltar de snang ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci ltar de snang ba nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that it does not appear?

original: bshad pa / dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / dngos las ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because it is not produced from an object.

original: gang gi phyir don las dngos su skyes pa'i shes pa ni de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don las dngos su skyes pa'i shes pa ni de'i rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa yin no //
translated: Because consciousness that is directly produced from an object conforms to its aspect.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na nges par rnam par 'jog par byed pas shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i don gyi rang bzhin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu med na nges par rnam par 'jog par byed pas shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the object to be apprehended, when there is no cause for error, definitely becomes the cause of consciousness, since it is the cause of the determination.
