translated: The characteristic of the state of negation is that nature which is only the characteristic of the state of mutual exclusion.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid pa'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid pa'i 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the nature of the characteristic of contradiction.

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid gcig par 'gal ba de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid gcig par 'gal ba de'i phyir de'i rang bzhin gyi yul can yin te /
translated: Because of the contradiction of identity, therefore it is the subject of that nature,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa bzhin no //
translated: like permanence and impermanence.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid ni rtag pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid ni rtag pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa'i ngo bo yin la //
translated: Impermanence is the nature of abiding in the abandonment of permanence.

original: rtag pa yang mi rtag pa nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa yang mi rtag pa nyid yongs su spangs pa yin no //
translated: Permanence is the abandonment of impermanence.

original: 'dir yang de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bya ba la ltos par byas te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de yang mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bya ba la ltos par byas te /
translated: Here, it should be understood that this is also due to the non-apprehension of that.

original: 'gal ba'i rgyu phan tshun spangs pa de yang mi dmigs pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rgyu phan tshun spangs pa de yang mi dmigs pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: The cause of contradiction, mutual abandonment, is also to be ascertained from the very non-apprehension of that.

original: ci ltar na phan tshun spangs pa 'gal ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
analyzed: ci ltar na phan tshun spangs pa 'gal ba'i rgyu yin zhing /
translated: How is it that mutual abandonment is the cause of contradiction?

original: mi dmigs pa las nges par bya ba yang ji ltar yin zhe na smras pa /🔽'di la gang yongs @206b su gcod pa na gang zhig rnam par bcad par 'gyur ba'i yongs su bcad pa'i de'i rang bzhin ni rnam par bcad pa yongs su spangs bas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las nges par bya ba yang ji ltar yin zhe na smras pa / 'di la gang yongs @206b su gcod pa na gang zhig rnam par bcad par 'gyur ba'i yongs su bcad pa'i de'i rang bzhin ni rnam par bcad pa yongs su spangs bas gnas pa yin no //
translated: And how is it to be ascertained from non-apprehension? It is said:🔽Here, when one is determined, the nature of that which is determined is to abide in the abandonment of the exclusion of what is excluded.

original: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod pa na yang de'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par gcod pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yongs su gcod pa na yang de'i rang bzhin nyams pa rnam par gcod pa yin te /
translated: When the nature of something is determined, the exclusion of the impairment of that nature is also excluded.

original: des na de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, its nature is to endure by completely abandoning the degeneration of its nature.

original: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pas gnas pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as it endures by completely abandoning the degeneration of its nature,

original: de'i ngo bo nyams pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang yongs su spangs pas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyams pa dang ldan pa'i dngos po yang yongs su spangs pas gnas pa yin no //
translated: it also endures by completely abandoning the degeneration of its nature that is associated with entities.

original: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni gcig la 'gal la /
analyzed: des na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag ni gcig la 'gal la /
translated: Therefore, entities and non-entities are mutually exclusive in one place.

original: dngos po ni gang dag gcig la gcig med par mi 'khrul pa de dag gcig la gcig med pa mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin gyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ni gang dag gcig la gcig med par mi 'khrul pa de dag gcig la gcig med pa mi 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis 'gal ba yin gyi dngos su ni ma yin no //
translated: Entities are mutually exclusive in one place because they are not confused about the absence of one in the other. They are mutually exclusive as the reason for the absence of one in the other, but not directly.

original: de ltar 'gal ba'i rgyu ni thams cad du phan tshun spangs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'gal ba'i rgyu ni thams cad du phan tshun spangs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the reason for mutual exclusion is always the mutual exclusion itself.

original: de yang mi dmigs pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de yang mi dmigs pa nyid las nges par bya ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it should be ascertained from non-apprehension itself.

original: gang zhig gang du mi dmigs pa de ni de na med par nges nus kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gang du mi dmigs pa de ni de na med par nges nus kyi /
translated: That which is not apprehended in a certain place can be ascertained as absent there,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: but not elsewhere.

original: mi dmigs pas nges pa nyid kyang dngos po gang zhig rnam par nges pa de yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas nges pa nyid kyang dngos po gang zhig rnam par nges pa de yin te /
translated: And the ascertainment by non-apprehension is of that thing which is ascertained.

original: dper na ser po la rnam par nges par gyur pa'i sngon po bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ser po la rnam par nges par gyur pa'i sngon po bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the blue which is ascertained in the case of yellow.

original: gang zhig ma nges pa'i ngo bo de ni thams cad la yod par the tshom za ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ma nges pa'i ngo bo de ni thams cad la yod par the tshom za ste /
translated: And that which has an uncertain nature is suspected of existing in everything,

original: dper na skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma yin no //
translated: for example, as being momentary.

original: de ni sngon po la sogs pa dag las rnam pa tha dad par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ni sngon po la sogs pa dag las rnam pa tha dad par mi 'dod do //
translated: It is not held that it is a different aspect from blue, etc.

original: des na de ni thams cad la dmigs par the tshom za ste ji srid rjes su dpag pa med pa de nyid du mi dmigs par nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni thams cad la dmigs par the tshom za ste ji srid rjes su dpag pa med pa de nyid du mi dmigs par nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is suspected that it is apprehended in everything, and as long as there is no inference, it is not ascertained as non-apprehended.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' yang skad cig ma nyid yongs su spangs nas gnas par rtogs pa ni med de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'ga' yang skad cig ma nyid yongs su spangs nas gnas par rtogs pa ni med de /
translated: Therefore, there is no cognition of anything remaining after the abandonment of momentariness.

original: des na rnam par nges par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par nges par shes pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the ascertainment is from the non-apprehension of something else which has the nature of a cognition. There is the designation of non-existence.

original: gal te snang du rung ba'i rnam pa nges pa nyid mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /🔽des na bum pa la sha za la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: gal te snang du rung ba'i rnam pa nges pa nyid mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ba ma yin nam / des na bum pa la sha za la sogs pa'am /
translated: If the ascertainment of the aspect that is suitable to appear is not non-apprehension, then how could the term “non-existence” be derived from it?

original: mi rtag pa la rtag pa snang sdu mi rung ba mi snang ba mi dmigs pa las ci ltar 'gog //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag pa snang sdu mi rung ba mi snang ba mi dmigs pa las ci ltar 'gog //
translated: Therefore, how could the non-appearance of the suitable to appear, such as a ghost in a pot, or permanence in the impermanent, be refuted by non-apprehension?

original: 'di ltar snang du rung bar 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid ni 'ga' yang med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar snang du rung bar 'gyur ba rtag pa nyid ni 'ga' yang med de /
translated: In this way, there is no permanence at all that is suitable to appear.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa gzhan gang la 'gog ce na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ma nges pa'i rnam pa gzhan gang la 'gog ce na /
translated: Therefore, how could any other aspect that is not ascertained be refuted?

original: smras pa / thams cad du mi dmigs pa kho na las yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / thams cad du mi dmigs pa kho na las yin no //
translated: We say: It is only from non-apprehension in all cases.

original: ci ltar zhe na /🔽'di la gang gi phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs @207a * //
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / 'di la gang gi phyir mi snang ba mi dmigs @207a * //
translated: How is that?

original: par 'gyur ba bum pa la tha dad pa'i sha za med par bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba bum pa la tha dad pa'i sha za med par bsgrub pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, non-apprehension is not the non-appearance of a ghost that is different from a pot.

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: However, it is non-different.

original: snang ba'i bum pa 'di ni sha za'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes de ltar snang ba nyid du las blangs nas sha za dgag par byed pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i bum pa 'di ni sha za'i rang bzhin ma yin no zhes de ltar snang ba nyid du las blangs nas sha za dgag par byed pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: The pot that appears is not the nature of a flesh-eater.

original: dper na gal te 'di ni bum pa yod na ni snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bum pa snang ba nyid khas blangs nas yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na gal te 'di ni bum pa yod na ni snang ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bum pa snang ba nyid khas blangs nas yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as it is said, “If this were a pot, it would appear,” and the existence of the pot is accepted as appearance, and then its existence is refuted, so too,

original: gal te 'di sha za yin na ni snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di sha za yin na ni snang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: “If this were a flesh-eater, it would appear.”

original: de bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid du khas blangs nas rtag pa nyid 'gog pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid du khas blangs nas rtag pa nyid 'gog pa'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid las yin no //
translated: Likewise, the existence of the flesh-eater is accepted as appearance, and then its permanence is refuted.

original: rtag pa nyid ni rnam par shes par gyur pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa sha za yang rnam par shes par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtag pa nyid ni rnam par shes par gyur pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa sha za yang rnam par shes par gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is said, “Permanence is not a transformation of consciousness.” A flesh-eater is not a transformation of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang ci srid du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyis bum pa las sha za rnam pa gzhan nyid du brtags pa de ni rtogs pas byas pa'i gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ci srid du snang ba'i rang bzhin gyis bum pa las sha za rnam pa gzhan nyid du brtags pa de ni rtogs pas byas pa'i gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: However, as long as the nature of the appearance is imagined to be different from the pot, that is a difference created by thought.

original: de bzhin du rtag pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyams pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyams pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: Similarly, permanence is the nature of the loss of impermanence.

original: des na rnam pa gzhan du brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam pa gzhan du brtags pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is imagined to be a different aspect.

original: de bzhin du dngos po med pa las yang dngos po bkag pa'i rang bzhin bzlog pa'i rnam pa brtags pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i dngos po 'am tha dad par brtags pa'i dngos po med pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po med pa las yang dngos po bkag pa'i rang bzhin bzlog pa'i rnam pa brtags pa'i phyir rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i dngos po 'am tha dad par brtags pa'i dngos po med pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: In the same way, since the nature of the negation of an entity from a nonentity is imagined to be the opposite aspect, whether it is an entity that appears as a different aspect or a nonentity that is imagined to be a different entity,

original: snang du rung ba nyid khas blangs nas dgag par byed pa na /
analyzed: snang du rung ba nyid khas blangs nas dgag par byed pa na /
translated: when one accepts that it is suitable to appear and then refutes it,

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: it is done only by the nonobservation of the appearance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs thigs par khyad par ma brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs thigs par khyad par ma brjod do //
translated: For that very reason, the Drop of Reasons does not mention a distinction.

original: tha dad pa 'gog pa la ni 'khrul pa'i phyir snang ba nyid du rung ba zhes khyad par du bya dgos kyi //
analyzed: tha dad pa 'gog pa la ni 'khrul pa'i phyir snang ba nyid du rung ba zhes khyad par du bya dgos kyi //
translated: In order to refute difference, it is necessary to add the qualification “in error” to “appearance.”

original: tha mi dad pa nyid du khas blangs pa 'gog pa la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir khyad par don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid du khas blangs pa 'gog pa la ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir khyad par don med pa nyid do //
translated: But in order to refute the claim of non-difference, the qualification is meaningless, because there is no error.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid gcig pa 'gog pa la snang ba mi dmigs pa kho nas byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the refutation of identity is accomplished by the mere non-apprehension of appearance.

original: de lta yin dang nges par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na'i nang du 'dus par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang nges par 'gyur ba med de zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na'i nang du 'dus par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And so, the argument “because there is no ascertainment” is included in the mere non-apprehension of appearance.

original: gal te de yongs su gcod pa dang de las gzhan rnam par gcod pa dang phung po gsum pa yang med par ston pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de yongs su gcod pa dang de las gzhan rnam par gcod pa dang phung po gsum pa yang med par ston pa zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is said that “it is shown that there is no third possibility apart from the determination of that and the exclusion of what is other than that,” and that “it is because it is the cause of the conceptual thoughts of affirmation and negation that it has a result,”

original: dngos po med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub par bshad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa mngon sum nyid kyis grub par bshad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: But it is not explained that non-entity is established by direct perception.

original: bden @207b te ;
analyzed: bden @207b te ;
translated: That is true.

original: dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub mod kyi /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub mod kyi /
translated: Non-entity is indeed established by direct perception.

original: 'on kyang de tha snyad ni snang ba mi dmigs pa las yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de tha snyad ni snang ba mi dmigs pa las yin no //
translated: However, the conventional is from the non-apprehension of appearance.

original: gal te snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur na /
translated: If the conventional of non-existence were from the non-apprehension of appearance,🔽then it would be like this:

original: 'di ni yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni yod do //
translated: This is existent.🔽This is non-existent.

original: 'di ni med do zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni med do zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa dang dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba ci ltar zhe na /
translated: Since it is the cause of the conceptualization of affirmation and negation, it has a result.

original: dmigs pa 'di ni yod do //
analyzed: dmigs pa 'di ni yod do //
translated: This is what will be explained.🔽How is it?

original: ma dmigs pa 'di ni med do zhes dmigs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho nas 'bras bu dang bcas par dgongs nas de skad du bshad do //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa 'di ni med do zhes dmigs pa bsgrub pa dang / dgag pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho nas 'bras bu dang bcas par dgongs nas de skad du bshad do //
translated: Thinking that this apprehension is the cause of the conceptualization of affirmation and negation, and that it has a result, it is explained in that way.

original: de nyid kyis na 'di ni dmigs so zhes rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na 'di ni dmigs so zhes rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the thought “This is perceived” arises.

original: gal te dmigs pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad kyang snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na las 'gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the convention of nonexistence of an object does not arise from the nonapprehension of an appearance,

original: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyang mngon sum gyis ji ltar 'grub ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyang mngon sum gyis ji ltar 'grub ce na /
translated: then how is the convention of nonexistence of an object established by perception?

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: gang gi phyir gang la dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de ni ma dmigs par nges kyang yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang la dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de ni ma dmigs par nges kyang yod par the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: Because if something exists as a nature that is different from the object, then even if it is ascertained that it is not apprehended, it is still doubted that it exists.

original: rmongs pa la mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rmongs pa la mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, in the case of confusion, the convention of nonexistence should be established from the nonapprehension of something.

original: gang la dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin med pa de la ni dmigs pa med par nges pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: gang la dmigs pa las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin med pa de la ni dmigs pa med par nges pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba gzhan ci zhig yod de /
translated: But if something does not exist as a nature that is different from the object, then what other thing to be established is there, since the convention of nonexistence is ascertained to be the nonapprehension of that?

original: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam pa gcig tu nges par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nges par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ascertainment of one aspect is the non-apprehension of the other.

original: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa nyid dmigs pa nges pa na cig shos dmigs pa med par nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu nges pa nyid dmigs pa nges pa na cig shos dmigs pa med par nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the ascertainment of one aspect is apprehended, the non-apprehension of the other is ascertained.

original: ji srid du shes pa gzhan med par ma nges pa de srid du ni nges pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa nges par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du shes pa gzhan med par ma nges pa de srid du ni nges pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa nges par mi 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: As long as the absence of another cognition is not ascertained, the cognition of the ascertained nature is not ascertained.

original: shes pa ni bdag nyid shes pa gzhan las rnam par gcod do zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni bdag nyid shes pa gzhan las rnam par gcod do zhes gang 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is explained that cognition is distinguished from another cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid ma yin par dgag pa 'jug pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid ma yin par dgag pa 'jug pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, because it is the cause of the convention of the absence of another cognition, non-apprehension is explained as the door of engagement of the negation of non-perception.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang dgag pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bshad pa na /
translated: The master also explains that all negations are from non-apprehension.

original: dmigs pa las gzhan gyi med pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa las gzhan gyi med pa'i tha snyad mi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan can du bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: The explanation is that the convention of non-existence is based on the non-apprehension of the object,

original: dmigs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not on the non-apprehension of the object itself.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis @208a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin pa nyid kyis @208a * //
translated: Since it is the cause of the convention of non-existence,

original: na ; mngon sum gyis snang ba'i dngos po med par don gyis nges par brjod do //
analyzed: na ; mngon sum gyis snang ba'i dngos po med par don gyis nges par brjod do //
translated: it is said that perception ascertains the non-existence of the object by implication.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin nges pa nges par byed pa ni shes pa gzhan med par nges par byed pa gang yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin nges pa nges par byed pa ni shes pa gzhan med par nges par byed pa gang yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, the ascertainment of the nature of perception itself is the ascertainment of the absence of another cognition.

original: snang ba'i dngos po yod na ni mngon sum gyis byas pa'i shes pa gzhan med par nges pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: snang ba'i dngos po yod na ni mngon sum gyis byas pa'i shes pa gzhan med par nges pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the object of appearance exists, it is not tenable to ascertain the absence of another cognition produced by perception.

original: de'i phyir don gyis shes pa gzhan med par nges par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid ni dngos po med par nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyis shes pa gzhan med par nges par byed pa'i mngon sum nyid ni dngos po med par nges par byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, perception itself, which ascertains the absence of another cognition by implication, ascertains the non-existence of the object.

original: don gyis dngos po med par nges par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir shes pa de nyid nye bar btags nas don gyis med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyis dngos po med par nges par byed pa de nyid kyi phyir shes pa de nyid nye bar btags nas don gyis med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Because it is that very cognition which ascertains that the object does not exist, the non-existence of the object is expressed by the designation of that very cognition.

original: dmigs pa med par nges kyang yod pa mthong ba'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par nges kyang yod pa mthong ba'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: Even though the non-existence of the object is ascertained, the non-apprehension of the appearance is conventionally expressed because the object is seen to exist.

original: de'i phyir shes pa med pa'i tha snyad ni mngon sum gyis byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa med pa'i tha snyad ni mngon sum gyis byas pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the conventional expression of the non-existence of cognition is made by direct perception itself.

original: des na yin gyi /
analyzed: des na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not that there is no ascertainment by direct perception.

original: nges pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no //
translated: Ascertainment is by direct perception itself.

original: de'i phyir dag gis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dag gis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to have an effect.

original: yang na dngos po med pa snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na dngos po med pa snang ba mi dmigs pas tha snyad du bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Or, the non-existence of the object is conventionally expressed by the non-apprehension of the appearance,

original: nges pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ni mngon sum nyid kyis yin no //
translated: but ascertainment is by direct perception itself.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i rnam rtog pas kyang 'bras bu dang bcas par brjod pa de ltar na yang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa'i rnam rtog pas kyang 'bras bu dang bcas par brjod pa de ltar na yang 'gal ba med do //
translated: Therefore, even the conception of non-existence is said to have an effect, and thus there is no contradiction.

original: dmigs pa med par nges pa'i byed pa nyid kyis na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med par nges pa'i byed pa nyid kyis na /
translated: By the very act of ascertaining the non-existence of the object,

original: de yongs su gcod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i bya ba rnam pa gsum yang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gcod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma'i bya ba rnam pa gsum yang rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The three activities of valid cognition, such as “determining that,” should be understood as well.

original: de ltar 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga la yang 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu dngos po med pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid las tha dad du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gal ba rnam pa gnyi ga la yang 'gal ba rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu dngos po med pa ni mi dmigs pa nyid las tha dad du bya'o //
translated: Thus, in both types of contradiction, the cause of positing the contradiction should be understood as being nothing other than nonapprehension.

original: rnam pa gnyi ga la yang zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyi ga la yang zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Why is it said that “in both types of contradiction”?

original: 'di ltar lhan cig mi gnas par 'gal ba la ni mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig mi gnas par 'gal ba la ni mi dmigs pa las med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, in the case of the contradiction of noncoexistence, the convention of nonexistence comes from nonapprehension.

original: snang ba'i don la don gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i don la don gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the negation of another object is in regard to an object that appears.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba la ni nges pa'i ngo bo gcig dmigs pa nyid kyis gzhan med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba la ni nges pa'i ngo bo gcig dmigs pa nyid kyis gzhan med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the case of the contradiction of mutual exclusion, the convention of nonexistence of one comes from the apprehension of the nature of the other.

original: der ni bdag nyid gcig par dgag par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: der ni bdag nyid gcig par dgag par bya ba yin la /
translated: In that case, it is the same nature that is to be negated.🔽And that is possible by the apprehension of the nature of the other.

original: de yang gcig gi ngo bor dmigs pa nyid kyis nus so zhe na mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang gcig gi ngo bor dmigs pa nyid kyis nus so zhe na mi nus te /
translated: This is not possible.

original: gang gi phyir phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Because,🔽in the case of mutually exclusive objects, the reason for the expression “the non-existence of the other” is the ascertainment of the nature of a single observed object.

original: gnas pa'i 'gal ba de la yang cig shos med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gcig gi ngo bo nges pa dmigs pa khyod kyis bshad pa gang yin pa gcig dmigs pa des na ngo bo @208b gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'gal ba de la yang cig shos med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gcig gi ngo bo nges pa dmigs pa khyod kyis bshad pa gang yin pa gcig dmigs pa des na ngo bo @208b gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa yin te /
translated: You have explained that when one observes a single nature, one does not observe another nature.

original: rang bzhin nges pa gcig dmigs pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin nges pa gcig dmigs pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: This is because one observes a single, ascertained nature.

original: de yang spangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang spangs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It does not mean that the other is excluded.

original: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar shes par bya dogs te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'di ltar shes par bya dogs te /
translated: One should understand this without a doubt.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni gal te gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par mi brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni gal te gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par mi brjod do //
translated: If it were not so, then if one did not say that the observation of one thing is the non-observation of another,

original: cig shos kyi ngo bo dmigs pa mi 'gog na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: cig shos kyi ngo bo dmigs pa mi 'gog na ni de'i tshe /
translated: then the observation of the nature of the other would not be refuted.

original: dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gang yin pa de med pa mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gang yin pa de med pa mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then that which is not refuted in terms of observation would not be established as nonexistent.

original: dmigs par dogs pa na med do zhes nges par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dmigs par dogs pa na med do zhes nges par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When there is doubt about observation, one cannot ascertain that it does not exist.

original: des na dmigs pa la ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na dmigs pa la ma bkag pa can med pa mi 'grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir gcig dmigs pas gzhan mi dmigs par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, since the non-existence of that which is not negated with respect to the observed object is not established, it is said that the observation of one thing negates the observation of another.

original: cig shos med par the tshom za ba yin na ni gcig gi rang bzhin nges pa dmigs par nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: cig shos med par the tshom za ba yin na ni gcig gi rang bzhin nges pa dmigs par nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If there is doubt about the non-existence of the other, then the observation of the nature of one thing is not ascertained.

original: de'i phyir gcig gi rang bzhin dmigs pas cig shos med par nges par 'phangs pa yin na cig shos ma dmigs pa 'phen par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig gi rang bzhin dmigs pas cig shos med par nges par 'phangs pa yin na cig shos ma dmigs pa 'phen par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the observation of the nature of one thing implies the ascertainment of the non-existence of the other, then the non-observation of the other is implied.

original: dmigs pa ma bkag na dngos po dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma bkag na dngos po dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if the observed object is not negated, then the thing cannot be negated.

original: gal te dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med par mi 'grub na /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa ma bkag pa can med par mi 'grub na /
translated: If the non-existence of that which is not negated with respect to the observed object is not established,

original: 'o na de ma thag pa kho nar rnam pa gcig myong ba las gzhan dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'o na de ma thag pa kho nar rnam pa gcig myong ba las gzhan dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad du 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de ci ltar yin te /
translated: then how is it that it was explained that the convention of the non-existence of the observed object arises from the experience of one aspect alone?

original: dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gyi dmigs pa yang med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig nyams su myong bar ma grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma bkag pa can gyi dmigs pa yang med par mi 'grub pa'i phyir rnam pa gcig nyams su myong bar ma grub par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of a cognition that does not block the object cannot be established as nonexistent, it follows that the aspect is not established as experienced.

original: dmigs pa bkag na yang de nyid las med pa'i tha snyad yin gyi rnam pa gcig nyams su myong ba la las ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa bkag na yang de nyid las med pa'i tha snyad yin gyi rnam pa gcig nyams su myong ba la las ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the object is blocked, then it is just the convention of nonexistence, not the experience of an aspect.

original: bden te / dmigs pa ma bkag par ni shes pa yang dgag par mi nus so //
analyzed: bden te / dmigs pa ma bkag par ni shes pa yang dgag par mi nus so //
translated: That is true, but without blocking the object, cognition cannot be blocked.

original: khyad par ni 'di yod do //
analyzed: khyad par ni 'di yod do //
translated: There is this difference:

original: shes pa ni dmigs pa las rang bzhin gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ni dmigs pa las rang bzhin gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Cognition is not essentially different from the object.

original: des na mi dmigs par nges pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad yin gyi /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs par nges pa nyid med pa'i tha snyad yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the certainty of nonapprehension is just the convention of nonexistence.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags las 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags las 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it arises from the evidence of nonapprehension.

original: mi dmigs par nges pa yang mngon sum nyid las yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs par nges pa yang mngon sum nyid las yin no //
translated: The certainty of nonapprehension is from perception itself.

original: der yang gang gis snga ma dang phyi mar skye bar bsam par bya ba rnam pa gcig dang gzhan med pa'i tha snyad dag tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: der yang gang gis snga ma dang phyi mar skye bar bsam par bya ba rnam pa gcig dang gzhan med pa'i tha snyad dag tha dad pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the conventional expressions “one and the same” and “different” do not apply to that which is conceived as arising in the prior and subsequent moments.

original: 'on kyang rnam pa gcig nges pa nyid shes pa gzhan dmigs pa med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa gcig nges pa nyid shes pa gzhan dmigs pa med par nges pa yin no //
translated: However, the ascertainment of one and the same aspect is the ascertainment of the other cognition as devoid of an object.

original: rnam pa gcig nges pa de yang mngon sum las yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gcig nges pa de yang mngon sum las yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of one and the same aspect is from direct perception.

original: des na shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad ni mngon sum nyid las yin gyi /
analyzed: des na shes pa gzhan med pa'i tha snyad ni mngon sum nyid las yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the conventional expression “no other cognition exists” is from direct perception itself.

original: mi dmigs pa las ni ma yin te /🔽rnam pa gcig @209a * //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las ni ma yin te / rnam pa gcig @209a * //
translated: It is not from nonapprehension,

original: tu nges pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tu nges pa las ma gtogs pa'i shes pa dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad med pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad las kyang dmigs pa med pa'i tha snyad gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, apart from the ascertainment of one and the same aspect, there is no conventional expression of a cognition devoid of an object, and because, apart from the conventional expression of an object as devoid of an object, there is no other conventional expression of an object as devoid of an object.

original: des na shes pa 'gog pa la yang dmigs pa dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa 'gog pa la yang dmigs pa dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in the cessation of cognition, the object is also to be negated.

original: de la mi dmigs pas ni med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pas ni med pa'i tha snyad byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that non-observation of that makes the expression of non-existence.

original: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid las yin pa'i phyir nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum nyid las yin pa'i phyir nyes pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: However, since it is direct perception itself, there is no opportunity for error.

original: de ltar don gzhan sgrub pa la yang dgag pa'i go bar byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar don gzhan sgrub pa la yang dgag pa'i go bar byed pa mi dmigs pa yin par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that non-observation is the comprehender of negation in the proof of a different object,

original: don gzhan dgag pa la yang bsgrub pa'i phyir gcig bkag pas zhes smos so //
analyzed: don gzhan dgag pa la yang bsgrub pa'i phyir gcig bkag pas zhes smos so //
translated: in order to prove that it is also the comprehender of negation in the negation of a different object, he says “by the negation of one.”

original: gang du gcig bkag pas gzhan med pa sgrub pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang du gcig bkag pas gzhan med pa sgrub pa de la ni /
translated: In that case, where the negation of one proves the non-existence of another,

original: mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rang bzhin du rab tu grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i gtan tshigs kyis rang bzhin du rab tu grub pa nyid de /
translated: the reason of non-observation is itself well established as the nature of the probandum,

original: dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa ni mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the negation is of the nature of non-observation.

original: dgag pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: dgag pa ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Negation is of the nature of the non-observation of appearance,

original: de yang gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs su bkod pa yin te /
translated: and that is posited as the reason.

original: des na mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin par grub po ;
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin par grub po ;
translated: Therefore, it is established that non-observation is the comprehender.

original: / don gzhan bkag pas don gzhan 'gog pa la ha cang thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: / don gzhan bkag pas don gzhan 'gog pa la ha cang thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor is there the absurd consequence that the negation of one thing negates another thing,

original: gang gi phyir don gzhan 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs de la yang gang zhig bkag pa gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba de dgag par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam gnyi ga ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gzhan 'gog pa'i gtan tshigs de la yang gang zhig bkag pa gtan tshigs su 'gyur ba de dgag par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gam gnyi ga ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: because in the negation of one thing, the reason is that which is negated, and that which is negated is either the cause or the effect of the reason, or it is neither.

original: gsum po de la re zhig gnyi ga ma yin pa med pas ni gzhan med par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gsum po de la re zhig gnyi ga ma yin pa med pas ni gzhan med par mi rigs te /
translated: Of these three, first, it is not tenable that the absence of one thing is the absence of another if the latter is neither the cause nor the effect of the former,

original: de ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no connection between them.

original: gnyis po phan tshun 'brel na ni 'gog par byed pa log na cig shos ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnyis po phan tshun 'brel na ni 'gog par byed pa log na cig shos ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the two are mutually related, then when the negating factor is reversed, the other is reversed.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the absence of one thing is the absence of another in any other way.

original: 'bras bu ma dmigs kyang rgyu de med par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma dmigs kyang rgyu de med par ga la 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Even if the effect is not observed, how could the cause be absent? It could not!

original: gang gi phyir rgyu ni nges pa kho nar 'bras bu dang 'brel par ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu ni nges pa kho nar 'bras bu dang 'brel par ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cause is not definitely related to the effect.

original: me yod kyang rgyu gzhan med pas du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me yod kyang rgyu gzhan med pas du ba mi skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though fire exists, smoke is not generated due to the absence of other causes.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to refute this, it is said:

original: nus pa mthu dang ldan pa rgyu yin gyi mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa mthu dang ldan pa rgyu yin gyi mi nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The cause is the potent, not the impotent.

original: des na gnas skabs gang na mi nus pa med pa de'i tshe ni rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: des na gnas skabs gang na mi nus pa med pa de'i tshe ni rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, when there is no impotence in a state, at that time it is not a cause.

original: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe ni skyed par byed pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nus pa de'i tshe ni skyed par byed pa kho na yin no //
translated: When it is potent, at that time it is only a producer.

original: des na gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: des na gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: Therefore, why is it said that it definitely does not possess that?

original: 'di snyam du nus pa yang 'ga' zhig gis nus pa 'joms pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du nus pa yang 'ga' zhig gis nus pa 'joms pa de'i phyir 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one thinks that potency is destroyed by something, then the effect would not exist.

original: nus pa la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: nus pa la ni zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, Potency is...

original: gal te nus pa nye ba can gyis bon la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe @209b bya rog la sogs pas sa bon la sogs pa zos pa na res 'ga' dgag byar yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa nye ba can gyis bon la sogs pa yang gang gi tshe @209b bya rog la sogs pas sa bon la sogs pa zos pa na res 'ga' dgag byar yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says that even seeds, etc. that possess potency are sometimes objects of negation when crows, etc. eat seeds, etc.

original: tha mi gnas skabs na yongs su 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha mi gnas skabs na yongs su 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: because at the time of the end, there is no transformation.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: sa bon la sogs pa ni tha ma'i gnas skabs nyid na nus pa yod pa yin la /
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa ni tha ma'i gnas skabs nyid na nus pa yod pa yin la /
translated: Seeds and so on have the capacity at the time of the end alone.

original: de la ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang 'brel pa ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur pa'i skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la ni yongs su 'gyur ba'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang 'brel pa ngo bo nyid gzhan du gyur pa'i skyed par byed pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: In that, there is no transformation that is the producer of a different nature, because it is connected with the condition of the cooperating cause.

original: skyes ma thag kho nar 'bras bu skyed par byed pas gegs med pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes ma thag kho nar 'bras bu skyed par byed pas gegs med pa yin no //
translated: Because it produces the effect immediately after arising, there is no obstruction.

original: gnas skabs snga ma rnams su yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs snga ma rnams su yongs su 'gyur ba la ltos pa'i phyir nus pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it depends on transformation in the previous states, it is not capable.

original: 'di snyam du tha ma'i skad cig nyid la gegs byed do snyam na ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du tha ma'i skad cig nyid la gegs byed do snyam na ;
translated: If you think that it obstructs at the time of the final moment,

original: bshad pa skad cig gcig la cha shas med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa skad cig gcig la cha shas med pa'i phyir te /
translated: then it is said that because it is partless in a single moment,

original: gang gis sngar nus pa med pa'i rgyu 'bras bu skyed pa la sdod pa na 'ga' zhig gis bsgrags par 'gyur ba snga phyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis sngar nus pa med pa'i rgyu 'bras bu skyed pa la sdod pa na 'ga' zhig gis bsgrags par 'gyur ba snga phyi ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the cause that previously lacked the ability to generate an effect now remains, it would be proclaimed by someone that the prior and subsequent states are not different.

original: de skyes pa na bar mchod pa kho nar ci tsam du gegs byed pa nye bar gnas pa de tsam nyid na 'bras bu skyes zin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gegs bya /
analyzed: de skyes pa na bar mchod pa kho nar ci tsam du gegs byed pa nye bar gnas pa de tsam nyid na 'bras bu skyes zin pa'i phyir gang gis gang la gegs bya /
translated: When it arises, since the effect has already arisen, what would obstruct what, to the extent that the obstruction remains for just as long?

original: 'di snyam du gal te mtshan nyid gcig la dbye ba med pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyi khyab pa kho nas gzhan gegs byed pa nyid yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te mtshan nyid gcig la dbye ba med pa de lta na yang rang bzhin gyi khyab pa kho nas gzhan gegs byed pa nyid yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that even if the characteristic is one and not different, still it is just the intrinsic nature that obstructs the other,🔽then Nāgārjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / 'bras bus skyed pa la mi mthun pa bskyed pa sgrub pa ni gegs gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'bras bus skyed pa la mi mthun pa bskyed pa sgrub pa ni gegs gang yin pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The definition of an obstruction is that which is established as generating a result that is incompatible with the generation of another.

original: gegs byed pa ni cung zhig byed pa yin la ;
analyzed: gegs byed pa ni cung zhig byed pa yin la ;
translated: Obstruction is the production of something else.

original: de yang rang bzhin khyad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin khyad par byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is the intrinsic nature that produces a difference.

original: de ni bdag nyid thams cad grub pa gcig la mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid thams cad grub pa gcig la mi 'thad de /
translated: That is untenable for a single thing that is established in all its aspects.

original: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of distinct things is that they have distinct natures.

original: rang bzhin gzhan byed pa yin na yang snga ma skyed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan byed pa yin na yang snga ma skyed pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it were to make another nature, then it would not generate the former.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: It is not like that.

original: gal te de ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par gegs su khas mi len gyi /🔽'on kyang tha dad pa'am dngos po med pa yin pa de'i tshe gegs byed pa zhes bya ba cung zad mi byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rang bzhin gyi khyad par gegs su khas mi len gyi / 'on kyang tha dad pa'am dngos po med pa yin pa de'i tshe gegs byed pa zhes bya ba cung zad mi byed par 'gyur la /
translated: If you do not accept that a specific nature is an obstruction,🔽then when it is distinct or non-existent, it would not perform the slightest obstruction.

original: cung zad mi byed pa de ni gegs yin par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: cung zad mi byed pa de ni gegs yin par mi 'thad de /
translated: And it is untenable that which does not perform the slightest function is an obstruction,

original: thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be no end.

original: des na cung zad mi byed pa ni gegs ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid gags yin pas /
analyzed: des na cung zad mi byed pa ni gegs ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi khyad par nyid gags yin pas /
translated: Therefore, because that which does not perform the slightest function is not an obstruction, a specific nature is an obstruction.

original: de ci'i phyir 'bras bu med pas rgyu med pa ma yin no zhes brjod ces bya ba'i pha rol gyi tshig gi dogs pa 'di bsu nas khas blangs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'bras bu med pas rgyu med pa ma yin no zhes brjod ces bya ba'i pha rol gyi tshig gi dogs pa 'di bsu nas khas blangs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to the opponent’s statement, “Why is it not the case that because it does not have an effect, it is without a cause?” he accepts this and explains.

original: de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni med par rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rgyu ni med par rtogs par 'gyur ba nyid de zhes 'brel to //
translated: The reason for this is that one understands that such a cause does not exist.

original: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma tha mar gyur pa nus pa yod @210a * //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma tha mar gyur pa nus pa yod @210a * //
translated: “ Such” refers to the last moment of the potency.

original: pa'o ; /'bras bu med pa las te ldog pa las so //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'bras bu med pa las te ldog pa las so //
translated: “ Without an effect” means without an object.

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dpe nye bar bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: “ For example” is for the purpose of teaching the example.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba'i chos can no //
translated: “ Here” is the subject.

original: khyim gyi dgar 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gyi dgar 'di na du ba'i rgyu nus pa thogs pa med pa gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: “ Here in the house, the cause of smoke, the unobstructed potency, does not exist” is the probandum.

original: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: du ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: “ Because there is no smoke” is the reason.

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang /
translated: This is the formulation of a proof of nonexistence.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa ma yin pa de'i tshe sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied when the cause is not characterized by the perception of an object.

original: 'di ltar blag ba med pa na 'dug pas du ba'i rgyu khyim gyi dgar na yod kyang blta bar mi nus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar blag ba med pa na 'dug pas du ba'i rgyu khyim gyi dgar na yod kyang blta bar mi nus la /
translated: Thus, when there is no smoke, the cause of smoke, even though it exists in the house, cannot be seen.

original: des bskyed pa'i du ba yang blag ba med pa'i yul de na 'thul ba yin pa na khyim gyi dgar de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa blag pa med pa na 'dug pas mthong ba'i steng gi cha dang ldan pa chos //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i du ba yang blag ba med pa'i yul de na 'thul ba yin pa na khyim gyi dgar de nyid kyi dbang du byas pa blag pa med pa na 'dug pas mthong ba'i steng gi cha dang ldan pa chos //
translated: The smoke produced by that is also seen rising in the place where the house is not, but the house is not there, in the place where the smoke is.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa sgrub byed du nye bar blangs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa sgrub byed du nye bar blangs te /
translated: The non-apprehension of the nature is adduced as the proof.

original: snang ba'i nam mkha'i yul na gnas pa'i du bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu khyim gyi dgar na med par rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: snang ba'i nam mkha'i yul na gnas pa'i du bskyed par byed pa'i rgyu khyim gyi dgar na med par rtogs par byed do //
translated: It is understood that the cause that produces the smoke that exists in the place of the visible sky is not in the house.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab par byed pa'i khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa lhag pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'bras bu de ni rgyu khyab par byed pa'i khyab pa dang ldog pa med pa lhag pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect that is like that is pervaded by the pervader that is the cause, and it is not the case that there is an exception to that.

original: ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi rang bzhin ni khyab par byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi rang bzhin ni khyab par byed pa yang yin te /
translated: The nature of the cause is also the pervader,

original: rang bzhin med par rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med par rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without the nature there is no cause.

original: ldog pa med cing lhag pa med pa yang yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu med par mi 'jug pas rgyu las ldog pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir rang gi lhag pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir ro //🔽ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi tha snyad byed do //
analyzed: ldog pa med cing lhag pa med pa yang yin pa de bzhin du 'bras bu yang rgyu khyab par byed pa dang / rgyu med par mi 'jug pas rgyu las ldog pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir rang gi lhag pa med pa yin pa de'i phyir ro // ji ltar rgyu'i rang gi tha snyad byed do //
translated: Just as the cause is not separate from its own effect and does not exceed its own effect, so too the effect is not separate from the cause and does not exceed the cause.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de mi dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: Thus, the non-apprehension of the effect is explained as the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'bras bu de dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi dmigs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du 'bras bu de dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de dmigs pa ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do zhes 'brel to //
translated: Just as there is non-apprehension of the effect, so too the apprehension of what is incompatible with that effect is explained as the non-apprehension of the nature.

original: de nyid kyi dper brjod pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dper brjod pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to illustrate that very point, he says For example, and so on.

original: de la chos can khyad par can gang la grang ba'i rgyu ni yod kyang rtogs pa po'i mngon sum ma yin la /
analyzed: de la chos can khyad par can gang la grang ba'i rgyu ni yod kyang rtogs pa po'i mngon sum ma yin la /
translated: There, the specific property possessor is where the cause of cold exists but is not the direct perception of the cognizer.

original: grang ba'i reg pa yang mi dmigs kyi rgyang ring po nas me ni snang ba'i yul de la 'di sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa yang mi dmigs kyi rgyang ring po nas me ni snang ba'i yul de la 'di sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The cold touch is not perceived, but the fire is applied to the place where the object of the appearance of fire is at a distance.

original: de la me mthong ba las grang ba'i reg pa ldog cing de las kyang de'i rgyu ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la me mthong ba las grang ba'i reg pa ldog cing de las kyang de'i rgyu ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cold touch is stopped by seeing the fire, and from that, its cause is stopped.

original: 'o na 'bras bu ldog pa rgyu med par go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na 'bras bu ldog pa rgyu med par go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: But if it is asked, “Why is the stopping of the effect not understood to be without a cause?”

original: bshad pa rgyu'i rdzas kyi spyi gang zhig 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa rnam pa gcig @210b tu 'dzin pa'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod de /
analyzed: bshad pa rgyu'i rdzas kyi spyi gang zhig 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du grags pa rnam pa gcig @210b tu 'dzin pa'i rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas 'bras bu mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa ma yin par brjod de /
translated: It is said: The stopping of the effect is not understood to be without a cause, in terms of the universal of the substance of the cause that is known in worldly convention, which is the characteristic of the continuity of the apprehension of one aspect.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dper brjod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de dper brjod pa'o //
translated: For example, etc. is the example of that.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa yang phyogs kyi bye brag la lar dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa yang phyogs kyi bye brag la lar dngos po med pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The non-perception of the cause is also the understanding of the non-existence of the thing in some particular place.

original: dper na mtsho chen po'i steng na yod pa'i rlangs pa la thag ring po nas du ba la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba na nges par bya ba'i phyir me med pa gtan tshigs su byed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na mtsho chen po'i steng na yod pa'i rlangs pa la thag ring po nas du ba la sogs pa'i dngos por the tshom za ba na nges par bya ba'i phyir me med pa gtan tshigs su byed pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when one is in doubt about whether the steam on the surface of a great lake is an entity such as smoke, in order to ascertain it, one uses the reason “absence of fire.”

original: mtsho chen po mi g-yo ba de na ni me'i 'dzel  ma tsam yang snang bar gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: mtsho chen po mi g-yo ba de na ni me'i 'dzel  ma tsam yang snang bar gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: For in that great lake, which is unmoving, not even the reflection of fire appears.

original: des na me med pa las 'bras bu med pa sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na me med pa las 'bras bu med pa sgrub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the absence of fire proves the absence of effect.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rang med pa kho na yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is, by the method explained above, the absence of intrinsic nature itself.

original: des de la ni dngos po med pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des de la ni dngos po med pa grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: For it does not establish the non-existence of the entity.

original: 'on kyang yul can med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par bzad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang yul can med pa'i tha snyad sgrub par bzad do //
translated: However, it does establish the convention of the absence of the possessor.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di'i nang du 'bras bu mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu 'gal ba mi dmigs pa dag rang nyid sdud par 'gyur ba des na de dag la la yang ltos nas med pa yang yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di'i nang du 'bras bu mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu 'gal ba mi dmigs pa dag rang nyid sdud par 'gyur ba des na de dag la la yang ltos nas med pa yang yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Since the non-observation of the result and the non-observation of the contradictory of the result are included within this non-observation of the nature itself, they are also explained as “non-observation in dependence on something else.”

original: de dag ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pas mtshon pa'i phyir dper brjod pa ni de'i ngo bo rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo khyab par byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de med pas ni dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bu mi dmigs pas mtshon pa'i phyir dper brjod pa ni de'i ngo bo rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo khyab par byed pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'i 'bras bu de med pas ni dngos po med pa bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since those are illustrated by the non-observation of the result, an example is stated: “Whatever result pervades the nature of the cause, that result is not existent, and the non-existence of that thing is to be proven.”

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu 'gal ba dmigs pa yang bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu 'gal ba dmigs pa yang bshad do //
translated: This also explains the observation of the contradictory of the result.

original: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pas de yang dper brjod pa'i don du bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yang rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus pas de yang dper brjod pa'i don du bshad pa /
translated: Similarly, the non-observation of the pervader is included within the non-observation of the nature itself, so that is also explained as the meaning of an example.

original: smra ba po gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos shing nyid mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba shing sha pa med par smra ba de'i tshe yang dngos po med par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: smra ba po gang gi tshe khyab par byed pa'i chos shing nyid mi dmigs pas khyab par bya ba shing sha pa med par smra ba de'i tshe yang dngos po med par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa nyid do //
translated: When the speaker, by not observing the pervading property “tree,” says that the pervaded property “śimśapā” is absent, then the non-existence of the thing is established.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de ltar zhes bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis 'ga' zhig bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas gzhan 'ga' zhig 'gog pa dang / 'gog pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa des na de ltar zhes bshad ma thag pa'i tshul gyis 'ga' zhig bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i sgo nas gzhan 'ga' zhig 'gog pa dang / 'gog pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Since that is the case, in that way, as just explained, by affirming or negating something, one negates something else, and in order to establish the expression of negation,

original: ji snyed go bar byed par blangs pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ji snyed go bar byed par blangs pa de thams cad ni mi dmigs pa kho na'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: whatever is taken to be understood is all of the nature of non-observation alone.

original: gang du 'ga' zhig 'gog pa de thams cad du dgag pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: gang du 'ga' zhig 'gog pa de thams cad du dgag pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs go bar byed pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: In all cases of negating something, there is no other means of understanding the reason for establishing the expression of negation.

original: bstan ma thag pa dgag pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul gang la yod pa'i mi dmigs pa de yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa dgag pa med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul gang la yod pa'i mi dmigs pa de yin gyi /
translated: The non-observation that exists in the domain of the just-explained expression of non-negation is that.

original: yod pa'i tha snyad zlog pa'i 'bras bu can gyi mi dmigs pa ni 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes khyad par du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad zlog pa'i 'bras bu can gyi mi dmigs pa ni 'di lta bu ma yin no zhes khyad par du ston pa yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension which has the result of negating the convention of existence is not like this.

original: sbyor ba ni sgra'i byed pa'am gtan tshigs kyi @211a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni sgra'i byed pa'am gtan tshigs kyi @211a * //
translated: The application is the function of the word or the function of the reason.

original: byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa nyid do //
translated: The function of the word is the function of the reason.

original: sgra'i byed pa de'i bye brag gis sam /
analyzed: sgra'i byed pa de'i bye brag gis sam /
translated: By the particular of that function of the word,

original: yang na sbyar bar bya ba'i mi dmigs pa de'i byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /🔽'di ltar de ni res 'ga' don gzhan sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug la /
analyzed: yang na sbyar bar bya ba'i mi dmigs pa de'i byed pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te / 'di ltar de ni res 'ga' don gzhan sgrub pa'i sgo nas 'jug la /
translated: or by the particular of the function of the non-apprehension which is to be applied, there are four kinds.🔽Thus, it is fourfold because sometimes it operates by the affirmation of another object,

original: don gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: don gzhan dgag pa'i sgo nas kyang 'jug pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: and sometimes by the negation of another object.

original: de nyid kyi dper brjod pa ni 'gal ba sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dper brjod pa ni 'gal ba sgrub pa'o //
translated: An example of that is the establishment of the contradictory.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: For example, it is like saying, “Here there is no cold touch,

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: because there is fire.”

original: dngos po med pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang yul gang la sbyar bar bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang yul gang la sbyar bar bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
translated: This application of the non-existent thing is also that which is to be applied to a certain object, and that has already been shown.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yang 'gal ba grub ba'i nang du 'dus par ston te dper brjod pa yang ba mo'i rig pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya bas ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba yang 'gal ba grub ba'i nang du 'dus par ston te dper brjod pa yang ba mo'i rig pa med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “this is also” shows that the contradiction of a pervader is included in the contradiction of a probandum. The example is “There is no awareness of cold.”

original: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: me yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: The phrase “because there is fire” is the reason.

original: ba mo'i rig pa mngon sum yin pa dang grang ba'i rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi dmigs kyi me ni mngon sum nyid yin te /
analyzed: ba mo'i rig pa mngon sum yin pa dang grang ba'i rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo yang mi dmigs kyi me ni mngon sum nyid yin te /
translated: The awareness of cold is direct perception, and the nature of the awareness of cold is not perceived. But fire is direct perception.

original: des ni grang ba'i reg pa ldog la de la log na ba mo'i rig pa yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des ni grang ba'i reg pa ldog la de la log na ba mo'i rig pa yang ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it stops the contact of cold, and when that stops, the awareness of cold stops.

original: 'di ni 'gal ba grub pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba grub pa nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: This is included in the contradiction of a probandum.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de grub pa ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de grub pa ni rnam pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The contradiction of an effect is the second kind of contradiction.

original: gang du grang ba'i reg pa dang me lkog tu gyur pa der du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di gtan tshigs su len pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du grang ba'i reg pa dang me lkog tu gyur pa der du ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhes 'di gtan tshigs su len pa yin te /
translated: The example is “Because there is smoke where the contact of cold and fire is hidden.”

original: yul de la dngos po med pa'i sgrub pa 'di sbyor ro //
analyzed: yul de la dngos po med pa'i sgrub pa 'di sbyor ro //
translated: This proof of the non-existence of the object is applied to that.

original: 'di gnyis ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni sgrub pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: These two are the modes of proof.

original: gsum pa dgag pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa dgag pa'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The third, in order to teach the mode of negation,

original: bshad pa rgyu ma grub pa'i dper brjod pa ston par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa rgyu ma grub pa'i dper brjod pa ston par byed pa ni dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: the explanation of the example of the unestablished reason is shown by “For example,” and so on.

original: yul gang la 'di la sbyar bar bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: yul gang la 'di la sbyar bar bya ba de ni bstan zin to //
translated: The object to which this is to be applied has already been taught.

original: mi dmigs pa bzhi ba'i rnam pa ston pa ni rang bzhin ma grub pa ni dper na zhes dper brjod do //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa bzhi ba'i rnam pa ston pa ni rang bzhin ma grub pa ni dper na zhes dper brjod do //
translated: The teaching of the mode of the non-observation of the nature is by way of the example, “For example,” and so on.

original: 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di na zhes bya ba ni chos can no zhes bya ba la sogs pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the subject is called “this.”

original: da ni sbyor ba gzhan rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa ston pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni sbyor ba gzhan rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di nyid kyi nang du 'dus pa ston pa ni 'dis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to show that the other syllogisms are included within this very non-observation of the nature, he says, “By this,” and so on.

original: shing sha pa'i khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin shing nyid de /
analyzed: shing sha pa'i khyab par byed pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin shing nyid de /
translated: The nature of the pervader of the tree, which is the property of the subject, is treeness.

original: de ma grub pa yang 'di nyid kyis bshad par blta'o //
analyzed: de ma grub pa yang 'di nyid kyis bshad par blta'o //
translated: This very [argument] should be seen as explaining the non-establishment of that [thesis].

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod ba'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni dper brjod ba'o //
translated: For example is an illustration.

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang gang gi tshe ri mthon po gnyis la gcig la ni shing gi tshogs mthong la de'i shing gi khyad par mi rtogs pa na ri gnyis pa de la shing sha pa med par nges par mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang gang gi tshe ri mthon po gnyis la gcig la ni shing gi tshogs mthong la de'i shing gi khyad par mi rtogs pa na ri gnyis pa de la shing sha pa med par nges par mi nus te /
translated: This proof of non-existence, when one sees a collection of trees on one of two high mountains but does not ascertain the particular tree, one is not able to ascertain the non-existence of a śimśapā tree on the second mountain,

original: @211b shing sha pa ni snang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @211b shing sha pa ni snang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the śimśapā tree is not visible.

original: shing ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur ba yin pa'i phyir de med par nges nus pa de'i tshe blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: shing ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur ba yin pa'i phyir de med par nges nus pa de'i tshe blta bar bya ste /
translated: When one is able to ascertain the non-existence of the tree because the tree has the characteristic of being perceptible, then one should look

original: des na khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba la ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa med pas khyab par bya ba la ldog pa yin no //
translated: and see that the pervaded is reversed due to the absence of the pervader.

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di thams cad ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul las gzhan du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di thams cad ni snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul las gzhan du rig par bya ste /
translated: All of these proofs of non-existence should be known to be different from the object of non-apprehension of appearance.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul la ni dngos po med pa grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul la ni dngos po med pa grub zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in the case of the object of non-apprehension of appearance, the non-existence of entity is already established.

original: yul yang dpe brjod pa dag tu ci lta ci ltar bstan zin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul yang dpe brjod pa dag tu ci lta ci ltar bstan zin pa bzhin no //
translated: And the object is just as it has been explained in the examples.

original: tha snyad sgrub ba la ni khyad par med pa zhes bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: tha snyad sgrub ba la ni khyad par med pa zhes bya bar rigs so //
translated: And in the establishment of convention, it is proper to say that there is no distinction.

original: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na la snang du rung ba dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs pa kho na la snang du rung ba dgag par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is only the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality that is the object to be refuted in the case of the suitability of appearance,

original: mi dmig pa'i sbyor ba gsum po dag la dgag bya snang du mi rung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi dmig pa'i sbyor ba gsum po dag la dgag bya snang du mi rung ba ma yin nam /
translated: are not the three kinds of non-apprehension of non-existence unsuitable as objects to be refuted?

original: 'gal ba'am / de'i 'bras bu la ni 'gal ba'i don snang du mi rung ba yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba'am / de'i 'bras bu la ni 'gal ba'i don snang du mi rung ba yin la /
translated: In the case of contradiction, the meaning of contradiction is unsuitable as an object to be refuted.

original: rgyu med pa la yang 'bras bu snang du mi rung ba dgag par bya ba yin te snang du rung ba nyid yin na ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa la yang 'bras bu snang du mi rung ba dgag par bya ba yin te snang du rung ba nyid yin na ni rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid rab tu sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And in the case of the absence of cause, the effect is unsuitable as an object to be refuted, because if it were suitable, the non-apprehension of intrinsic reality would be applied.

original: snang du mi rung ba 'gog pa yang snang ba mi dmigs pa ma yin na /
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba 'gog pa yang snang ba mi dmigs pa ma yin na /
translated: And the refutation of the unsuitable is not the non-apprehension of appearance.
