original: de ci ltar sbyor ba bzhi ka la snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar sbyor ba bzhi ka la snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid go bar byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does the non-apprehension of an appearance in all four modes of activity make one understand?

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tu dgag bya snang du mi rung ba nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu dgag bya snang du mi rung ba nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it were impossible for the object of negation to appear in some cases,

original: thams cad du snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid go bar byed pa yin par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: thams cad du snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid go bar byed pa yin par mi 'gyur na /
translated: then the non-apprehension of an appearance would not make one understand in all cases.

original: med pa dang tha snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang gang zhig 'gog pa de dang ni mi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: med pa dang tha snyad sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang gang zhig 'gog pa de dang ni mi dmigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: But in all these cases of non-apprehension, which establishes the non-existence and the convention, one should understand that there is non-apprehension of the object of negation.

original: rang bzhin ci lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: snang ba'i don las gzhan du gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams /
analyzed: snang ba'i don las gzhan du gyur pa'i dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams /
translated: It is the non-apprehension of the causes of the apprehension of an object which is different from the appearing object.

original: gang zhig mi dmigs pa na yod pa ste de 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mi dmigs pa na yod pa ste de 'dra ba'o //
translated: When that is apprehended, it exists; it is like that.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i mi dmigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: One should understand that it is the non-apprehension which has the characteristic of an apprehension.

original: 'dir 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang dmigs par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad kyi 'on kyang dmigs par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, not only that, but also the apprehension should be understood.

original: gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gang dag ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: de dag dang de dang 'gal ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag dang de dang 'gal ba dag go //
translated: and those that are incompatible with them.

original: gsum pa rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dper brjod pa la ni dgag par bya ba 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams de dag ces bya bas ston par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum pa rgyu mi dmigs pa'i dper brjod pa la ni dgag par bya ba 'bras bu'i khyad par rnams de dag ces bya bas ston par byed pa yin la /
translated: In the third example of nonobservation of a cause, the objects of negation, the specific effects, are indicated by “those.🔽”

original: 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa gnyis po dag la ni dgag par bya ba 'gal zla dag de dag las 'gal ba zhes bya bas brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i dper brjod pa gnyis po dag la ni dgag par bya ba 'gal zla dag de dag las 'gal ba zhes bya bas brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the two examples of incompatible observation, the objects of negation, the incompatible phenomena, are indicated by “those that are incompatible with them.🔽”

original: de dag ces bya ba sbyar ba ni 'gal ba dang de'i 'bras bu dag brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba sbyar ba ni 'gal ba dang de'i 'bras bu dag brjod pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “those” is used to indicate both incompatible phenomena and their effects.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i sbyor ba la /🔽dgag bya rgyu dang @212a * //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa'i sbyor ba la / dgag bya rgyu dang @212a * //
translated: In the syllogism of the observation of an effect of an incompatible phenomenon,🔽the object of negation is incompatible with the cause,

original: 'gal ba yin gyi 'bras bu dang ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'gal ba yin gyi 'bras bu dang ni ma yin na /
translated: but not with the effect.

original: de ji ltar na de dag dang 'gal ba'i sgra dgag bya la brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na de dag dang 'gal ba'i sgra dgag bya la brjod ce na /
translated: So how can the word “incompatible” in the statement of the reason refer to the object of negation?

original: brgyud pa ste de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir de yang 'gal bar brjod pas nyes ba med do //
analyzed: brgyud pa ste de'i rgyu dang 'gal ba'i phyir de yang 'gal bar brjod pas nyes ba med do //
translated: Since the effect is indirectly incompatible with the cause, it is also called “incompatible.” There is no error.

original: dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dag ni snang du mi rung ba la ni med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dag ni snang du mi rung ba la ni med do //
translated: The non-apprehension of an object and the non-apprehension of an appearance are not possible in what is not suitable to appear.

original: des bltar rung ba'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: des bltar rung ba'i zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “that which is suitable to be seen.”

original: de dag dang 'gal ba bltar rung ba dag kho na de ltar gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag dang 'gal ba bltar rung ba dag kho na de ltar gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that only those which are suitable to be seen are like that, i.e., are negated,

original: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: but not others. This is the meaning.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te bltar rung ba kho na'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'gal ba dag kho na dgag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te bltar rung ba kho na'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'gal ba dag kho na dgag pa yin gyi /
translated: The meaning is this: Only that which is suitable to be seen is the object of negation, i.e., the effect, the nature, the contradiction, and the cause.

original: bltar mi rung ba ni dgag bya ma yin te /
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba ni dgag bya ma yin te /
translated: That which is not suitable to be seen is not the object of negation.

original: gang gi phyir snang du rung ba dag kho na dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs par srid pa des na snang du mi rung ba ni dgag bya ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snang du rung ba dag kho na dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs par srid pa des na snang du mi rung ba ni dgag bya ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because only that which is suitable to appear is possible as the non-apprehension of an object and the non-apprehension of an appearance, therefore that which is not suitable to appear is not the object of negation.

original: gang dag bltar rung ba'i de dag ma grub pa dang / bltar rung ba'i de dag dang 'gal ba dag grub pa zhes ci rigs par 'brel par byed pa de dag gi ltar na khyad par don med de gzhan ni dmigs par mi 'thad pas snang du rung ba kho na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag bltar rung ba'i de dag ma grub pa dang / bltar rung ba'i de dag dang 'gal ba dag grub pa zhes ci rigs par 'brel par byed pa de dag gi ltar na khyad par don med de gzhan ni dmigs par mi 'thad pas snang du rung ba kho na dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who say that the non-establishment of the visible is established, and the establishment of the visible is contradictory, should be told that the distinction is meaningless, because the visible is the only object that can be perceived, since it is not tenable that anything else is perceived.

original: gang las snang du rung ba dag kho na dgag par bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa thams cad la dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa kho nar rigs par bya ba'i nges pa
analyzed: gang las snang du rung ba dag kho na dgag par bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ba med pa sgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa thams cad la dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa kho nar rigs par bya ba'i nges pa
translated: In all cases of non-apprehension as proof, the object to be negated should be understood to be only the visible, because the object to be negated is not apprehended, and because the visible is not apprehended.

original: 'di nyid ga las she na /
analyzed: 'di nyid ga las she na /
translated: Why is this so?

original: don gyi shugs kyis so //
analyzed: don gyi shugs kyis so //
translated: It is so by the force of the meaning.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhan dag la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: It is the statement “in the case of others.”

original: dmigs pa dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang bral ba dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang 'gal ba de dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang bral ba dag la ni rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa dang med pa dang 'gal ba de dag mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in the case of the non-apprehension of the existent and the apprehensible, the existence and non-existence of cause and effect are contradictory and not established.

original: gang dag dmigs pa dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa de dag la ni 'di gsum ka yang mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: gang dag dmigs pa dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa de dag la ni 'di gsum ka yang mi 'grub bo //
translated: But in the case of the non-apprehension of the existent and the apprehensible, all three are not established.

original: 'di ltar yod pa dag gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir ni 'gal bar rtogs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa dag gzhan yod na med pa'i phyir ni 'gal bar rtogs la /
translated: Thus, the existence of one thing is understood to be contradictory to the existence of another, because of the non-existence of one when the other exists.

original: yong pa dag nyid gzhan med na med pa las ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs so //
analyzed: yong pa dag nyid gzhan med na med pa las ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs so //
translated: And the existence of one thing is understood to be the cause and effect of another, because of the non-existence of one when the other does not exist.

original: 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras du rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu yod pa dang med par nges pa yang mthong ba dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras du rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu yod pa dang med par nges pa yang mthong ba dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs ba'i rgyu mtshan can yin te /
translated: The ascertainment of existence and non-existence, which is the cause of the establishment of contradiction and cause and effect, is based on the non-apprehension of the visible and the apprehensible.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yod pa dang med pa nges pa dag kha na 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bur grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba dang bltar rung ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yod pa dang med pa nges pa dag kha na 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bur grub pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of existence and nonexistence that is concomitant with the nonapprehension of what is visible and what is suitable to be seen is established as the effect of the reason.

original: de 'dra ba dag kyang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dag kyang bltar rung ba'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: And such things are only of the nature of what is suitable to be seen.

original: de bzhin du dngos po @212b med pa yang gnyi ga las grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po @212b med pa yang gnyi ga las grub pa yin la /
translated: In the same way, the nonexistence of a thing is established from both,

original: gnyi ga yang bltar rung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang bltar rung ba kho na yin no //
translated: and both are only what is suitable to be seen.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pa la khyab bya bltar rung ba kho na med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni khyab bar byed pa mi dmigs pa la khyab bya bltar rung ba kho na med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood to explain the meaning of the statement, “In the nonapprehension of a pervader, the pervaded that is suitable to be seen is only nonexistent.”

original: 'di ltar rim dang rim ma yin pa mi dmigs na yang yod pa nyid dang / shing med na shing sha pa med par grub pas chos gnyis khyab bya khyab byed du grub la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rim dang rim ma yin pa mi dmigs na yang yod pa nyid dang / shing med na shing sha pa med par grub pas chos gnyis khyab bya khyab byed du grub la /
translated: In this way, even when the nonapprehension of order and disorder is ascertained, existence and nonexistence are established as the pervaded and the pervader.

original: de med par grub pa yang snang ba dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de med par grub pa yang snang ba dang snang ba mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: And the establishment of their nonexistence is concomitant with the apprehension of appearance and the nonapprehension of what is not seen.

original: des na khyab bya bltar rung ba nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: des na khyab bya bltar rung ba nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, one realizes that the pervasion is suitable to be seen.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te sbyor ba'i dus na dgag bya bltar mi rung ba de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba'i dus na dgag bya bltar mi rung ba de lta na yang /
translated: Even though at the time of the application the object of negation is not suitable to be seen,🔽at the time of apprehending the object of negation, the nonobservation of the appearance of the object of negation is the cause for ascertaining the nonexistence of the object of negation.

original: 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa 'bras bu dang khyab bya med pa'i yul can gang yin pa de nyid las dngos po med par🔽nges pa yin te /🔽de sbyor ba'i dus su ma dran na ni 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur na 'gal ba mthong ba dang rgyu med pa dang khyab par byed pa med pa las
analyzed: 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa 'bras bu dang khyab bya med pa'i yul can gang yin pa de nyid las dngos po med par nges pa yin te / de sbyor ba'i dus su ma dran na ni 'gal ba dang rgyu dang 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po rtogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur na 'gal ba mthong ba dang rgyu med pa dang khyab par byed pa med pa las
translated: This is because if one does not recall the nonobservation of the object of negation at the time of the application, one will not realize the object of negation as being contradictory, cause and effect, or the pervaded and pervader.

original: cig shos med par rtogs par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: cig shos med par rtogs par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: If one does not realize the object of negation as being contradictory, cause and effect, or the pervaded and pervader, how could one realize the absence of one thing from seeing the absence of another, or from the absence of a cause, or from the absence of a pervader?

original: 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bur rtogs pa'i don la mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa na ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba dang khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bur rtogs pa'i don la mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa na ni /
translated: When one follows the non-apprehension of the object of the understanding of contradiction, pervaded and pervader, cause and effect,

original: de nyid kyis cig shos med pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de nyid kyis cig shos med pa rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: then by that very fact one understands the absence of the other.

original: 'gal btsam rgyu dang khyab par byed pa med pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal btsam rgyu dang khyab par byed pa med pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not merely the contradiction, or the mere absence of the cause and the pervader.

original: des na de ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba thams cad snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub pa'i mi dmigs pa 'di thams cad la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas sbyor ba thams cad snang ba mi dmigs pa'i nang du 'dus par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this non-apprehension which proves the expression of non-existence in that way is explained as included in the non-apprehension of appearance in all the syllogisms beginning with “all this.”

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: rnam 'grel las /
translated: In the Pramanavarttika it is said:

original: gzhan du chos gcig yod brjod pas //
analyzed: gzhan du chos gcig yod brjod pas //
translated: By saying that one thing exists in a certain place,

original: gzhan med de nyid gang gis rtogs //🔽gal te 'gal las yin de yang //
analyzed: gzhan med de nyid gang gis rtogs // gal te 'gal las yin de yang //
translated: how is the non-existence of another known?🔽If it is from contradiction, how is that established?

original: cis grub / lhan cig mi gnas ba'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: cis grub / lhan cig mi gnas ba'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is because they do not coexist,

original: de gang las 'dod /
analyzed: de gang las 'dod /
translated: from what is that accepted?

original: snang ba mthong med phyir zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba mthong med phyir zhe na /
translated: If it is because appearance is not seen,

original: de ni mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bshad nas /
analyzed: de ni mtshan nyid ma yin zhes bshad nas /
translated: That is not the definition.🔽Finally,

original: tha mar ; thams cad du ni sbyor ba nyid //
analyzed: tha mar ; thams cad du ni sbyor ba nyid //
translated: It is applied in all cases.

original: tha dad don la tha dad med //
analyzed: tha dad don la tha dad med //
translated: There is no difference in the non-difference of different objects.

original: ces bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no /
translated: This is the explanation.🔽All negations are from non-apprehension,

original: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: dgag pa gang ji snyed pa ni mi dmigs pa las yin no zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: and so on up to:🔽All that is understood is of the nature of non-apprehension.

original: go bar byed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis dgag pa thams cad ni @213a * //
analyzed: go bar byed pa thams cad ni mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i mthar thug pa'i gzhung gis dgag pa thams cad ni @213a * //
translated: This final passage expresses the meaning that all negations

original: mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: are preceded by non-apprehension.

original: rnam 'grel las /🔽tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
analyzed: rnam 'grel las / tshad mas grub par smra rnams kyi //
translated: The Pramii(laviirttikam) says:🔽For those who speak of establishment by valid cognition,

original: don gyis zlog pa nyid las yin //🔽zhes bshad do //
analyzed: don gyis zlog pa nyid las yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: it is just the opposite.🔽This is the explanation.

original: bshad zin pa de nyid don bsdus pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: bshad zin pa de nyid don bsdus pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to summarize what has already been explained, it is said:

original: snang ba mthong ba med pa dang // dngos po mi dmigs pa la ni //
analyzed: snang ba mthong ba med pa dang // dngos po mi dmigs pa la ni //
translated: In the non-perception of appearance and the non-apprehension of things,

original: rgyu mi srid par gyur pa na //
analyzed: rgyu mi srid par gyur pa na //
translated: when the cause becomes impossible,

original: dngos po med pa dgag pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa dgag pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will understand the negation of non-entity.

original: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba la ni snang ba mthong ba med pa yin no //🔽'di ltar de la dngos po gcig snang ba na rang bzhin gzhan snang ba nyid du khas blangs ba'i mthong ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba'i sbyor ba la ni snang ba mthong ba med pa yin no // 'di ltar de la dngos po gcig snang ba na rang bzhin gzhan snang ba nyid du khas blangs ba'i mthong ba med pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the application of the contradictory, which is the non-perception of entity and the mutual exclusion of natures, there is the non-perception of the appearance.

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: Thus, in that case, when one entity appears, there is the non-perception of the appearance of another nature, as has been previously explained.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba la ni rgyu mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa dang lhan cig mi gnas pa'i 'gal ba la ni rgyu mi srid pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the contradictory, which is the non-perception of cause and the non-coexistence, there is the impossibility of cause.

original: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i mes kyang rgyu bzlog pa'i sgo nas grang ba'i reg pa bzlog pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gal ba'i mes kyang rgyu bzlog pa'i sgo nas grang ba'i reg pa bzlog pa yin no zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, as has been previously explained, even the fire of contradiction, by the exclusion of cause, excludes the contact of cold.

original: de'i phyir de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni sngar bshad pa'i don mtha' dag sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni sngar bshad pa'i don mtha' dag sdud pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this verse summarizes the entire meaning of the previous explanation.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de dmigs pas kyang 'gal ba cig shos med par nges na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu de dmigs pas kyang 'gal ba cig shos med par nges na /
translated: If you determine the absence of one of a pair of contradictory effects by observing the other effect,

original: 'gal ba de'i rgyu dmigs pas kyang med par ci ste ma nges /
analyzed: 'gal ba de'i rgyu dmigs pas kyang med par ci ste ma nges /
translated: then why don’t you determine the absence of the cause of that contradiction by observing its effect?

original: rgyus kyang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar nye bar 'jog go snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rgyus kyang 'bras bu gdon mi za bar nye bar 'jog go snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The point is that you think that the cause necessarily produces the effect.

original: de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so,

original: rgyu de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de ni 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause is mistaken.

original: rgyu ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yin no zhes dper brjod pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
analyzed: rgyu ni 'bras bu la 'khrul pa yin no zhes dper brjod pa ni dper na 'di na grang ba'i reg pa med de /
translated: The cause is mistaken with regard to the effect. For example, it is like the following analogy: Here, cold is not absent because wood exists,

original: shing yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because wood is seen.

original: shing mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rgyu de dmigs pa ni 'bras bu'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shing mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rgyu de dmigs pa ni 'bras bu'i go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The observation of such a cause does not prove the effect,

original: rtsom par ma nges pas so //
analyzed: rtsom par ma nges pas so //
translated: because the cause is not necessarily produced.

original: des na gang du grang ba bzlog par bya ba grang ba zlog pa'i me gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang du grang ba bzlog par bya ba grang ba zlog pa'i me gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, where cold is to be removed, fire, which removes cold, does not necessarily occur.

original: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi skad cig ma la ni 'khrul pa med do /
analyzed: tha ma'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyi skad cig ma la ni 'khrul pa med do /
translated: There is no error in the final moment of the particular state.

original: des na de las 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes dogs na ma yin te zhes 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: des na de las 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes dogs na ma yin te zhes 'gog par byed do //
translated: Therefore, if you suspect that the effect is inferred from that, he refutes that, saying “No!”

original: skad cig ma tha mar gyur pa'i rgyus ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma tha mar gyur pa'i rgyus ni 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa ma yin no //
translated: The effect is not inferred from the cause that is the final moment.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bshad pa / mtha'i skad cig de las 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdod pa dus 'gor ba ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / mtha'i skad cig de las 'bras bu skye ba gang yin pa de ni sdod pa dus 'gor ba ste /
translated: He explains: That effect which arises from that final moment is delayed, enduring for a while.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist.

original: mdor bstan pa'i tshig de nyid rgyas par rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir mtha'i skad cig gi bar du ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: mdor bstan pa'i tshig de nyid rgyas par rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir mtha'i skad cig gi bar du ni zhes smos so //
translated: In order to fully explain the words of the brief presentation, he says, “up to the final moment.”

original: 'di la rgyu'i rgyun gyi mtha'i skad cig las sngon rol gyi skad cig gang yin pa de dag la ni 'bras @213b bu skyed pa la gegs byed pa srid de /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu'i rgyun gyi mtha'i skad cig las sngon rol gyi skad cig gang yin pa de dag la ni 'bras @213b bu skyed pa la gegs byed pa srid de /
translated: In this regard, it is possible that the effect is obstructed from arising from the moments prior to the final moment of the continuum of the cause.

original: des na de dag las 'bras bu rjes su mi dpog go //
analyzed: des na de dag las 'bras bu rjes su mi dpog go //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not inferred from those.

original: mtha'i skad cig la ni rnam par dbyer med pa'i phyir gegs med de /
analyzed: mtha'i skad cig la ni rnam par dbyer med pa'i phyir gegs med de /
translated: There is no obstruction to the final moment because it is not divisible.

original: des na de kho na las 'bras bu rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: des na de kho na las 'bras bu rjes su dpog go //
translated: Therefore, the effect is inferred from that alone.

original: des na mtha'i skad cig de nyid ni rtags yin la /
analyzed: des na mtha'i skad cig de nyid ni rtags yin la /
translated: Therefore, that final moment is the reason.

original: de'i mthong ba de las rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa skye'o //
analyzed: de'i mthong ba de las rjes su dpag par bya ba rtogs pa skye'o //
translated: From the seeing of that, the arising of the understanding of the object to be inferred occurs.

original: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig las she na /🔽'brel pa dran pa ni rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig las she na / 'brel pa dran pa ni rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: From what kind of special [seeing]?

original: de la ltos pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa las so //
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i mthong ba gang yin pa las so //
translated: From the seeing that depends on the memory of the relation.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: skad cig tha ma'i rgyu yod na mthong ba skye la /
analyzed: skad cig tha ma'i rgyu yod na mthong ba skye la /
translated: If the cause of the final moment exists, seeing arises.

original: mthong ba'i 'og tu ni rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa dran no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i 'og tu ni rtags dang rtags can gyi 'brel pa dran no //
translated: After seeing, the relation between the reason and the property possessor is remembered.

original: dran pas par du chod pa'i rtags mthong ba las ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba rtogs te /
analyzed: dran pas par du chod pa'i rtags mthong ba las ni rjes su dpag bar bya ba rtogs te /
translated: From the seeing of the reason that is remembered, the object to be inferred is understood.

original: des na dang por rgyu skad cig gnyis pa la mthong ba /
analyzed: des na dang por rgyu skad cig gnyis pa la mthong ba /
translated: Therefore, first, the seeing of the cause in the second moment,

original: mthong ba'i dus de nyid du skyes pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba dran pa bas kyang snga bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus de nyid du skyes pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum yin pa'i phyir 'brel ba dran pa bas kyang snga bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the effect that is produced at the very time of seeing is manifest, the relation would be prior to the memory.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni mtha'i skad cig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni mtha'i skad cig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught: “The final moment” and so on.

original: rtags mthong zhing 'brel pa yang dran pa na rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni nges pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags mthong zhing 'brel pa yang dran pa na rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa gang yin pa 'di ni nges pa yin te /
translated: When the sign is seen and the relation is remembered, the inference engages, and this is the ascertainment.

original: 'brel pa dran pa la mi ltos par rtags 'ba' zhig gam mthong ba las kyang ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa dran pa la mi ltos par rtags 'ba' zhig gam mthong ba las kyang ni ma yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not the case that it is not dependent on the memory of the relation, or that it is only from the sign that is seen.

original: 'di snyam du dper na me mngon sum pa la rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du dper na me mngon sum pa la rjes su dpog pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: One might think as follows: Just as the perception of fire is not an inference,

original: 'bras bu mngon sum pa la ni rjes su mi dpog gi / lkog tu gyur pa la ni rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum pa la ni rjes su mi dpog gi / lkog tu gyur pa la ni rjes su dpog par 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: in the same way, the perception of the effect is not an inference, but the hidden phenomenon is inferred.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond: “Whose perception” and so on.

original: 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa gang yin pa de la ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa gang yin pa de la ni mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the effect is not directly perceived, then the relation of cause and effect cannot be ascertained by means of perception and nonapprehension.

original: gal te yang me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mthong ba yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang me dang du ba dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por mthong ba yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if fire and smoke are seen to be related as cause and effect,

original: ji srid 'bras bu ma mthong ba de srid du ni mtha' nyid du yang nges pa mi nus na rgyu lta ci smos /
analyzed: ji srid 'bras bu ma mthong ba de srid du ni mtha' nyid du yang nges pa mi nus na rgyu lta ci smos /
translated: as long as the effect is not seen, it is impossible to ascertain that it is the end of the causal process, let alone that it is the cause.

original: 'di ltar skad cig ni re zhig tshu rol mthong bas rnam par dbye bar nus ba yin pa nyid yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig ni re zhig tshu rol mthong bas rnam par dbye bar nus ba yin pa nyid yin /
translated: For the moment, the mere separation of the two can be ascertained by seeing them at different times.

original: de'i nus pa rnam par dbye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de'i nus pa rnam par dbye ba lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention the separation of their capacities?

original: 'bras bu snang ba yin na ni gang gi phyir 'bras bu skyes pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'i gnas skabs tha ma yin no zhes nges par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu snang ba yin na ni gang gi phyir 'bras bu skyes pa'i phyir 'di ni 'di'i gnas skabs tha ma yin no zhes nges par nus kyi /
translated: If the effect were to appear, then it would be possible to ascertain that this is the final stage of the cause because the effect has arisen.

original: 'bras bu med bar na nges pa med do zhes 'chad pa ni 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa la ni rgyu'i dngos bor rtogs pa med @214a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu med bar na nges pa med do zhes 'chad pa ni 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa la ni rgyu'i dngos bor rtogs pa med @214a * //
translated: The explanation that “if there is no effect, there is no ascertainment” means that if the effect is not directly perceived, the thing that is the cause is not ascertained.

original: do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that “there is no certainty that there is no effect” means that there is no cognition of the thing that is the cause when the effect is not manifest.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyu las 'bras bu mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the effect is not established from a momentary cause.

original: gal te dngos po mthong ba rang gi 'bras bu dang 'gal ba zlog par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po mthong ba rang gi 'bras bu dang 'gal ba zlog par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If the seen thing does not stop the effect that is incompatible with it,

original: 'on ni me yang rang gi 'bras bu lus yongs su gdung ba'i 'gal zla grang ba'i reg pas byas pa'i yul la zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa'i go bar byed par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on ni me yang rang gi 'bras bu lus yongs su gdung ba'i 'gal zla grang ba'i reg pas byas pa'i yul la zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa'i go bar byed par mi 'gyur na /
translated: then fire would not stop the effect that is incompatible with it, the cold touch that is produced by the object that is the cause of the body’s chill.

original: 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: This is also accepted.

original: des na ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dag 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, “The reason is incompatible with the property of the position.”

original: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgyu ni gzhan dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu nye bar 'jog pas 'gal zla cig shos zlog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu ni gzhan dang 'gal ba'i 'bras bu nye bar 'jog pas 'gal zla cig shos zlog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The cause does not stop the other, which is incompatible with the effect, by positing the effect that is incompatible with it.

original: 'on kyang 'gal zla'i rgyu gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa nyid kyis zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gal zla'i rgyu gang yin pa de zlog par byed pa nyid kyis zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: However, the cause of the opposite is the opposite itself, because it is the reversal of that.

original: 'di dper brjod pas ston par byed pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos can bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dper brjod pas ston par byed pa ni 'di la zhes bya ba ni chos can bstan pa'o //
translated: He shows this by an example: “Here” indicates the subject.

original: sbu langs zhes bya ba ni gyen du langs ba'o //
analyzed: sbu langs zhes bya ba ni gyen du langs ba'o //
translated: “Hairs standing on end” means standing up.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni so tag tag byed pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni so tag tag byed pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes horripilation and so on.

original: de dag nyid dga' ba dang dad pa la sogs pas byas pa dag las khyad par du 'gyur bas bye brag go //
analyzed: de dag nyid dga' ba dang dad pa la sogs pas byas pa dag las khyad par du 'gyur bas bye brag go //
translated: They are “distinctive” because they are produced by joy, faith, and so on, and they are different from those.

original: med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
translated: “There is none” indicates the conclusion.

original: skyes bu gang la gdung bar byed pa'i bya brag nye bar te /
analyzed: skyes bu gang la gdung bar byed pa'i bya brag nye bar te /
translated: “The distinctive activity of a person” is the distinctive activity of a person.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir ro //
translated: “Because” indicates the reason.

original: gdung bar byed pa'i bya brag mngon sum du gyur pa las grang ba'i reg pa ldog par dpog la /
analyzed: gdung bar byed pa'i bya brag mngon sum du gyur pa las grang ba'i reg pa ldog par dpog la /
translated: From the direct perception of the distinctive activity of a person, the reversal of cold touch is inferred.

original: des na de'i 'bras bu yang ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i 'bras bu yang ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, its effect is also reversed.

original: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang grang ba'i reg pa dang de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang grang ba'i reg pa dang de'i 'bras bu mi dmigs pa la bya ba yin no //
translated: This syllogism proving the nonexistence of an entity is to be applied to the nonobservation of cold contact and its effect.

original: gal te me mthong ba las yongs su gdung ba dpag pas na /
analyzed: gal te me mthong ba las yongs su gdung ba dpag pas na /
translated: If you infer the existence of heat from seeing fire,

original: yongs su gdung ba dang 'gal ba spu langs pa la sogs pa ldog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba dang 'gal ba spu langs pa la sogs pa ldog pa ma yin nam /
translated: then why is the absence of goose bumps and so on, which are incompatible with heat, not inferred?

original: 'gal ba dag gi rgyu gang yin pa de dag 'gal na zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na /🔽bshad pa / spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'gal ba yongs su gdung ba lus dros pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: 'gal ba dag gi rgyu gang yin pa de dag 'gal na zhes ci'i phyir brjod ce na / bshad pa / spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang 'gal ba yongs su gdung ba lus dros pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Why do you say, “When there is a cause of incompatible things, if one of them is seen, the other is negated”?🔽The incompatible state of goose bumps and so on is the state of a body that is hot.

original: dros pa'i gnas skabs des ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag zlog pa yin no //
analyzed: dros pa'i gnas skabs des ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag zlog pa yin no //
translated: That state of heat negates the state of goose bumps and so on.

original: yongs su gdung ba de'i rgyu me yin la /
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba de'i rgyu me yin la /
translated: The cause of heat is fire.

original: nges ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba'i rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: But the cause of the incompatible state of goose bumps and so on is cold contact.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang yongs su gdung ba'i gnas skabs dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag dang yongs su gdung ba'i gnas skabs dag ni phan tshun 'gal ba yin no //
translated: The specific states of horripilation, etc., and the state of being heated are mutually exclusive.

original: me mthong ba las kyang yongs su gdung ba'i gnas skabs rjes su @214b dpag pa na spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: me mthong ba las kyang yongs su gdung ba'i gnas skabs rjes su @214b dpag pa na spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: And even when the state of being heated is inferred from the perception of fire, horripilation, etc., are not reversed.

original: 'on kyang me mthong ba las spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa'i mtshan nyid ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang me mthong ba las spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu grang ba'i reg pa'i mtshan nyid ldog pa yin no //
translated: But from the perception of fire, the cause of horripilation, etc., the characteristic of cold contact is reversed.

original: de smras pa ni grang ba rgyun chad pa dngos po med par rtogs na de'i 'bras bu yang med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de smras pa ni grang ba rgyun chad pa dngos po med par rtogs na de'i 'bras bu yang med par nges pa yin no //
translated: When the cessation of cold is understood as a non-entity, its effect is ascertained as non-existent.

original: sbyor ba gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir 'dis ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: sbyor ba gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i phyir 'dis ni zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate other syllogisms, he says, “By this . . .”

original: 'gal ba des 'bras bu las kyang ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba des 'bras bu las kyang ste /
translated: By that contradiction, from the effect . . .

original: grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba med pa'i 'bras bu du bas med dang 'gal ba grang ba'i reg pa'i 'bras bu spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de med par nges par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa dang 'gal ba med pa'i 'bras bu du bas med dang 'gal ba grang ba'i reg pa'i 'bras bu spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de med par nges par bshad pa yin no //
translated: The effect of smoke, which is not incompatible with the contact of cold, is the bristling of the body-hairs, etc., which is the effect of the contact of cold, which is incompatible with heat.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: du ba las me nges par byas pa na yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: du ba las me nges par byas pa na yongs su gdung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu rjes su dpag pa'i sgo nas /
translated: When fire is ascertained from smoke, the effect of that, which has the characteristic of burning, is inferred.

original: spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa ldog pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The reversal of the bristling of the body-hairs, etc., is not by the route of inference.

original: 'on kyang me nges pa las grang ba'i reg pa ldog cing de las ni de'i 'bras bu ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang me nges pa las grang ba'i reg pa ldog cing de las ni de'i 'bras bu ldog pa yin no //
translated: However, from the ascertainment of fire, the contact of cold is reversed, and from that, its effect is reversed.

original: de'i dper brjod pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dper brjod pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: An example of that is stated in the line, “For example,” and so on.

original: phyogs kyi bye brag 'di ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag sngar bstan pa dang bcas pa de ngang 'brel pa'i me dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi bye brag 'di ni spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag sngar bstan pa dang bcas pa de ngang 'brel pa'i me dang ldan pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bsgrub bya bstan pa'o //
translated: This particular direction is called “hairy” and so on, and it is not related to the fire that has been previously indicated. This is the statement of the probandum.

original: du ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: du ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the existence of smoke.

original: me dang 'brel pa'i du ba khyad par can mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang 'brel pa'i du ba khyad par can mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees the special smoke that is related to fire.

original: dngos po med pa bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang gang du me grang ba'i reg pa dang spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi snang ba der sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa bsgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yang gang du me grang ba'i reg pa dang spu langs zhes byed pa la sogs pa'i khyad par mi snang ba der sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This proof of the nonexistence of a thing should be applied in a place where the heat of fire and the special “hairy” and so on do not appear.

original: gal te skabs su bab pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi las 'di dag tha dad pa ma yin nam zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te skabs su bab pa'i mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa bzhi las 'di dag tha dad pa ma yin nam zhes dogs na /
translated: If one doubts that this is not different from the four kinds of proofs of nonapprehension that are appropriate in this context,

original: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu ma grub pa ma dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba grub pa 'di yang sngar bstan pa'i rgyu ma grub pa ma dmigs pa nyid yin no zhes smras so //
translated: then it is said that this proof of the establishment of the contradictory of that is just the nonapprehension of the nonestablishment of the reason that was previously indicated.

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba 'di dag kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid las 'bras bu med par rtogs par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do //🔽de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba sgra'i byed pa don gzhan sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi sgo nas tha dad pa'i bye brag gis sam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba 'di dag kyang rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid las 'bras bu med par rtogs par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di ni rgyu mi dmigs pa nyid du bshad do // de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pa 'di ni sbyor ba rjod par byed pa zhes bya ba sgra'i byed pa don gzhan sgrub pa dang dgag pa dag gi sgo nas tha dad pa'i bye brag gis sam /
translated: Because these arguments are causes that make one understand the nonexistence of effects due to the nonapprehension of causes, therefore this is explained as the nonapprehension of causes.🔽Therefore, this nonapprehension of appearances is of ten types, distinguished by the different activities of the words that express the arguments, by the different activities of establishing and refuting other objects,

original: de nyid kyi don mi dmigs pa'i bya ba don gzhan sgrub pa dang ; dgag ba'i sgo nas nyes par blangs pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis mi dmigs pa rnam pa bcu yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don mi dmigs pa'i bya ba don gzhan sgrub pa dang ; dgag ba'i sgo nas nyes par blangs pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis mi dmigs pa rnam pa bcu yin te /
translated: and by the different activities of establishing and refuting other objects that are the objects of the nonapprehension of the object itself.

original: skabs su bab pa'i dper brjod kyis rjes su 'brang ste yongs su bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i dper brjod kyis rjes su 'brang ste yongs su bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: They should be enumerated by following the examples given in the appropriate sections.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa las 'khrul pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /🔽'di ltar @215a * //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa las 'khrul pa rtogs pa ma yin nam /🔽'di ltar @215a * //
translated: If the apprehension of error is from the apprehension of a contradictory effect,🔽then how is it that the nonapprehension of a cause is the apprehension of an effect that is contradictory with it?

original: yul gang du du ba mthong ba de nyid du re zhig grang ba'i reg pa bgag pa med na gzhan du 'gog par 'gyur ba lta ci smos so //
analyzed: yul gang du du ba mthong ba de nyid du re zhig grang ba'i reg pa bgag pa med na gzhan du 'gog par 'gyur ba lta ci smos so //
translated: In whatever place one sees smoke, one also sees the absence of cold to the touch; how much more so in other places!

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba 'di ldog par byed pa ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba 'di ldog par byed pa ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then can this syllogism be reversed?

original: bshad pa / 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
analyzed: bshad pa / 'gal 'bras la yang yul dang ni //
translated: Reply: Even with a contradictory effect, there is a place,

original: dus dang / sogs pa smos pas du ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: dus dang / sogs pa smos pas du ba'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: and a time, and so on. The phrase “and so on” includes other specific features of smoke.

original: gang cung zad me la mi 'khrul ba'i chos de gzung ngo //
analyzed: gang cung zad me la mi 'khrul ba'i chos de gzung ngo //
translated: Whatever property is not mistaken with respect to fire is apprehended.

original: de dag la ltos par 'dod de /
analyzed: de dag la ltos par 'dod de /
translated: They are asserted to be dependent.

original: yul gang du gnas pa'i me las gang gi tshe du ba skyes pa der de'i tshe gang ba'i reg pa med par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gang du gnas pa'i me las gang gi tshe du ba skyes pa der de'i tshe gang ba'i reg pa med par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When smoke arises from fire in a particular place, then the absence of cold to the touch is also present there.

original: du ba'i khyad par la yang ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: du ba'i khyad par la yang ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: It is also dependent on the specific features of smoke.

original: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba'i du ba ni grang ba'i reg pa med par nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gtsub shing gtsubs pa las byung ba'i du ba ni grang ba'i reg pa med par nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Smoke that arises from rubbing sticks is not definitely without cold to the touch.

original: grang ba'i rig pa zlog par rung ba'i me med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba'i rig pa zlog par rung ba'i me med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no fire that can stop the awareness of cold.

original: gzhan du na gal te de lta bu'i khyad par mi ltos pa de'i tshe ni rtags 'khrul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te de lta bu'i khyad par mi ltos pa de'i tshe ni rtags 'khrul par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if it did not depend on such a distinction, then the reason would be mistaken.

original: dper na mi grang la grang ba'i reg pa med pa sgrub pa la thal ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi grang la grang ba'i reg pa med pa sgrub pa la thal ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it would be like proving that a person who is not cold does not have the sensation of cold.

original: ci ltar grang ba ldog pa sgrub pa la thal ba nye bar blangs pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ci ltar grang ba ldog pa sgrub pa la thal ba nye bar blangs pa go bar byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the application of the consequence does not make it understood that the proof of the reversal of cold is not correct.

original: 'dir yang yul dang dus la ltos na go bar byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang yul dang dus la ltos na go bar byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Here, too, if one relies on place and time, it is only understood.

original: de ltar na snang du rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa ni go bar byed pa'i tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na snang du rung ba'i yul mi dmigs pa ni go bar byed pa'i tshad ma yin la /
translated: Thus, the non-observation of an object that can appear is a valid cognition that understands.

original: snang du mi rung ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin te ;
analyzed: snang du mi rung ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni dngos po med par nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin te ;
translated: The non-observation of an object that cannot appear does not have the effect of ascertaining the absence of a thing.

original: des na tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: ji ltar tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma ma yin /
translated: How is it not a valid cognition?

original: bshad pa / gang gi phyir bskal pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: bshad pa / gang gi phyir bskal pa rnams la ni /
translated: It is explained: Because in the case of those who are separated,

original: med par nges pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: med par nges pa yod ma yin //
translated: But the non-perception of what is absent is not certain.

original: bskal pa dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bskal pa dang ldan pa rnams la'o //
translated: It is in regard to what is spatially and temporally remote, and to what is naturally imperceptible.

original: de'i phyir na de'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na de'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni nges pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-perception of the object of that is not certain, and so it is not a valid cognition.

original: bskal pa de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: bskal pa de dag kyang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is spatially remote, what is temporally remote, and what is naturally imperceptible?

original: rnam pa gsum zhes smos te /🔽'di dag la bskal pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum zhes smos te / 'di dag la bskal pa yod pa yin no //
translated: The three kinds of remoteness are mentioned.

original: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa gang dag la yod pa de dag dang ldan pa yin no //🔽de dag bskal pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod de /
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa gang dag la yod pa de dag dang ldan pa yin no // de dag bskal pa zhes ci'i phyir brjod de /
translated: That which has remoteness is spatially remote, temporally remote, and naturally imperceptible.🔽What is spatially remote is that which exists in a place other than where one is.

original: gang gi phyir yong pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar yul den gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yong pa gang yin pa de ni gdon mi za bar yul den gnas pa 'ga' zhig gi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: What is temporally remote is that which exists in the past or future.🔽What is naturally imperceptible is that which is not perceived by a certain person, such as the smell and touch of something else.

original: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i sha za yang rigs mthun pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i sha za yang rigs mthun pa dag gis dmigs pa yin no //
translated: What is naturally imperceptible is also perceived by those of the same class, such as the smell and touch of a ghost.

original: dus kyis bskal pa gang yin pa de yang 'das pa ni 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: dus kyis bskal pa gang yin pa de yang 'das pa ni 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa yin la /
translated: What is temporally remote is that which is past, which is perceived by some.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The future is the object.

original: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa na @215b dmigs pa gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston par byed pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa na @215b dmigs pa gang la yod pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: The past and future exist in relation to the object.

original: de ci ltar gang mi dmigs pa de med pa ma yin zhes nges par mi rung /
analyzed: de ci ltar gang mi dmigs pa de med pa ma yin zhes nges par mi rung /
translated: How could it be ascertained that what is not observed does not exist?

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa thams cad ldog pa de ni dngos po med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa thams cad ldog pa de ni dngos po med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, the cessation of all objects is the nonexistence of things.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos te /
translated: To refute this, the root text states, “It is not the case that . . .”

original: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa de ni dngos po med par nges par bya ba 'dir rtags nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa de ni dngos po med par nges par bya ba 'dir rtags nyid ma yin te /
translated: The cessation of all objects is not a valid reason for ascertaining the nonexistence of things.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa las 'ga' zhig kyang dngos po med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir na thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa las 'ga' zhig kyang dngos po med par mi 'grub po //
translated: Because of that reason, the cessation of all objects does not prove the nonexistence of anything.

original: dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa pos rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya zhing gzhan la yang bstan par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni rtogs pa pos rang nyid kyis rtogs par bya zhing gzhan la yang bstan par bya ba yin na /
translated: The nonexistence of things is something that is understood by the person who realizes it and can be taught to others.

original: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ni de rang nyid la grub pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad kyi dmigs pa log pa ni de rang nyid la grub pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The cessation of all objects is not something that is established for that person himself.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it in any other way.

original: de bshad pa ni bdag dang gzhan dag la grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni bdag dang gzhan dag la grub pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is: because there is no establishment for oneself or others.

original: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad ma grub pa de'i phyir pha rol po 'di bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid tshad ma gtan tshigs su byed pa na don spong pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dmigs pa thams cad ma grub pa de'i phyir pha rol po 'di bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pa nyid tshad ma gtan tshigs su byed pa na don spong pa yin no //
translated: Since all non-apprehension is not established, therefore, when the opponent makes the non-apprehension of oneself the reason for the negation of the object, it is a repudiation of the object.

original: ji ltar bltar rung ba'i don la de'i dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du bltar mi rung ba dag la yang yod na /
analyzed: ji ltar bltar rung ba'i don la de'i dmigs pa med pa de bzhin du bltar mi rung ba dag la yang yod na /
translated: Just as the non-apprehension of an object that can be seen is like that, so too it exists for those that cannot be seen.

original: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa nyid du ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag mi dmigs pa'i phyir na med pa nyid du ni brjod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But because they are not apprehended, it is not possible to say that they do not exist.

original: bskal pa der yang yod na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung yang rung ste 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: bskal pa der yang yod na ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung yang rung ste 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: If they exist in that kalpa, then direct perception, inference, and scripture would operate.

original: de'i phyir bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs ba ni tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dang lung log pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi dmigs ba ni tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the non-apprehension that has the nature of the negation of direct perception, inference, and scripture connected to oneself is a valid cognition.

original: gang du gcig log pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du gcig log pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not that the one is negated in the other.🔽Therefore, since the object of that sort is negated, one understands that it does not exist.

original: des na de'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pas dngos po med par rtogs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs ba bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na de'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa log pas dngos po med par rtogs pa yin no zhes gzhan dag dogs ba bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: To dispel the doubt of others, he says:

original: de ni de lta ma yin te yul khyad par can 'ba' zhig la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te yul khyad par can 'ba' zhig la bstan bcos kyi dbang du byas pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is not so, because the treatise does not take as its domain only the special object,

original: byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without activity.

original: gang 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bstan bcos 'jug pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang 'di nyid rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir bstan bcos 'jug pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: In order to explain this very point, he says: The treatise is undertaken in order to liberate those who are bound.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa lhur byed pa ni bstan bcos su brjod la /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa lhur byed pa ni bstan bcos su brjod la /
translated: Thus, a treatise is said to be that which is intent on teaching the human goal.

original: skyes bu'i don yang thabs nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don yang thabs nye bar bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: And the human goal is to be taught by means of the teaching of the means.

original: des na skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas te brjod byar byas nas 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na skyes bu'i don sgrub par byed pa'i thabs 'ga' zhig la brten nas te brjod byar byas nas 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the treatise is undertaken in dependence on, i.e., with reference to, some means of accomplishing the human goal.

original: skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa la mi ltos na ni bstan bcos nyid sma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa la mi ltos na ni bstan bcos nyid sma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not depend on the person's purpose, then the treatise itself would be useless.

original: de ltar ma yin @216a * //🔽na zhes smos te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin @216a * // na zhes smos te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: skyes bu'i don nye bar mi ston na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don nye bar mi ston na'o //
translated: if it did not teach the person's purpose.

original: 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mi mkho ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni nye bar mi mkho ba'i don to //
translated: It would be unrelated means it would have no useful purpose.

original: brjod ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ma 'brel pa'i don smra ba ste /
analyzed: brjod ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun ma 'brel pa'i don smra ba ste /
translated: It would be incoherent means it would express a meaning that is not mutually related.

original: de lta bu ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It would not be a valid means of knowledge means it would not be a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir bstan bcos su skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa de kho na'i phyir na dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan par bya ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang gi phyir bstan bcos su skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa de kho na'i phyir na dngos po thams cad bstan bcos su bstan par bya ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think, Because the treatise teaches the person's purpose, therefore all things should be taught in the treatise,

original: bshad pa / skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa'i skabs der yang don mang po gdon mi za bar kho nar bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te 'ga' zhig ni bstan par mi nus pa dang / 'ga' zhig ni bstan par mi 'os pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa'i skabs der yang don mang po gdon mi za bar kho nar bstan par bya ba ni ma yin te 'ga' zhig ni bstan par mi nus pa dang / 'ga' zhig ni bstan par mi 'os pa dag yin no //
translated: Nāgārjuna responds: Even in the context of teaching the meaning of a person, it is not the case that many meanings must be taught without exception, because some cannot be taught and some should not be taught.

original: re zhig bstan par mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig bstan par mi nus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that some cannot be taught, he says:

original: bshad pa / dper na bdag nyid so so la nges pa bdag nyid dang / bdag nyid la nges pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi 'jug pa rab tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / dper na bdag nyid so so la nges pa bdag nyid dang / bdag nyid la nges pa'i skyes bu rnams kyi sems kyi 'jug pa rab tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: For example, the mental activity of people who are certain about themselves and their own selves cannot be taught.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sems kyi 'jug pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la med pa nye bar bstan par mi nus la /
analyzed: sems kyi 'jug pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la med pa nye bar bstan par mi nus la /
translated: Because mental activity is not shared, it cannot be taught to others.

original: nye bar bstan pa la dgos pa yang ci lang med do //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa la dgos pa yang ci lang med do //
translated: And there is no need to teach it.

original: 'di snyam du rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par gyis de dag bstan par nus pa kho na'o snyam na kha shad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgyu mtshan gyi khyad par gyis de dag bstan par nus pa kho na'o snyam na kha shad pa /
translated: If you think, “They can be taught through specific reasons,” he says:

original: rgyu mtshan nges pa la byung pa ma yin pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nges pa la byung pa ma yin pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa'o //
translated: This is the way in which it is not a reason.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rang gi ngo bos bstan par nus pa ma yin la rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos bstan par nus pa ma yin la rgyu mtshan gyi sgo nas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to demonstrate it by means of its own nature, nor by means of a reason,

original: rgyu mtshan nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no definite reason.

original: nye par bstan pa la dogs pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: nye par bstan pa la dogs pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no doubt about the demonstration of the near, he says:

original: yul dang dus de dag gis chod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus de dag gis chod pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ste /
translated: That which is an entity obstructed by those objects and times.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skabs su zhes bya ba skyes bu'i don nye bar ston ba'i skabs su mi dogs pas na nye bar mkho ba med ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skabs su zhes bya ba skyes bu'i don nye bar ston ba'i skabs su mi dogs pas na nye bar mkho ba med ba yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not necessary to demonstrate the near, since there is no doubt about the occasion of the person’s purpose.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te ;
translated: This is what is being said:

original: / dus kyis chod pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can dag ni skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa'i skabs 'gar yang dgos pa med la /
analyzed: / dus kyis chod pa 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin can dag ni skyes bu'i don nye bar ston pa'i skabs 'gar yang dgos pa med la /
translated: Entities obstructed by time, which are of the nature of the past and future, are not necessary at any time for the demonstration of the person’s purpose.

original: da ltar ba la yang yul gyis chod pa thag ring ba na 'dug pa ni nye bar mkho ba med cing /
analyzed: da ltar ba la yang yul gyis chod pa thag ring ba na 'dug pa ni nye bar mkho ba med cing /
translated: Also, with regard to the present, that which is distant, separated by an intervening object, is not needed.

original: nye ba na 'dug pa kha cig kyang nye bar mi mkho ba yin te ;
analyzed: nye ba na 'dug pa kha cig kyang nye bar mi mkho ba yin te ;
translated: And some things that are near are not needed.

original: des na nye bar mkho ba med ba de dag ni bstan bcos kyi brjod byar byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: des na nye bar mkho ba med ba de dag ni bstan bcos kyi brjod byar byed pa ma yin /
translated: Therefore, those things that are not needed are not the subject matter of the treatise.

original: 'di snyam du gal te lung gis de dag bsdus pa ma yin yang mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te lung gis de dag bsdus pa ma yin yang mngon sum gyis gzung bar bya ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that even though those things are not included in scripture, they are to be apprehended by direct perception, then:

original: de ltar bskal pa dag la ni //
analyzed: de ltar bskal pa dag la ni //
translated: They are separated by eons.

original: zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal pa'o //
translated: They are separated by place, time, and nature.

original: rang gi bdag @216b nyid kyi mthu des nye bar gnas pa nye bar gzhag pa gang la yod ba de ni de skad brjod do //
analyzed: rang gi bdag @216b nyid kyi mthu des nye bar gnas pa nye bar gzhag pa gang la yod ba de ni de skad brjod do //
translated: That which exists as a basis for the power of one’s own nature is called that.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras ba / shes pa skyed pa la nus pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: smras ba / shes pa skyed pa la nus pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is said to be that which is capable of producing consciousness.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: kha cig ni brgyud nas shes pa skyed par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni brgyud nas shes pa skyed par nus pa yin la /
translated: Some are capable of producing consciousness indirectly.

original: kha cig ni dngos su'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni dngos su'o //
translated: Some are direct.

original: de la brgyud pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de la brgyud pa'i nus pa gang yin pa de ni don gzhan nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin te /
translated: The power that is indirect is established in another object,🔽because it is not present in another object.

original: gzhan la ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis nye bar brtags nas nus pa tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis nye bar brtags nas nus pa tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: The power is conventionally designated as present by the non-absence of another.

original: des na gzhan gyi mthus nye bar gnas pa de ni des nye bar gzhag pa'i nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi mthus nye bar gnas pa de ni des nye bar gzhag pa'i nus pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, that which is present by the power of another is the power established by that.

original: bdag nyid kyi mthus nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi mthus nye bar gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not present by its own power.

original: gang la dngos su rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa ni bdag nyid kho na las rnam par gnas pa yin pas rang gi mthus nye bar gnas par tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang la dngos su rnam par shes pa skye ba de'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa ni bdag nyid kho na las rnam par gnas pa yin pas rang gi mthus nye bar gnas par tha snyad du bya ba yin no //
translated: The power that produces consciousness in that which directly produces consciousness is present only in itself, so it is conventionally designated as present by its own power.

original: des na rnam par gcod par bya ba yod pas na /
analyzed: des na rnam par gcod par bya ba yod pas na /
translated: Therefore, since there is something to be excluded,

original: rang gi mthus nye bar gnas pa'i nus pa zhes bstan te /
analyzed: rang gi mthus nye bar gnas pa'i nus pa zhes bstan te /
translated: the power that is present by its own power is taught.

original: de lta ma yin na mthu dang nus pa dag rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir na gcig la sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mthu dang nus pa dag rnam grangs yin pa'i phyir na gcig la sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, since power and ability are synonyms, they would not be applied to one thing.

original: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gang yi pa de ni dbang po nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos su skyed par byed pa'i phyir gzung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gang yi pa de ni dbang po nyams pa med pa'i rnam par shes pa dngos su skyed par byed pa'i phyir gzung ba yin gyi /
translated: The object that is the nature of the apprehended is the apprehended because it directly generates consciousness when the sense faculty is not impaired.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other.

original: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dngos su skyed par byed pa yin yang gzung ba ni ma yin te dbang po bzhin no //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dngos su skyed par byed pa yin yang gzung ba ni ma yin te dbang po bzhin no //
translated: That which is not the nature of the apprehended is not the apprehended even though it directly generates consciousness, like the sense faculty.

original: rab rib la sogs pas dbang po nyams ba las skyes pa la ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa gzhag pa'i phyir skyed bar byed pa yin yang gzung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas dbang po nyams ba las skyes pa la ni phyin ci log gi rnam pa gzhag pa'i phyir skyed bar byed pa yin yang gzung ba ma yin te /
translated: That which is generated from an impaired sense faculty due to cataracts and so on is not the apprehended even though it generates consciousness because it is posited as having an erroneous aspect.

original: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la zla ba gcig gi rang gi rnam pa ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa la zla ba gcig gi rang gi rnam pa ma bzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aspect of one moon is not posited in the consciousness of two moons.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it be the apprehended by another consciousness?

original: rnam par 'jog pa la gags byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'jog pa la gags byed pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for obstructing the determination of the object.

original: don gcig nyid rnam par shes pa 'jog par nus pa dang mi nus pa 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: don gcig nyid rnam par shes pa 'jog par nus pa dang mi nus pa 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is contradictory for the same object to be capable and incapable of producing a consciousness,

original: 'o na ni snang ba yang 'ug pa dang mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa bsgrub pa dang gegs byed pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni snang ba yang 'ug pa dang mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa bsgrub pa dang gegs byed pa 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is contradictory for light to be capable and incapable of producing the eye consciousness of an owl and the eye consciousness of one with healthy eyes.

original: snang ba ni lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba ni lhan cig byed pa yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no contradiction because light is a cooperative condition,

original: yul yang rnam ba dang ldan ba'i rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yul yang rnam ba dang ldan ba'i rnam par shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa yin gyi /
translated: then the object is a cooperative condition for a consciousness that possesses an image,

original: nye bar len pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig la rnam pa gtod kyi thams cad la ma yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig la rnam pa gtod kyi thams cad la ma yin pas skyon med do //
translated: but it is not a substantial cause. Therefore, there is no fault in saying that it directs the image to some but not to all.

original: chod pa dag la ni nus pa de 'dra ba med de /
analyzed: chod pa dag la ni nus pa de 'dra ba med de /
translated: That capacity does not exist for those who are obstructed.

original: des na mngon sum ma yin @217a * //
analyzed: des na mngon sum ma yin @217a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not direct perception.

original: no ; /'di snyam du de dag ni rjes su dpag par rtogs so snyam na gang gis zhes smos so //
